original: gang du yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang du yin zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: de'i phyir sa bon dang khye'u kha 'thon pa rung ba dag gi'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sa bon dang khye'u kha 'thon pa rung ba dag gi'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “of seeds and of a person who is able to speak.”

original: sa bon rung bar ma byas pa dang / khye'u kha 'thon pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa bon rung bar ma byas pa dang / khye'u kha 'thon pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: of seeds that have not been made unfit and of a person who is able to speak.

original: 'dir rtsva la sogs pa skye ba khye'u kha 'thon pa zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir rtsva la sogs pa skye ba khye'u kha 'thon pa zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: Here, the arising of grass, etc. is called “a person who is able to speak.”

original: rung bar ma byas pa zhes smos pas ni rung bar byas pa nyid yod kyang sa bon nyid la ltung ba med ces bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rung bar ma byas pa zhes smos pas ni rung bar byas pa nyid yod kyang sa bon nyid la ltung ba med ces bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The phrase “that have not been made unfit” indicates that even though there is a making fit, there is no offense in regard to the seeds themselves.

original: 'dir ci zhig rjes su bsgrub na de la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa bo nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir ci zhig rjes su bsgrub na de la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa bo nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Here, what is being accomplished that is the most important in regard to the perception of that?

original: de'i phyir tha na rtsa rgyun yan chad nyams par byas na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha na rtsa rgyun yan chad nyams par byas na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “even if one destroys the root of a plant, etc.”

original: yan chad kyi sgras ni mngon par khyab par byas pa'i don la'o //
analyzed: yan chad kyi sgras ni mngon par khyab par byas pa'i don la'o //
translated: The word “etc.” has the meaning of “and so on.”

original: tha na rtsa rgyun gyi yan chad kyi sa bon 'di dag la khye'u kha 'thon pa ste /
analyzed: tha na rtsa rgyun gyi yan chad kyi sa bon 'di dag la khye'u kha 'thon pa ste /
translated: Even if one destroys the root of a plant, etc., these seeds are a person who is able to speak.

original: gang yang rung ba dag la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba dag la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not any other kind of tree.

original: 'dir gzhung ni shing ljon pa'i rtsa rgyun 'byin par byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni shing ljon pa'i rtsa rgyun 'byin par byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here the scripture states: “If one digs up the roots of a tree, there is an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: ji ltar nyams pa dang gcod pa dang rung ba la sogs pa nyid kyis cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar nyams pa dang gcod pa dang rung ba la sogs pa nyid kyis cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the point of discussing decay, cutting, and suitability?

original: de'i phyir ji ltar yang rung ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar yang rung ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “in any way.”

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir sprul pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir sprul pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it says, “even by emanation.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis shing tog rnams sprug cing glog par bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis shing tog rnams sprug cing glog par bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: Here the scripture states: “Venerable! If a monk shakes fruit from a tree and plucks it, what is the offense?”

original: gal te shing tog smin pa dag yin na ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: gal te shing tog smin pa dag yin na ni nyes byas so //
translated: If the fruit is ripe, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ji ste ma smin pa dag yin na ni ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ste ma smin pa dag yin na ni ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If it is unripe, it is a fall into a misdeed.”

original: rtsa ba dang 'dam rdzab dang sa rdul la sogs pa dag gis mnan pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtsa ba dang 'dam rdzab dang sa rdul la sogs pa dag gis mnan pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is also by pressing down with roots, mud, dust, and so on.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis ran nam 'dam rdzab bam sa rdul gyis shing ljon pa nyams par gyur cig / rnam par nyams par gyur cig ces gnon par bgyid cing rtsva sngon po sa rdul lam phye ma'am gzhan gang yang rung bas @187b 'gebs par
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis ran nam 'dam rdzab bam sa rdul gyis shing ljon pa nyams par gyur cig / rnam par nyams par gyur cig ces gnon par bgyid cing rtsva sngon po sa rdul lam phye ma'am gzhan gang yang rung bas @187b 'gebs par
translated: Here the text is: “If a monk, a reverend, presses down a tree, saying, ‘May the tree be ruined! May the tree be destroyed!’ and covers the green grass with dust, dirt, or anything else,

original: bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: what is the offense?”

original: nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “It is an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: 'dir sbyor ba tsam la dgongs nas shing la sogs pa mnan pa la sogs pa la nyes byas kyi tshig go //
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba tsam la dgongs nas shing la sogs pa mnan pa la sogs pa la nyes byas kyi tshig go //
translated: Here, intending just the preparation, the words “wrong conduct” are for pressing down a tree, and so on.

original: 'dir 'dam rdzab kyi tshig gis bzung ba'o //🔽khu tshan la sogs pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dir 'dam rdzab kyi tshig gis bzung ba'o // khu tshan la sogs pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, the words “mud” are to be understood.🔽“And so on” means “and so on up to sap.”

original: khu tshun zhes bya ba ni 'u sha zhes bya ba la sogs pa khu ba tshab gtor ba'o //
analyzed: khu tshun zhes bya ba ni 'u sha zhes bya ba la sogs pa khu ba tshab gtor ba'o //
translated: “Sap” means the sap of trees such as ushira.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'chag pa dang yal ga la sogs pa 'dren pa dang dkyil 'khor dang skyang nul la sogs pa dag kyang bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'chag pa dang yal ga la sogs pa 'dren pa dang dkyil 'khor dang skyang nul la sogs pa dag kyang bsdu'o //
translated: The words “and so on” include such things as walking, branches, and so on, and such things as a maṇḍala and a smooth surface.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis sngo'i phyogs su 'u sha tsha ba 'thor zhing snying po 'thor bar byed na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis sngo'i phyogs su 'u sha tsha ba 'thor zhing snying po 'thor bar byed na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here the text says, “If a bhikṣu scatters the seeds of the śirīṣa tree and scatters the seeds of the śirīṣa tree in the direction of the east, and so on.”

original: rlung dang nyi ma la 'jog pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba la 'dir gzhung ni dge slong ma'i rnam par 'byed pa las dge slong mas sa bon gyi rigs lnga po 'di dag nyams par gyur ces rlung dang nyi ma la 'jog par byed na gal te sa
analyzed: rlung dang nyi ma la 'jog pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba la 'dir gzhung ni dge slong ma'i rnam par 'byed pa las dge slong mas sa bon gyi rigs lnga po 'di dag nyams par gyur ces rlung dang nyi ma la 'jog par byed na gal te sa
translated: “By placing them in the wind and sun” means that here the text from the Bhikṣuṇī Vibhanga says, “If a bhikṣuṇī says, ‘These five types of seeds will be destroyed,’ and places them in the wind and sun,

original: bon rnam par nyams pa ni ltung byed do //
analyzed: bon rnam par nyams pa ni ltung byed do //
translated: if the seeds are destroyed, there is an offense entailing acknowledgment.

original: ji ste rnam par ma nyams na ni nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ste rnam par ma nyams na ni nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If they are not destroyed, there is an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: sa gzhi skam por yang ngo zhes bya ba la 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis sa bon gyi rigs lnga po dag nyams par gyur cig ces sa gzhi skam por 'jog par byed na gal te sa bon nyams na ni lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa gzhi skam por yang ngo zhes bya ba la 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis sa bon gyi rigs lnga po dag nyams par gyur cig ces sa gzhi skam por 'jog par byed na gal te sa bon nyams na ni lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: Also on dry land means that here the text states: If a monk places the five types of seeds on dry land with the thought 'May they perish,' then if the seeds perish, there are five offenses.

original: gal te rnam par ma nyams na ni nyes byas lngar 'gyur zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te rnam par ma nyams na ni nyes byas lngar 'gyur zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If they do not perish, there are five offenses of wrong conduct.

original: bsam pa ji lta bus she na /
analyzed: bsam pa ji lta bus she na /
translated: With what kind of intention?

original: de'i phyir der 'dun pas so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir der 'dun pas so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, With the intention of destroying them.

original: nyams par 'dun pas so //
analyzed: nyams par 'dun pas so //
translated: With the intention of destroying them.

original: ci rang kho nas sam zhe na /
analyzed: ci rang kho nas sam zhe na /
translated: Is it only oneself?

original: de'i phyir rang ngam gzhan gyis kyang rung ngo zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang ngam gzhan gyis kyang rung ngo zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore it says, Either oneself or another.

original: 'dir gnas skabs gang la kha na ma tho ba ji lta bu dag nyams pa la byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir gnas skabs gang la kha na ma tho ba ji lta bu dag nyams pa la byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
translated: At what point in time and with what kind of offense does the agent become one who destroys?

original: de'i phyir nyams par 'gyur zhe na dngos gzhi dag go zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyams par 'gyur zhe na dngos gzhi dag go zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, If they perish, it is the actual basis.

original: nyams par gyur pa ni dngos gzhi'i ltung ba dag kyang 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyams par gyur pa ni dngos gzhi'i ltung ba dag kyang 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that even the downfalls of the actual basis occur.

original: sbyor ba gcig gi dbang gis sa bon mang po dag nyams par byed na ci gcig gam mang po la yin zhe na /
analyzed: sbyor ba gcig gi dbang gis sa bon mang po dag nyams par byed na ci gcig gam mang po la yin zhe na /
translated: If many seeds are destroyed by the power of one preparation, then is it one or many?

original: da'i phyir nyams par bya ba'i grangs dag gi'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: da'i phyir nyams par bya ba'i grangs dag gi'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “By the number of those to be destroyed.”

original: nyams par bya ba 'di rnams la grangs yod pas zhes bya ba 'dir bsdu'o //
analyzed: nyams par bya ba 'di rnams la grangs yod pas zhes bya ba 'dir bsdu'o //
translated: Here, it is included that these are to be destroyed by the number.

original: ji ltar nyams par bya ba dag gi grangs kyis ltung ba rnam par gzhag par bstan cing /🔽sdong po dang yal ga dang 'dab ma las grangs rnam par gzhag par @188a * //
analyzed: ji ltar nyams par bya ba dag gi grangs kyis ltung ba rnam par gzhag par bstan cing / sdong po dang yal ga dang 'dab ma las grangs rnam par gzhag par @188a * //
translated: How are the downfalls established by the number of those to be destroyed?

original: bya 'am zhe na /
analyzed: bya 'am zhe na /
translated: Is it established by the number of trunks, branches, and leaves?

original: de'i phyir sdong bu las so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sdong bu las so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “By the trunk.”

original: sdong bu rtsa ba las shing ljon pa gcod par byed na yang yal ga phra mo dang 'dab ma du ma nyid yod du zin kyang ltung ba gcig kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdong bu rtsa ba las shing ljon pa gcod par byed na yang yal ga phra mo dang 'dab ma du ma nyid yod du zin kyang ltung ba gcig kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: Even if a tree is cut down from the root, if there are many small branches and leaves, there is only one downfall.

original: de bzhin du yal ga dag rang gi sdong bu las bcad pa la yal ga phra mo dang 'dab ma mang po nyid yod pa dang / yal ga phra mo dag rang gi sdong po las bcad pa la 'dab ma mang po nyid yod pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yal ga dag rang gi sdong bu las bcad pa la yal ga phra mo dang 'dab ma mang po nyid yod pa dang / yal ga phra mo dag rang gi sdong po las bcad pa la 'dab ma mang po nyid yod pa dang /
translated: Likewise, if one cuts off a branch from its trunk, there are many small branches and leaves, and if one cuts off the small branches from their trunks, there are many leaves.

original: 'dab ma dag rang gi sdong bu las bcad pa las 'dab ma bdun pa ltar 'dab ma mang bo nyid yod pa dang / ae ran ta'i 'dab ma ltar yal ga mang po nyid yod du zin kyang de lta mod kyi ltung byed gcig kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dab ma dag rang gi sdong bu las bcad pa las 'dab ma bdun pa ltar 'dab ma mang bo nyid yod pa dang / ae ran ta'i 'dab ma ltar yal ga mang po nyid yod du zin kyang de lta mod kyi ltung byed gcig kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: And if one cuts off the leaves from their trunks, there are many leaves, like a seven-leaved tree, and many branches, like the branches of an eranda tree, still it is only one offense of wrong conduct.

original: sdong bu zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'og ma'i cha'i dpe yin te /
analyzed: sdong bu zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'og ma'i cha'i dpe yin te /
translated: Here, the trunk is an example of the lower part.

original: de lta bas na 'dab ma'i yal ga bcad pa dang / lcug ma'i mgo lcogs bcad na yang 'dir dngos gzhi ston pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dab ma'i yal ga bcad pa dang / lcug ma'i mgo lcogs bcad na yang 'dir dngos gzhi ston pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, if one cuts off a branch with leaves or a shoot with buds, here it is the actual basis that is taught.

original: sdong bu'i ngos nas 'dab ma la cung zad brtsegs pa dang / 'dab ma'i rim pa nas cung zad brtsegs pa ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas te /
analyzed: sdong bu'i ngos nas 'dab ma la cung zad brtsegs pa dang / 'dab ma'i rim pa nas cung zad brtsegs pa ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas te /
translated: The fault of preparation is when the leaves are slightly stacked on the trunk or slightly stacked on the layers of leaves.

original: dngos gzhi'i ni ma yin zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i ni ma yin zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The actual basis is not like that.🔽Here, the text states:🔽If a monk cuts down a tree with one preparation, there is one fault and one offense.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis shing ljon pa gcig sbyor ba gcig gis bcad na nyes byas gcig dang ltung byed gcig / dge slong gis shing ljon pa gcig sbyor ba gnyis kyis gcod na nyes byas gnyis dang ltung byed gcig go zhes bya ba la sogs pa
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis shing ljon pa gcig sbyor ba gcig gis bcad na nyes byas gcig dang ltung byed gcig / dge slong gis shing ljon pa gcig sbyor ba gnyis kyis gcod na nyes byas gnyis dang ltung byed gcig go zhes bya ba la sogs pa
translated: If a monk cuts down a tree with two preparations, there are two faults and one offense.

original: gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And so on.🔽This is explained in the sutras for the sake of arising.

original: skye ba'i phyir mdo rnam par bshad nas mdo de nyid las sa bon gyi phyir 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i phyir mdo rnam par bshad nas mdo de nyid las sa bon gyi phyir 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
translated: In that sutra itself, it should be understood in terms of seeds.

original: ji ltar zhe na gang zhig nyams par bya ba'i grangs dag gi'o zhes smos pas gzhan sa bon du gyur pa gang phyogs gcig pa de bas na ma yin zhes smos pa ni sdong bu las zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na gang zhig nyams par bya ba'i grangs dag gi'o zhes smos pas gzhan sa bon du gyur pa gang phyogs gcig pa de bas na ma yin zhes smos pa ni sdong bu las zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: How? He says: “of those that are to be destroyed.” The seed that is a part of something else is not destroyed by the destruction of that other thing. He says: “like the trunk.”

original: sdong bu thams cad la gcig pa nyid mngon par brten pas 'dir gzugs thams cad sdong bu nyid kyis brjod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sdong bu thams cad la gcig pa nyid mngon par brten pas 'dir gzugs thams cad sdong bu nyid kyis brjod par rig par bya ste /
translated: Since the trunk is the support of all the forms, here all the forms are said to be the trunk.

original: rtsa ba dang 'bras bu dag la ni 'di med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtsa ba dang 'bras bu dag la ni 'di med pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the roots and fruits are not included in this.

original: de bas na 'di dag la 'dis ma bsdus pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di dag la 'dis ma bsdus pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not not included in this.

original: gzugs tha dad pa rnams la sbubs dang yal ga dag la 'di gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs tha dad pa rnams la sbubs dang yal ga dag la 'di gnas pa'o //
translated: The different forms are in the branches and leaves.

original: gang zhig tho gu dang rtse mo dag la'o //
analyzed: gang zhig tho gu dang rtse mo dag la'o //
translated: The trunk is in the stem and top.

original: de las byung ba'i 'bras bu rnams la gcig pa nyid du mngon par brten pa la byas pa nyid de phyogs gcig tu gyur pa'i sa bon nyams pas sa @188b bon nyams pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i 'bras bu rnams la gcig pa nyid du mngon par brten pa la byas pa nyid de phyogs gcig tu gyur pa'i sa bon nyams pas sa @188b bon nyams pa ma yin no //
translated: The fruits that arise from it are the support of the one. The seed is not destroyed by the destruction of a part of the seed.

original: de bas na sa bon gyi phyogs gcig nyams pa la yang dngos gzhi ste /
analyzed: de bas na sa bon gyi phyogs gcig nyams pa la yang dngos gzhi ste /
translated: Therefore, even if one part of the seed is damaged, it is the actual basis.

original: thams cad nyams pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad nyams pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: But not all of it is damaged.🔽In preparation, they are wrong actions.

original: sbyor ba la ni nyes byas dag tu'o zhes bya ba ni slar ci zhig nyams par bya ba'i grangs kyis 'di rnams kyis tha dad pa yin nam ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: sbyor ba la ni nyes byas dag tu'o zhes bya ba ni slar ci zhig nyams par bya ba'i grangs kyis 'di rnams kyis tha dad pa yin nam ma yin zhe na /
translated: If one asks whether these are differentiated by the number of things that are damaged or not,

original: de'i phyir 'di la bsnun pa re re las de tha dad pa yin gyi dngos po las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la bsnun pa re re las de tha dad pa yin gyi dngos po las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then in response to that, it says, “They are differentiated by each blow, not by the thing.”

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba la'o //
translated: “In this” refers to preparation.

original: de zhes bya ba ni bsnun pa la'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni bsnun pa la'o //
translated: “That” refers to the blow.

original: bsnun pa re re la de tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: bsnun pa re re la de tha dad pa ste /
translated: It is differentiated by each blow.

original: dngos po tha dad pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not differentiated by the thing.

original: bsnun pa ji snyed pa de kho na nyid kyi sbyor ba dag tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsnun pa ji snyed pa de kho na nyid kyi sbyor ba dag tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there are as many preparations as there are blows.

original: bton na bskyed par bya ba nyid yin du zin kyang mtha' nyid de zhes bya ba ni shing ljon pa la sogs pa rang gi gnas nas bton pa gang yin pa de la mtha' nyid de skyed rung ba'i chos nyid yod du zin kyang nyams pa las skye🔽ba nyid de /
analyzed: bton na bskyed par bya ba nyid yin du zin kyang mtha' nyid de zhes bya ba ni shing ljon pa la sogs pa rang gi gnas nas bton pa gang yin pa de la mtha' nyid de skyed rung ba'i chos nyid yod du zin kyang nyams pa las skye ba nyid de /
translated: If it is extracted, it is produced, but it is not the end. This means that whatever is extracted from its own place, such as a tree, even though it has the nature of being produced, it is produced from destruction.

original: de'i tshe nyams pa las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe nyams pa las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: At that time, it is said that it is produced from destruction.

original: skyer mi rung ba nyid yod kyang sngar gyi rnam pa nyid kyis so sor brjod pa la 'di nye bar ma son par gyur pa dang ro nyid du gyur pa'i bye brag yod de zhes bya ba shes bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: skyer mi rung ba nyid yod kyang sngar gyi rnam pa nyid kyis so sor brjod pa la 'di nye bar ma son par gyur pa dang ro nyid du gyur pa'i bye brag yod de zhes bya ba shes bzhin pa'o //
translated: Even though it is not suitable to be produced, it is individually described in the previous form. It is understood that there is a difference between what has not yet reached this and what has become ashes.

original: skyer rung ba nyid la ni rnyed pa nyid yod du zin kyang ro nyid du gyur ba'i bye brag med do zhes bya ba yin la nges par thim pa yin no //
analyzed: skyer rung ba nyid la ni rnyed pa nyid yod du zin kyang ro nyid du gyur ba'i bye brag med do zhes bya ba yin la nges par thim pa yin no //
translated: Even though suitability for production exists, there is no difference between what has become ashes and what has been obtained, and it is definitely dissolved.

original: de bas na 'dir mdo 'di byas pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir mdo 'di byas pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this sutra was composed here.

original: nya lcibs dang nya tshang dag chu nas bton ba ni de nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nya lcibs dang nya tshang dag chu nas bton ba ni de nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The fish-net and the fish-trap are just as they were before.

original: nya lcibs dang nya tshang dag chu nas bton pa ni de nyid do //
analyzed: nya lcibs dang nya tshang dag chu nas bton pa ni de nyid do //
translated: The fish-net and the fish-trap are just as they were before.

original: chu nas 'di dag la bton pa dang rjes su bzung pa de la de'i tshe na gcod pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chu nas 'di dag la bton pa dang rjes su bzung pa de la de'i tshe na gcod pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When they are taken out of the water, they are called “cut off.”

original: de'i tshe na 'di dag la ro nyid khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe na 'di dag la ro nyid khas blangs pa'o //
translated: At that time, their nature as fish-nets and fish-traps is accepted.

original: gang zhig slar bcug pa dag la de lta nyid du rjes su 'jug pas de yang sa bon nying la rjes su 'jug pa nyid kyis nya lcibs dang nya tshang dag la gang zhigs dang ma 'brel pas chu'i steng du skyes pa de la 'di bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig slar bcug pa dag la de lta nyid du rjes su 'jug pas de yang sa bon nying la rjes su 'jug pa nyid kyis nya lcibs dang nya tshang dag la gang zhigs dang ma 'brel pas chu'i steng du skyes pa de la 'di bshad pa'o //
translated: When they are put back in the water, they function just as before. Therefore, the seed is also accepted as functioning just as before. The fish-net and the fish-trap are produced on the surface of the water without being connected to anything else. This is explained in that context.

original: tshi gu ma bcom bar ril mid byed ba ni phyed nyid do zhes bya ba ni tshi gu ma bcom pa zhes bya ba ni so rnams kyis dum bur ma byas pa la gang zhig ril mid byed pa ni za bar byed pa la phyed ces bya ba'i
analyzed: tshi gu ma bcom bar ril mid byed ba ni phyed nyid do zhes bya ba ni tshi gu ma bcom pa zhes bya ba ni so rnams kyis dum bur ma byas pa la gang zhig ril mid byed pa ni za bar byed pa la phyed ces bya ba'i
translated: If one swallows without breaking the berry, it is half.  Without breaking the berry means without cutting it into pieces with the teeth.  If one swallows means if one eats it.🔽The word half

original: tshig smos pas ni nyes byas yin par go bar byed do //
analyzed: tshig smos pas ni nyes byas yin par go bar byed do //
translated: indicates that it is a minor offense.

original: phyed kyi tshig gis thams cad du ltung ba gcod par gyur pa'i nyes byas ston par byed pa'o //🔽'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis rgya shug gi tshe gu ma bcom par ril mid bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur nyes byas so zhes @189a * //
analyzed: phyed kyi tshig gis thams cad du ltung ba gcod par gyur pa'i nyes byas ston par byed pa'o // 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis rgya shug gi tshe gu ma bcom par ril mid bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur nyes byas so zhes @189a * //
translated: The word half shows that it is a minor offense that is a part of a downfall.

original: gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here the text says, Venerables, if a monk swallows a jujube berry without breaking it, what is his offense? It is a minor offense.

original: 'di ni tshi gum bcom pa ltar nyams par byed pa dang ril mid byed pa zhes bya ba 'di la don byas pa nyid btab pa dag ltar ltor bcug pa la 'dir blos yin gyi nyams pa'i don du gzhag pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don
analyzed: 'di ni tshi gum bcom pa ltar nyams par byed pa dang ril mid byed pa zhes bya ba 'di la don byas pa nyid btab pa dag ltar ltor bcug pa la 'dir blos yin gyi nyams pa'i don du gzhag pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don
translated: This is like the destruction of a eunuch, or like the saying “swallowing a whole one.” Here, the meaning of “destruction” is posited by the mind, not as the meaning of “destruction” itself.

original: to // lto ba dang 'brel par nyams pa la 'dir ltung ba rnam par gzhag par mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: to // lto ba dang 'brel par nyams pa la 'dir ltung ba rnam par gzhag par mi bya ba ste /
translated: The meaning is that falling away in connection with the womb should not be posited as a downfall here.

original: gang la 'dir nyams pa'i blos 'byung bar gyur pa de la dngos gzhi'i ltung ba byung ba kho na yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang la 'dir nyams pa'i blos 'byung bar gyur pa de la dngos gzhi'i ltung ba byung ba kho na yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that when the mind of destruction arises here, that is the actual downfall.

original: gal te 'di bcad par gyur na legs so zhes smras na bton pa'i 'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te 'di bcad par gyur na legs so zhes smras na bton pa'i 'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: If one says, “It would be good if this were cut off,” it is the downfall of expulsion.

original: bton pa'i 'o zhes bya ba ni bton pa'i phyed ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bton pa'i 'o zhes bya ba ni bton pa'i phyed ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The downfall of expulsion is applied to the half-expulsion.

original: legs so zhes bya ba'i brjod pa 'di ni bton pa'i phyed la 'di ltar brjod cing gcod par byed na dngos gzhi'i mtha' can gyi nyes byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: legs so zhes bya ba'i brjod pa 'di ni bton pa'i phyed la 'di ltar brjod cing gcod par byed na dngos gzhi'i mtha' can gyi nyes byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement a fault with a root-like basis, which is made in the middle of the recitation of the Prātimokṣa and is recited as if you say 'good' to this, and so on.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las //
translated: Here is the text of the question:

original: btsun pa dge slong gis 'di skad ces 'dis shing ljon pa 'di gcad par gyur na legs so stes so zhes mchi zhing des 'gums par bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis 'di skad ces 'dis shing ljon pa 'di gcad par gyur na legs so stes so zhes mchi zhing des 'gums par bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Venerable, if a monk says, It would be good if this tree were cut down, and he causes it to be cut down, what is the offense? It is a fault, it is said.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis na ma byas pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'di ni rnam par rol pa tsam yin te byas ba'i ngo bo 'jug pa 'di ma yin zhes bya ba 'dis shes pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis na ma byas pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'di ni rnam par rol pa tsam yin te byas ba'i ngo bo 'jug pa 'di ma yin zhes bya ba 'dis shes pa'o //
translated: By supernormal power, it is not done. This is just a display. This is understood by the statement this is not the engagement of the nature of what is done.🔽Here is the text of the question:

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis rdzu 'phrul gyis shing ljon pa 'gums par bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis rdzu 'phrul gyis shing ljon pa 'gums par bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: Venerable, if a monk causes a tree to be cut down by supernormal power, what is the offense?

original: nye ba 'khor ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Upali, there is no downfall.🔽The idea that a seed is something other than itself is like that.

original: sa bon la sa bon gzhan nyid du 'du shes pa la 'di de dang 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i sa bon la sogs pa la sdong bu'i sa bon nyid du 'du shes pa ni de dang 'dra ba nyid de phyed nyid ni ma
analyzed: sa bon la sa bon gzhan nyid du 'du shes pa la 'di de dang 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i sa bon la sogs pa la sdong bu'i sa bon nyid du 'du shes pa ni de dang 'dra ba nyid de phyed nyid ni ma
translated: The idea that a seed of the stalk is something other than the root seed is like that, but it is not half of it.

original: yin no // 'dir skyon ni mtshungs te srog gcod pa ltar na smad pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yin no // 'dir skyon ni mtshungs te srog gcod pa ltar na smad pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The fault here is the same: it is not a downfall like killing a living being.

original: skye ba la yang cho ga 'di rnam par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: skye ba la yang cho ga 'di rnam par gnas pa yin te /
translated: This rule also applies to birth.

original: de yang 'dir sa bon nyid kyis brjod par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang 'dir sa bon nyid kyis brjod par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: And here the seed is to be understood as the seed of the root.

original: 'dir ni rtsa ba la sogs pa'i sa bon nyid yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni rtsa ba la sogs pa'i sa bon nyid yod pa yin te /
translated: Here the seed of the root and so on exists.

original: de bas na sa bon skye ba dag la yang phan tshun nyid du phyin ci log ste /
analyzed: de bas na sa bon skye ba dag la yang phan tshun nyid du phyin ci log ste /
translated: Therefore, even in the case of the arising of the seed, there is a mutual error.

original: 'di ni dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba ste ma smad pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba ste ma smad pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is a basic downfall, not a minor downfall.

original: shun pa dang phyir dang 'dab ma skya bo dang / me tog kha bye ba dang 'bras bu smin pa rnams ni phyed shi ba nyid du rjes su tha snyad @189b gdags so zhes bya ba ni shun pa dang phri dang 'dab ma skya bo dang me tog kha bye ba dang /🔽'bras bu smin pa dang zhes bya bas bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: shun pa dang phyir dang 'dab ma skya bo dang / me tog kha bye ba dang 'bras bu smin pa rnams ni phyed shi ba nyid du rjes su tha snyad @189b gdags so zhes bya ba ni shun pa dang phri dang 'dab ma skya bo dang me tog kha bye ba dang / 'bras bu smin pa dang zhes bya bas bsdu ba'o //
translated: This is the summary of the bark, the skin, the yellow leaves, the opened flowers, and the ripe fruits.

original: de rnams ni phyed shi ba nyid ces bya ba 'di ltung ba na smad pa nyid de nyes byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams ni phyed shi ba nyid ces bya ba 'di ltung ba na smad pa nyid de nyes byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They are half-dead, and so they are called fallen. This means that when they fall, they are despised, and so they are called faults.

original: 'dir rab tu grags pa la blo ltung ba ni rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'o//
analyzed: 'dir rab tu grags pa la blo ltung ba ni rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'o//
translated: Here, the mind that is well-known as fallen is what is called conventionally designated.

original: 'di rnams la phyed shi ba nyid ni rab tu grags pa kho na nyid de 'dir ston byed kyi rgyu btsal bar bya ba ni ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di las 'di yang dag par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams la phyed shi ba nyid ni rab tu grags pa kho na nyid de 'dir ston byed kyi rgyu btsal bar bya ba ni ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di las 'di yang dag par bstan pa'o //
translated: The half-dead state of these is well-known itself. Here, the cause of teaching should not be sought. This is what is taught by this.

original: de dag gi rtsa bar gyur pa rang bzhin las ma phye ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gang zhig rang bzhin las phye ba bral ba de ni 'og nas shun pa la sogs pa rnams la rtsa bar gyur pa de ni phyed shi ba nyid
analyzed: de dag gi rtsa bar gyur pa rang bzhin las ma phye ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gang zhig rang bzhin las phye ba bral ba de ni 'og nas shun pa la sogs pa rnams la rtsa bar gyur pa de ni phyed shi ba nyid
translated: The root of those is not the trunk that is not distinguished from the nature of the tree.

original: du rjes su tha snyad gdags pa ma yin te /
analyzed: du rjes su tha snyad gdags pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is distinguished from the nature of the tree, that which is separated from it, is not later designated as the root of the bark and so on.

original: de bas na phyogs las 'di rnams sel bar byed pa la dngos gzhi kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽'dir shun pa'i gzhung ni shun pa 'chu bar byed cing snying po dang 'brel ba 'chu bar byed na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na phyogs las 'di rnams sel bar byed pa la dngos gzhi kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to // 'dir shun pa'i gzhung ni shun pa 'chu bar byed cing snying po dang 'brel ba 'chu bar byed na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the trunk alone is the basis for removing these parts.🔽Here, the Vinaya on bark states: If one peels bark and peels the trunk connected to the heartwood, one commits a downfall.

original: snying po dang ma 'brel pa 'chu bar byed na ni nyes byas su 'gyur zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: snying po dang ma 'brel pa 'chu bar byed na ni nyes byas su 'gyur zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: If one peels bark not connected to the heartwood, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: phri dang 'dab ma skya bo dang me tog kha phye ba dang / 'bras bu smin pa rnams la yang 'di nyid rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba thams cad las gsungs so //
analyzed: phri dang 'dab ma skya bo dang me tog kha phye ba dang / 'bras bu smin pa rnams la yang 'di nyid rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba thams cad las gsungs so //
translated: The same is true of the cutting of leaves, the opening of flowers, and the ripening of fruit.

original: 'dab ma dang 'bras bu dag la 'jug pas 'chu ba ni de dag nyid dang lhan cig chos mtshungs pa yin te smin pa rnams kyi ni smin pa nyid yin la ma smin pa rnams kyi ni ma smin pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'dab ma dang 'bras bu dag la 'jug pas 'chu ba ni de dag nyid dang lhan cig chos mtshungs pa yin te smin pa rnams kyi ni smin pa nyid yin la ma smin pa rnams kyi ni ma smin pa nyid yin te /
translated: The cutting of leaves and fruit is the same as the cutting of trees, since they are similar in being leaves and fruit. The cutting of ripe fruit is the same as the cutting of unripe fruit, since they are similar in being fruit.

original: de dag nyid kyi phyogs gcig gyur pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi phyogs gcig gyur pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should understand that the cutting of one part of a tree is the same as the cutting of the whole tree.

original: gang zhig me tog 'chu ba'i ngo bo ni me tog la 'jug pa de la me tog nyid de 'jug par gyur pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig me tog 'chu ba'i ngo bo ni me tog la 'jug pa de la me tog nyid de 'jug par gyur pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: The cutting of a flower is not the same as the cutting of a tree, since they are not similar in being trees.🔽Therefore, the following verse is stated:

original: de bas na 'og nas gang zhig 'di dag la de ni 'di rnams la 'dir 'jug pa 'di brjod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'og nas gang zhig 'di dag la de ni 'di rnams la 'dir 'jug pa 'di brjod par rig par bya'o //
translated: The cutting of leaves, etc., should be understood in the same way as the cutting of trees.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu pa las cig car 'byung ste 'chu ba gcod na nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu pa las cig car 'byung ste 'chu ba gcod na nyes byas so //
translated: The text of the Vinaya states that cutting the leaves of a tree is a minor offense.

original: pha bong gi dreg pa 'chu na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: pha bong gi dreg pa 'chu na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If he breaks off a piece of rock, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽Here, the term “breaks off” should be understood to include the breaking off of a lotus and so on, as well as the breaking off of a leaf.🔽Here, the term “piece of rock” should be understood to mean a piece of stone, not a piece of excrement.

original: 'dir 'chu ba zhes bya ba'i sgras ni autpa la la sogs pa kha bye ba'i 'chu ba dang / 'dab ma'i 'chu ba bsdus pa rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'chu ba zhes bya ba'i sgras ni autpa la la sogs pa kha bye ba'i 'chu ba dang / 'dab ma'i 'chu ba bsdus pa rig par bya'o //
translated: If the seed element has been planted, but the root has not yet arisen, it is half-grown.🔽The seed element has been planted, but the root has not yet arisen.

original: 'dir pha bong gi dreg pa zhes bya ba ni rdo'i dreg pa yin par rig par bya'i sru sru ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir pha bong gi dreg pa zhes bya ba ni rdo'i dreg pa yin par rig par bya'i sru sru ni ma yin no //
translated: This is what is meant by “here” in the verse.🔽If the seed element has been planted, but the root has not yet arisen, it is half-grown.🔽This is what is meant by “here” in the verse.

analyzed: sa bon gyi khams btab pa rtsa ba ma skyes pa ni phyed skyed pa nyid du'o zhes bya ba ni sa @190a * //

analyzed: bon gyi khams btab pa la da dung rtsa ba ma skyes pa nyid du rjes su tha snyad gdags te /
translated: If the seed element has been planted, but the root has not yet arisen, it is half-grown.

original: de la ni 'dir nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la ni 'dir nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is what is meant by “here” in the verse.🔽If the seed element has been planted, but the root has not yet arisen, it is half-grown.🔽This is what is meant by “here” in the verse.🔽If the seed element has been planted, but the root has not yet arisen, it is half-grown.🔽This is what is meant by “here” in the verse.

analyzed: sa 'bus pa dang sha mo dang sha ba la snod dang gos la sogs pa'i rlam rnams ni phyed skyes pa nyid du'o zhes bya ba ni rjes su tha snyad gdags so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If the seed element has been planted, but the root has not yet arisen, it is half-grown.🔽This is what is meant by “here” in the verse.🔽If the seed element has been planted, but the

original: snod dang gos la sogs pa rnams kyi rlam gyi sgra dang 'brel pa yin gyi /
analyzed: snod dang gos la sogs pa rnams kyi rlam gyi sgra dang 'brel pa yin gyi /
translated: The sound of vessels, clothing, etc. is related to the sound of the wind,

original: snga ma rnams kyis kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: snga ma rnams kyis kyang ma yin no //
translated: but not to the sound of the previous ones.

original: 'u sha'i khu tshan la sogs pa dbo ba dang 'chag pa dang yal ga la sogs pa 'dren pa dang / dkyil 'khor dang skyang nul dag la de dag gi bsam pa nyid la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni dbo bal sogs pa'i bsam pa nyid la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'u sha'i khu tshan la sogs pa dbo ba dang 'chag pa dang yal ga la sogs pa 'dren pa dang / dkyil 'khor dang skyang nul dag la de dag gi bsam pa nyid la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni dbo bal sogs pa'i bsam pa nyid la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: There is no offense for those who are sick, who are bringing water, who are walking, who are bringing branches, etc., and who are sweeping and plastering the ground, if they do so with the intention of benefiting the Saṅgha.

original: ma nyams pa'i 'dun pas ltung ba med pa nyid de na smad pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i don du mdo 'di yin no //
analyzed: ma nyams pa'i 'dun pas ltung ba med pa nyid de na smad pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i don du mdo 'di yin no //
translated: This sūtra is for the purpose of teaching that there is no offense for those who do not have the intention to destroy.

original: rten nyid kyis yin te de bas na 'dir ltos pas bsreg par bya ba dang 'thag par bya ba nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dir ltung ba med par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rten nyid kyis yin te de bas na 'dir ltos pas bsreg par bya ba dang 'thag par bya ba nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dir ltung ba med par shes pa'o //
translated: It is by the very fact of being a basis. Therefore, here it is understood that there is no offense by the very fact of being a basis, not by the fact of being what is to be burned or what is to be woven.

original: phongs pa'i tshe rtsva ku sha la sogs pas bcings pa des mi thar na bcad na yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phongs pa'i tshe rtsva ku sha la sogs pas bcings pa des mi thar na bcad na yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: If one is in distress, there is no offense if one cuts the kuśa grass, etc., with which one is bound, but not if one is not bound by it.

original: yang gi sgras ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba 'di'i rjes snyegs pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba 'di'i rjes snyegs pa'i don du'o //
translated: The word “also” is for the purpose of including the following statement: “There is no offense if one cuts.”

original: rtsva ku sha la sogs pas zhes bya ba ni 'dir gzhung ni sil bu dag las gleng gzhi'i dbang gis rtsva ku sha rnams nyid la 'di gsungs te /
analyzed: rtsva ku sha la sogs pas zhes bya ba ni 'dir gzhung ni sil bu dag las gleng gzhi'i dbang gis rtsva ku sha rnams nyid la 'di gsungs te /
translated: “Kuśa grass, etc.” means that the text is scattered here and there, and that this is stated in the nidāna according to the kuśa grass.

original: sems can gyi grangs las gzhan thams cad la gcod par byed pa la rnam par gzhag pa bya ba ni sogs pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: sems can gyi grangs las gzhan thams cad la gcod par byed pa la rnam par gzhag pa bya ba ni sogs pa'i tshig go //
translated: The word “etc.” is used to establish that all other sentient beings are to be cut.

original: phongs pa'i tshe na zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs thob pa yod pa la'o //
analyzed: phongs pa'i tshe na zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs thob pa yod pa la'o //
translated: “If one is in distress” means if one has attained a state of affliction.

original: 'dir gang gis gcod na rjes su bsgrub par gyur pa la ltung ba med do zhes na /
analyzed: 'dir gang gis gcod na rjes su bsgrub par gyur pa la ltung ba med do zhes na /
translated: Here, if one cuts with the thought “I will not be bound,” there is no offense.

original: de'i phyir bcings pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcings pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “if one is bound.”

original: gang gis bcings pa zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis bcings pa zhe na /
translated: By what is one bound?

original: des zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: des zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, “by that.”

original: gang la gcod pa 'di bshad pa rdzas gang nyid kyis bcings pa rdzas de nyid brjod pa la ltung ba 'di med pa yin gyi gnas skabs thams cad du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang la gcod pa 'di bshad pa rdzas gang nyid kyis bcings pa rdzas de nyid brjod pa la ltung ba 'di med pa yin gyi gnas skabs thams cad du ni ma yin te /
translated: This explanation of cutting is not a downfall for one who is bound by a substance and expresses that very substance, but not in all circumstances.

original: 'on kyang mi thar na bdag gam gzhan la 'gro ba po med pas so //
analyzed: 'on kyang mi thar na bdag gam gzhan la 'gro ba po med pas so //
translated: But if one is not liberated, then there is no goer, either self or other.

original: du ma nyid yin na de las gcig gis so zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mi thar na cho ga 'di yin pa de bas na du ma nyid du bcings pa la de gcig gis gcad par bya'i gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: du ma nyid yin na de las gcig gis so zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mi thar na cho ga 'di yin pa de bas na du ma nyid du bcings pa la de gcig gis gcad par bya'i gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: If there are many, then by one of them. Since one is not liberated, this is the rite. Therefore, in the case of being bound by many, one is cut by one of them, not by another.

original: sa bon gyi chos med @190b ba ni nyes pa byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ma sbas pa nyid kyi phyir 'di la ltung bar byas pa nyid ni gang gis sams pa de'i don du sa bon gyi chos med pa nyid 'di rung ba lnga🔽po rnams gsungs pa gang yin pa de'i bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: sa bon gyi chos med @190b ba ni nyes pa byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ma sbas pa nyid kyi phyir 'di la ltung bar byas pa nyid ni gang gis sams pa de'i don du sa bon gyi chos med pa nyid 'di rung ba lnga🔽po rnams gsungs pa gang yin pa de'i bsdu ba'o //
translated: The absence of the seed-dharma is not a fault. This is the inclusion of those five that are suitable for this, since the downfall is made by the absence of concealment.

original: byin len ma byas pa'i kha zas kyi ltung ba dang 'brel pa las 'di dang po'i rung ba zhes bya ba don 'dir phran tshegs rnams las sa bon med pa nyid 'brel pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa blangs pa zhes bya ba'i mthar thug par grangs
analyzed: byin len ma byas pa'i kha zas kyi ltung ba dang 'brel pa las 'di dang po'i rung ba zhes bya ba don 'dir phran tshegs rnams las sa bon med pa nyid 'brel pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa blangs pa zhes bya ba'i mthar thug par grangs
translated: The first of these is called “proper” in the context of the downfall related to eating food that has not been offered and accepted.🔽The section on medicine lists “what is counted as real” and so forth up to “arising of existence.”

original: so // sman gyi gzhi las yang dag pa nyid du grangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa srid pa ldang ba zhes bya ba'i mthar thug par grangs pa dang / sman gyi gzhi zhu ba las byas pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa bza' bar bya zhes bya ba'i mthar thug par grangs pa dang /
analyzed: so // sman gyi gzhi las yang dag pa nyid du grangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa srid pa ldang ba zhes bya ba'i mthar thug par grangs pa dang / sman gyi gzhi zhu ba las byas pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa bza' bar bya zhes bya ba'i mthar thug par grangs pa dang /
translated: The section on requesting medicine lists “what is prepared” and so forth up to “one should eat.”

original: phran tshegs la sogs pa las tha mi dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya bar grangs so //
analyzed: phran tshegs la sogs pa las tha mi dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya bar grangs so //
translated: The minor downfalls are not listed separately.

original: mes reg pa dang mtshon dang sen mo dang ne tso dag gis rma phyung ba dang rnyings pa dang phyung ba dang bkrum pa dang bkas pa dang bcas pa lta bu dag ni rung ba'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan rnams kyis rma phyung ba ni rma phyung ba
analyzed: mes reg pa dang mtshon dang sen mo dang ne tso dag gis rma phyung ba dang rnyings pa dang phyung ba dang bkrum pa dang bkas pa dang bcas pa lta bu dag ni rung ba'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan rnams kyis rma phyung ba ni rma phyung ba
translated: Those that are suitable are those that are wounded by fire, weapons, nails, or parrots, and those that are old, cut, washed, or broken.

original: ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: Those wounded by others are not not wounded.

original: de bas na mtshon la sogs pas brgyab pa ni 'dir dper rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na mtshon la sogs pas brgyab pa ni 'dir dper rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, being struck by weapons and so on should be understood as an example here.

original: de las gzhan pa rma byung ba ma yin pa ni shing tog la sogs pa la sen mo dang ne tsos rma phyung pa ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa rma byung ba ma yin pa ni shing tog la sogs pa la sen mo dang ne tsos rma phyung pa ste /
translated: Those other than that, which are not wounded, are those wounded by nails and parrots on fruits and so on.

original: grags pa nyid kyi phyir dang brtsal bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang grags par bya dka' ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ma byas pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'di rnams la dpe nyid kyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: grags pa nyid kyi phyir dang brtsal bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir dang grags par bya dka' ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ma byas pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'di rnams la dpe nyid kyis bstan pa'o //
translated: Because they are well-known, because they are not to be sought, and because they are not difficult to make known, these are taught by analogy just as they are, without being fabricated.

original: phyung ba zhes bya ba ni phyung ba ste /
analyzed: phyung ba zhes bya ba ni phyung ba ste /
translated: What is called cut is cut.

original: 'dir de ni brtags pa gzhan gyis rung bar bya ba la ltos mi dges te /
analyzed: 'dir de ni brtags pa gzhan gyis rung bar bya ba la ltos mi dges te /
translated: Here, it is not necessary to rely on another examination for suitability.

original: phyung ba nyid kho na 'dir rung bar byas pas nyid ces bya ba 'dir rtogs par bya'o //🔽'di bkrum par byed pa ni bkrum pa'i tshig gis bzung ngo //
analyzed: phyung ba nyid kho na 'dir rung bar byas pas nyid ces bya ba 'dir rtogs par bya'o // 'di bkrum par byed pa ni bkrum pa'i tshig gis bzung ngo //
translated: Just the removal is taken as the suitability here. The word “just” should be understood here.🔽The word “cut” is taken as the word “cut off.”

original: bkas pa ste zhes bya ba ni gas par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: bkas pa ste zhes bya ba ni gas par gyur pa ste /
translated: “Cut off” means broken.

original: rang gas pa nyid gang yin pa de ni rung ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gas pa nyid gang yin pa de ni rung ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: Whatever is broken by itself is not suitable,

original: rnam par mi 'gyur bar gyur pa nyid gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi 'gyur bar gyur pa nyid gyi phyir ro //
translated: because it has become deformed.

original: bcad pa zhes bya ba ni brngas pa ste /
analyzed: bcad pa zhes bya ba ni brngas pa ste /
translated: “Cut” means cut with a knife.

original: gnas las bsal ba'i don du gcod pa gang yin pa 'di ni de'i don to //
analyzed: gnas las bsal ba'i don du gcod pa gang yin pa 'di ni de'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is cut for the purpose of removing it from its place.

original: bza' ba'i don du 'thad pa byas pa nyid la rma byung ba ni 'di yin te /🔽de ni sngar bzung ba ste /
analyzed: bza' ba'i don du 'thad pa byas pa nyid la rma byung ba ni 'di yin te / de ni sngar bzung ba ste /
translated: The meaning is that it is cut for the purpose of eating.🔽It is taken as suitable just for that purpose.🔽The word “not” is for the purpose of excluding that.

original: de lta bur gyur pa ma yin pa zhes bya bar gang gis bsam pa de'i don du tshig 'di'o //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa ma yin pa zhes bya bar gang gis bsam pa de'i don du tshig 'di'o //
translated: The meaning is that it is not suitable for that purpose.

original: yin pa nyid du gyur gyi bar du ltos par bya ba mi dgos pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni rung bar byed pa na ji srid du sa bon ma yin pa nyid du gyur gyi bar de srid du 'di la ltos pa 'di mi bya zhes bya🔽ba'i don to //
analyzed: yin pa nyid du gyur gyi bar du ltos par bya ba mi dgos pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni rung bar byed pa na ji srid du sa bon ma yin pa nyid du gyur gyi bar de srid du 'di la ltos pa 'di mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that until it becomes non-seed, it should not rely on this.

original: de reg pa'i me zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsal ba'i don nyid shes pa yin te de bas na mdo 'di byas so //
analyzed: de reg pa'i me zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsal ba'i don nyid shes pa yin te de bas na mdo 'di byas so //
translated: The meaning of this is understood by the refutation beginning with “The steam is not fire.” Therefore, this sūtra was composed.

original: 'di la rlangs pa ni me ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di la rlangs pa ni me ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, steam is not fire.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni rung ba la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni rung ba la'o //
translated: “Here” means in the case of steam.

original: rlangs pa ni me kho na nyid de rlangs pas kyang mes reg pa la rung ba nyid skyes pa zhes bya ba de'i 'di byed pa'o //
analyzed: rlangs pa ni me kho na nyid de rlangs pas kyang mes reg pa la rung ba nyid skyes pa zhes bya ba de'i 'di byed pa'o //
translated: Steam is just fire. Steam is produced by the contact of fire. This is its function.

original: 'dir mdo de gnyis kyi gzhung ni dge slong dag sa bon gyi rigs ma tshos pa zhes bya ba yod pas de'i phyir rlangs pas brlan pa de bza' bar rjes su gnang gis 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir mdo de gnyis kyi gzhung ni dge slong dag sa bon gyi rigs ma tshos pa zhes bya ba yod pas de'i phyir rlangs pas brlan pa de bza' bar rjes su gnang gis 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text of those two sūtras is: “Monks, since there is a type of seed that is not cooked, therefore, I allow you to eat it when it is moist with steam. Do not regret it.”

original: 'bras bu dag mes rung bar bya ba la spyi'i tsho mas ni gtso cher bya ba la 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag rgun 'brum mes spyir re re nas rung bar byed pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu dag mes rung bar bya ba la spyi'i tsho mas ni gtso cher bya ba la 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag rgun 'brum mes spyir re re nas rung bar byed pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In the case of fruits, cooking is done in general. Here, the text says: “Monks, since grapes are cooked in general, one by one, they are fit to be eaten.”

original: 'dir spyi'i ngo bo gtso bor byed pa'i yang dag pa nyid kyi grangs dang ldan pa ste spyi la rung ba nyid yin par snang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir spyi'i ngo bo gtso bor byed pa'i yang dag pa nyid kyi grangs dang ldan pa ste spyi la rung ba nyid yin par snang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Here, the number of real entities is made primary in terms of general nature. It appears that fitness is in general.

original: phyogs gcig nas ni phyi'i rung bar mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni rung ba dag byas pa zhes bya ba rung ba 'di la'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig nas ni phyi'i rung bar mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni rung ba dag byas pa zhes bya ba rung ba 'di la'o //
translated: It is said that fitness does not arise from one part, that is, from the act of cooking. This is because fitness is for this.

original: de bas na spyi la ngos thams cad la mes reg par rigs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na spyi la ngos thams cad la mes reg par rigs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is called “the principle of touching fire on all sides.”

original: phyogs gnyis sam gsum rnams su reg par bya'o zhes gsungs pa de bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis sam gsum rnams su reg par bya'o zhes gsungs pa de bsdus pa yin no //
translated: It is included in the statement, “One should touch the two or three sides.”

original: dge slong gis rung ba dag byas pa nyid ni byas pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge slong gis rung ba dag byas pa nyid ni byas pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: “A monk should make them suitable to eat.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa re zhig de dag gis zhugs kyis sa ma sen mos sam mtshon gyis sa bon gyi rigs lnga po dag rung bar bgyid na rung bar pa gyis pa zhes bgyi 'am /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa re zhig de dag gis zhugs kyis sa ma sen mos sam mtshon gyis sa bon gyi rigs lnga po dag rung bar bgyid na rung bar pa gyis pa zhes bgyi 'am /
translated: Here is the text: “Venerable, if they make the five types of seeds suitable to eat by heating them with fire, cutting them with a knife, or crushing them with nails, are they then said to be made suitable to eat?”

original: nye ba 'khor rung bar byas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor rung bar byas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: “Upāli, they are said to be made suitable to eat.

original: nye ba 'khor mes rung bar byas pa ma gtogs pa lhag ma rnams ni bzar rung ste bza' bar bya ba dag yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor mes rung bar byas pa ma gtogs pa lhag ma rnams ni bzar rung ste bza' bar bya ba dag yin no //
translated: Upāli, except for making them suitable to eat with fire, the remaining ones are suitable to eat, they are things to be eaten.

original: gang rung bar byed na sa bon gyi tshogs 'joms pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang rung bar byed na sa bon gyi tshogs 'joms pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one makes them suitable to eat, it is a downfall that destroys the collection of seeds.”

original: nyams par gyur pa'i rung ba'i dbang du byas nas gang rung bar byed na zhes bya ba'i tshig rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyams par gyur pa'i rung ba'i dbang du byas nas gang rung bar byed na zhes bya ba'i tshig rig par bya'o //
translated: The phrase if one makes it suitable should be understood in terms of what is suitable for a consecrated fire pit.

original: gang 'dir nye ba 'khor mes rung bar byas pa ma gtogs pa zhes gsungs pa des ni mer rung bar bya ba ma gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang 'dir nye ba 'khor mes rung bar byas pa ma gtogs pa zhes gsungs pa des ni mer rung bar bya ba ma gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The phrase except for what is consecrated by fire, indicates that it is not consecrated by fire.

original: 'tshed @191b pa ma yin no zhes bya ba mdo 'dis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'tshed @191b pa ma yin no zhes bya ba mdo 'dis rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood from the sutra that states, it is not cooked.

original: dge slong gis btsos pa'i dbang du byas pa 'dir bza' bar bya ba nyid la rgyu rnam par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: dge slong gis btsos pa'i dbang du byas pa 'dir bza' bar bya ba nyid la rgyu rnam par gnas pa yin te /
translated: In this context, the phrase what is cooked by a monk refers to what should be eaten, and the reason is stated:

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba don 'di mdor byas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba don 'di mdor byas pa'o //
translated: It is not the case for others. This is the meaning summarized in the sutra.

original: sa rung ba ma yin par yang ngo zhes bya ba ni rung ba rnams kyis byas pa nyid ni byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: sa rung ba ma yin par yang ngo zhes bya ba ni rung ba rnams kyis byas pa nyid ni byas pa nyid do //
translated: It is also not suitable on unsuitable ground means that what is done on suitable ground is indeed done.

original: zhag bdun pa dang 'tsho ba'i bar bcang ba chu grang mos ma gtor bar bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhag bdun pa dang 'tsho ba'i bar bcang ba chu grang mos ma gtor bar bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not eat the seven-day medicine and life-prolonging medicine without sprinkling cold water on them.

original: der rung bar bya ba dang 'brel pa yin pas 'de'i tshig byas pa'o //
analyzed: der rung bar bya ba dang 'brel pa yin pas 'de'i tshig byas pa'o //
translated: Since it is related to that which is suitable, it is called the word of that.🔽Here, that which is suitable is not discarded, just as fire and so on are not discarded.

original: rung ba la ni 'dir ma gtor ba nyid ji ltar me la sogs pas de bzhin du 'di la yang gang gi tshe de'i nyes byas nyid la rung ba nyid de bza' ba'i dus nyid la ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rung ba la ni 'dir ma gtor ba nyid ji ltar me la sogs pas de bzhin du 'di la yang gang gi tshe de'i nyes byas nyid la rung ba nyid de bza' ba'i dus nyid la ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that when it is suitable for that nonvirtue, it is the time to eat, but it is not the time to eat when it is not suitable.🔽Here is the text:

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa gang zhig ltung ba brgyad po 'di rnams tso tsa'i 'bras bu las byung ba dang chu shing gi 'bras bu las byung ba dang go las byung ba dang rtsub 'gyur las byung ba dang / rgun dang au du ma b'a ra las byung ba dang n+ya gro dha las byung ba dang khyab gnas las byung ba gang dag lags pa de rnams rtsa ba'i khu ba 'am sdong bu'i khu ba 'am 'dab ma'i khu ba 'am me tog gi khu ba dang bsres
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa gang zhig ltung ba brgyad po 'di rnams tso tsa'i 'bras bu las byung ba dang chu shing gi 'bras bu las byung ba dang go las byung ba dang rtsub 'gyur las byung ba dang / rgun dang au du ma b'a ra las byung ba dang n+ya gro dha las byung ba dang khyab gnas las byung ba gang dag lags pa de rnams rtsa ba'i khu ba 'am sdong bu'i khu ba 'am 'dab ma'i khu ba 'am me tog gi khu ba dang bsres
translated: Venerable, those eight downfalls that arise from the fruit of the mango, the fruit of the plantain, the fruit of the grape, the fruit of the pomegranate, the fruit of the grape, the fruit of the udumbara, the fruit of the banyan, and the fruit of the kīpāka, if they are mixed with the juice of the root, the juice of the trunk, the juice of the leaf, or the juice of the flower,

original: shing 'tshal zhing sbyar na rung ngam /
analyzed: shing 'tshal zhing sbyar na rung ngam /
translated: Is it proper to cook and eat wood?

original: gal te skyur ba dang / myos par mi 'gyur ba dang / mi bska ba dag yin na btung du rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te skyur ba dang / myos par mi 'gyur ba dang / mi bska ba dag yin na btung du rung ngo //
translated: If it is sour, intoxicating, or astringent, it is proper to drink it.

original: de las lhag par chus btab pa dag ni zhag bdun pa 'am 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba dag yin no zhes gsungs pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: de las lhag par chus btab pa dag ni zhag bdun pa 'am 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba dag yin no zhes gsungs pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: If it is more than that, it is to be kept for seven days or as long as one lives, as stated in the passage.

original: thun tshod du rung ba yang de ma thag pa'i mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thun tshod du rung ba yang de ma thag pa'i mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Also, what is proper for one period is not to be done immediately.

original: des zhes bya ba ni chu grang mos so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni chu grang mos so //
translated: In this passage, it refers to cold water.

original: 'di la gzhan gyi dus ma yin pa las ma byas pa la byas pa nyid do //🔽mar bsrub ba'i tshe dang 'bri mar 'tsher ba'i tshe na yang chu grang mos gdab dgos mod gyi /
analyzed: 'di la gzhan gyi dus ma yin pa las ma byas pa la byas pa nyid do // mar bsrub ba'i tshe dang 'bri mar 'tsher ba'i tshe na yang chu grang mos gdab dgos mod gyi /
translated: Here, what is not done at the improper time is considered done.🔽When churning butter and when pressing sesame seeds, one must also sprinkle cold water.

original: 'on kyang mar dang mar nag po dag gis rung bar byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang mar dang mar nag po dag gis rung bar byas pa nyid do //
translated: However, butter and sesame oil are considered proper.

original: kun slong la 'di dgos pas 'di dag grub pa la rung ba 'di la byas pa nyid kyi phyir bu ram yang mes bskol ba na chu grang mos gdab par bya ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: kun slong la 'di dgos pas 'di dag grub pa la rung ba 'di la byas pa nyid kyi phyir bu ram yang mes bskol ba na chu grang mos gdab par bya ba yin mod kyi /
translated: Since this is necessary for the motivation, it is proper to heat molasses with fire and then to pour cold water on it.

original: de'i tshe na chus btab pa des rung bar byas pa nyid du mi chud do //🔽zhag bdun pa la mes rung bar bya ba mi srid de 'dir gzhung ni de la nyams su ma grub pa dang / mngon sum ma yin par thos par 'phya yang rung zhes bya ba 'di'i rjes su snyegs @192a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe na chus btab pa des rung bar byas pa nyid du mi chud do // zhag bdun pa la mes rung bar bya ba mi srid de 'dir gzhung ni de la nyams su ma grub pa dang / mngon sum ma yin par thos par 'phya yang rung zhes bya ba 'di'i rjes su snyegs @192a * //
translated: But at that time, it is not considered that it is made proper by the water that is poured on it.

original: pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not possible to make it proper with fire in seven days, because the text continues, “Even if one were to deny what is well known and what is not directly perceived, it would be improper.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni tshe dang ldan pa nye dga' dang lhan cig tu 'du 'dzi'i gtam gyi phyir 'khod pa na tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor phyogs der song ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni tshe dang ldan pa nye dga' dang lhan cig tu 'du 'dzi'i gtam gyi phyir 'khod pa na tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor phyogs der song ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The text continues, “When the elder Upasena was sitting in a gathering to discuss frivolous matters, the elder Mahakaश्यप went to that place.”

original: gzhogs 'phyas zhes bya ba ni gang gi don du 'phya ba de'i ming nas 'byin pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhogs 'phyas zhes bya ba ni gang gi don du 'phya ba de'i ming nas 'byin pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Slander” means that the name of the one who is being slandered is not mentioned.

original: ltung ba ji lta bu dang kha na ma tho ba ji lta bu la 'dir 'di rnams la byed pa po nyid yin zhe na bgrangs pa la ni dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ltung ba ji lta bu dang kha na ma tho ba ji lta bu la 'dir 'di rnams la byed pa po nyid yin zhe na bgrangs pa la ni dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text states, “The actual basis is for those who are counted, and for others, a misdeed is for those who are not counted.”

original: mngon sum du 'phya ba dang gzhogs 'phyas byed pa 'phangs pa nyid kyis gal te 'di bgrang bar gyur cig 'phya ba dang gzhogs 'phyas byed na de nas gang zag 'di la dngos gzhi'i byed pa po nyid do //
analyzed: mngon sum du 'phya ba dang gzhogs 'phyas byed pa 'phangs pa nyid kyis gal te 'di bgrang bar gyur cig 'phya ba dang gzhogs 'phyas byed na de nas gang zag 'di la dngos gzhi'i byed pa po nyid do //
translated: If one directly ridicules and slanders those who are counted, then this person is the actual basis.

original: ma bgrangs pa la gzhan du nyes byas kyi'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma bgrangs pa la gzhan du nyes byas kyi'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one does not count them, then it is a misdeed.🔽The root text states, “One should not speak to those who cannot tolerate even a little.”

original: cung zad tsam yang dang du len par mi nus pa la ni brjod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni cung zad tsam yang dang du len par mi nus pa'i gang zag la bskul ba dran pa bya ba la sogs pas cung zad tsam yang brjod par mi
analyzed: cung zad tsam yang dang du len par mi nus pa la ni brjod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni cung zad tsam yang dang du len par mi nus pa'i gang zag la bskul ba dran pa bya ba la sogs pas cung zad tsam yang brjod par mi
translated: One should not speak to those who cannot tolerate even a little, by reminding them of their faults and so on.

original: bya'o // gzhan la 'phya ba dang gzhogs 'phyas byed pa'i rnam pas gang zhig brjod pa de 'dir bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: bya'o // gzhan la 'phya ba dang gzhogs 'phyas byed pa'i rnam pas gang zhig brjod pa de 'dir bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The word etc. includes those who speak in a way that is contemptuous and sarcastic.

original: zhe sdang bar gyur pa de rang gis las su bsko bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni cung zad tsam yang dang du len par mi nus pa'i gang zag gang yin pa de zhe sdang par gyur cing mi dga' bar gyur na de dge 'dun gyis las su
analyzed: zhe sdang bar gyur pa de rang gis las su bsko bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni cung zad tsam yang dang du len par mi nus pa'i gang zag gang yin pa de zhe sdang par gyur cing mi dga' bar gyur na de dge 'dun gyis las su
translated: One who is angry should not be appointed to a task means that if a person is unable to tolerate even a little, and becomes angry and displeased, then the Saṅgha should not appoint him to a task.

original: bsko bar mi bya ste brgyud pas ni bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsko bar mi bya ste brgyud pas ni bsko bar bya'o //
translated: But he can be appointed indirectly.

original: 'phya ba'o // gleng bar gtogs ba'i bsgo ba tshig gis rna la gzon pa dang / cang mi smra bas rna la gzon pa dang / gang zag bstan pa rnams la ngor 'phya ba dang / zur gyis gzhogs 'phyas byed pa gsol bar mi bgrang bar mi bya'o zhes pa ni gleng bar gtogs pa'i bsgo pa'i tshig gis rna la gzon pa dang /
analyzed: 'phya ba'o // gleng bar gtogs ba'i bsgo ba tshig gis rna la gzon pa dang / cang mi smra bas rna la gzon pa dang / gang zag bstan pa rnams la ngor 'phya ba dang / zur gyis gzhogs 'phyas byed pa gsol bar mi bgrang bar mi bya'o zhes pa ni gleng bar gtogs pa'i bsgo pa'i tshig gis rna la gzon pa dang /
translated: One should not appoint someone who is contemptuous or sarcastic to a task that involves speaking, whether by speaking oneself or by having someone else speak, or by indicating a person, or by hinting.  Contemptuous means speaking in a way that is contemptuous.🔽Sarcastic means speaking in a way that is sarcastic.  Speaking oneself means speaking oneself.  Having someone else speak means having someone else speak.  Indicating a person means indicating a person.  Hinting means hinting.

original: cang mi smra bas rna la gzon pa dang / gang zag bstan pa rnams la ngor 'phya ba dang zur gyis gzhogs 'phyas byed pa dang zhes bya ba'i bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: cang mi smra bas rna la gzon pa dang / gang zag bstan pa rnams la ngor 'phya ba dang zur gyis gzhogs 'phyas byed pa dang zhes bya ba'i bsdu ba'o //
translated: The silent person is one who is not heard to speak. The disparaging person is one who is contemptuous of the teachings and of persons. The sneering person is one who is sarcastic. The reckoning person is one who is counted among the persons.

original: zas la bsko ba la sogs pa'i gang zag rnams bshad zin to //
analyzed: zas la bsko ba la sogs pa'i gang zag rnams bshad zin to //
translated: The persons who are enumerated in the Sūtra have been explained.

original: da ltar byung ba la 'di ni nges par byed pa ste /🔽bgrang bar bya ba ni nged kyis khyod kyi spyod pa dam pa ma yin pa 'di 'dra bar shes te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba la 'di ni nges par byed pa ste / bgrang bar bya ba ni nged kyis khyod kyi spyod pa dam pa ma yin pa 'di 'dra bar shes te /

analyzed: gleng bar gtogs pa ni tshig tu gyur pa go bar byed pa'o //
translated: The reckoning person is one who is counted among the persons who are doers of what is not proper, because he is known to be a doer of what is not proper.🔽 The reckoning person is one who is counted among the persons who are doers of what is not proper, because he is known to be a doer of what is

analyzed: gleng bar gtogs pa'i bsgo ba gleng ba pos bya ba'i dri ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The one who is reproved is the one who is reproved by the one who reproves, who is engaged in the discussion.

translated: Here, the text says that if a monk takes a little time to accept a bed or seat that is a place for walking, then if he does not gather up that bed or seat that was laid out by the saṅgha or does not have it gathered up, it is a minor offense.

analyzed: gang zag gi gtsug lag khang gi yin la der dge slong gis phyis gnon byas te gnas mal bcas na nyes byas so //

translated: It is not so if it is not to be touched, meaning that if the nature of gold, etc., is not to be touched, then it is not even a minor offense.🔽Here, the text of the sutra states:

analyzed: ma bsdus sam sdud du ma bcug par de nas gzhan du mchi na ltung ba mi 'byung ba 'ga' mchis sam /

analyzed: bka' stsal pa yod de rin po che las byas pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: 'dir reg par bya ba ma yin pa nyid rin po che bzung ba la gtso bo ste /

analyzed: de bas na 'dir gzhan du nye bar btags pa shes par bya ba ma yin no //

translated: When one has set out the requisites for going on alms round,
