original: de'i don la nyes pa med pa dang na smad pa ma yin na zhes bya ba ni bsod snyoms kyi don nyid du zhugs pa de la gnas mal dang 'brel pa'i yongs su rdzogs pa nyid ni kha na ma tho ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i don la nyes pa med pa dang na smad pa ma yin na zhes bya ba ni bsod snyoms kyi don nyid du zhugs pa de la gnas mal dang 'brel pa'i yongs su rdzogs pa nyid ni kha na ma tho ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is that there is no fault or blame in the completion of the bed and alms round.

original: na smad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: na smad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for blame,

original: 'dir gzhung ni bsdu bar bya ba bting ste bsod snyoms la zhugs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bsdu bar bya ba bting ste bsod snyoms la zhugs par mi bya'o //
translated: Here, the text is to be spread out and one should not go for alms.

original: 'jug na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jug na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one goes, one becomes guilty of an offense.

original: gang gi phyir 'gal tshabs can bcas pa'i tshig ni ji ltar brjod pa'i skyon yod pa ston par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gal tshabs can bcas pa'i tshig ni ji ltar brjod pa'i skyon yod pa ston par byed pa ste /
translated: Because the words of the offense show that there is a fault as stated.

original: 'di na smad pa'i rgyu yang yod pa ma yin te gang gi phyir na smad par 'gyur /🔽gal te brjod pas lam ring du 'das sam phyi nas dran pa rnyed na phyin chad de ltar mi bya'o zhes sems bskyed par bya zhing tshig tu brjod par yang bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di na smad pa'i rgyu yang yod pa ma yin te gang gi phyir na smad par 'gyur / gal te brjod pas lam ring du 'das sam phyi nas dran pa rnyed na phyin chad de ltar mi bya'o zhes sems bskyed par bya zhing tshig tu brjod par yang bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, there is no cause for blame, because of what would one be blamed?🔽If one goes far on the road and later regains mindfulness, one should arouse the mind and say the words, “I will not do it again.”

original: gal te lam ring por ma phyin par slar dran pa rnyed na ni phyir log par bya'o zhes bya ba 'dir rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te lam ring por ma phyin par slar dran pa rnyed na ni phyir log par bya'o zhes bya ba 'dir rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: If one does not go far on the road and regains mindfulness, one should return. This is the rule.

original: gal te dge slong lam nas tshur 'ong ba zhig dang phrad par gyur na bsdu ba'i phyir de la bcol bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dge slong lam nas tshur 'ong ba zhig dang phrad par gyur na bsdu ba'i phyir de la bcol bar bya'o //
translated: If a monk comes along the road and meets him, he should entrust it to him in order to gather it in.🔽When he has accepted it, he should do it himself.

original: khas blangs pas son pa nyid na bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni gnas mal gyi gnas su son pa nyid la 'dir ni gnas mal yang dag par bsgrub pa la slar bsdu bar bya zhes bya ba gang zhig gis khas blangs pa de de'i byed pa🔽po nyid do //
analyzed: khas blangs pas son pa nyid na bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni gnas mal gyi gnas su son pa nyid la 'dir ni gnas mal yang dag par bsgrub pa la slar bsdu bar bya zhes bya ba gang zhig gis khas blangs pa de de'i byed pa po nyid do //
translated: This is what he has accepted: “Here, I will gather in the bedding.” He is the one who does it.

original: de'i zhes bya ba 'di ni shugs kyis rnyed par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba 'di ni shugs kyis rnyed par bya ba ste /
translated: “His” is to be understood by implication.

original: de bas na mdor ma byas so //
analyzed: de bas na mdor ma byas so //
translated: Therefore, it is not stated in the verse.

original: 'dir 'di'i gzhung ni gal te dge slong des kyang dge slong de la khas blangs nas gnas mal de bsdu bar mi byed na ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir 'di'i gzhung ni gal te dge slong des kyang dge slong de la khas blangs nas gnas mal de bsdu bar mi byed na ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Here, the text says, “If that monk accepts it from that monk, but does not gather in the bedding, he commits an offense.”

original: tshur 'ong ba zhig la 'di skad smras te /
analyzed: tshur 'ong ba zhig la 'di skad smras te /
translated: He says to the one who is coming,🔽“I will do it.”

original: gzhan du yang 'di'i rjes su 'brengs pas 'di shes pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan du yang 'di'i rjes su 'brengs pas 'di shes pa ste /
translated: He follows after him, and so he knows.

original: rig pa la yang byed pa po la gnas pa la ni ltung ba med de /
analyzed: rig pa la yang byed pa po la gnas pa la ni ltung ba med de /
translated: There is no offense if the monk is staying in a place where there is a danger of being attacked.

original: 'di ni khas blangs pa zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni khas blangs pa zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is meant by “if he has permission.”

original: gnas nas 'phags par 'gyur ba na nyam pa dang phrad par mi 'gyur ba lta na gnas mal bsdu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni @196a * //
analyzed: gnas nas 'phags par 'gyur ba na nyam pa dang phrad par mi 'gyur ba lta na gnas mal bsdu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni @196a * //
translated: “If there is no danger of being attacked, he should gather up the bedding and seats and leave” means

original: bla gab med pa 'am g-yogs pa la yang zhes bya ba bye brag yongs su 'dzin par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bla gab med pa 'am g-yogs pa la yang zhes bya ba bye brag yongs su 'dzin par rtogs pa'o //
translated: that he should do so even if the dwelling is uncovered or covered.

original: 'dir gzhung ni phran tshegs dag las dge slong gis gnas mal bsdus nas 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni phran tshegs dag las dge slong gis gnas mal bsdus nas 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: The scriptures state that a monk should gather up the bedding and seats and leave.

original: mi sdud na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi sdud na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If he does not do so, he commits an offense.

original: nyam nga ba dang phrad par mi 'gyur ba lta na zhes smos pa ni gnas mal sdud par byed pa na mchis pa'i dbang gis gal te na srog gi bar chad la sogs pas 'byung bar dogs pa dang nyam nga ba la gnas pa zhes bya ba 'di'i
analyzed: nyam nga ba dang phrad par mi 'gyur ba lta na zhes smos pa ni gnas mal sdud par byed pa na mchis pa'i dbang gis gal te na srog gi bar chad la sogs pas 'byung bar dogs pa dang nyam nga ba la gnas pa zhes bya ba 'di'i
translated: “If there is no danger of being attacked” means that if a monk is staying in a dwelling and there is a danger of being attacked, he should leave.

original: don du'o // gal te dri ma can du gyur na sprug par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don du'o // gal te dri ma can du gyur na sprug par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it becomes dirty, it should be shaken.

original: 'dir gzhung ni ma mo las dge slong 'gro bar chas pa zhes bya ba nas gnas mal dri ma can du gyur pa na sprug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni ma mo las dge slong 'gro bar chas pa zhes bya ba nas gnas mal dri ma can du gyur pa na sprug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here the text is: A monk who is about to depart... up to... if the bedding becomes dirty, it should be shaken.

original: de dbul bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni nyam nga ba dang phrad par gyur pa'i gnas mal lo //
analyzed: de dbul bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni nyam nga ba dang phrad par gyur pa'i gnas mal lo //
translated: That should be entrusted means bedding that has encountered danger.

original: yang na bcol bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni nyam mi nga bar phrad par mi 'gyur bar lta na zhes bya ba ni rjes su sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na bcol bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni nyam mi nga bar phrad par mi 'gyur bar lta na zhes bya ba ni rjes su sbyar ro //
translated: Or it should be entrusted means if it is seen that danger will not be encountered.

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /
translated: To whom?

original: de'i phyir dge slong la'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong la'o //
translated: Therefore it says: to a monk.

original: med na dge tshul la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: med na dge tshul la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If not, to a novice.

original: dge slong med na dge tshul la de bcol bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong med na dge tshul la de bcol bar bya'o //
translated: If there is no monk, it should be entrusted to a novice.

original: de yang med na khyim bdag la'o zhes bya ba ni dge tshul de yang med na khyim bdag la de bcol bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang med na khyim bdag la'o zhes bya ba ni dge tshul de yang med na khyim bdag la de bcol bar bya'o //
translated: If he also does not exist, to a householder. If that novice also does not exist, it should be entrusted to a householder.

original: thams cad med na phyogs bzhir rnam par bltas te lde mig sbas nas 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bcol bar bya ba thams cad med na'o //
analyzed: thams cad med na phyogs bzhir rnam par bltas te lde mig sbas nas 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bcol bar bya ba thams cad med na'o //
translated: If all of these are absent, he should look around in the four directions, hide the key, and leave.

original: gal te lam khar dge slong mthong na phyogs de de la brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang du lde mig sbas pa'o //
analyzed: gal te lam khar dge slong mthong na phyogs de de la brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang du lde mig sbas pa'o //
translated: If he sees a monk on the road, he should tell him about the place where he hid the key.🔽If he comes to a house where the door is closed because the householder has been invited to a meal elsewhere, he should enter after placing his seat near the wall or a tree.

original: gal te 'ong ba ni khyim gzhan du mgron du bos shing sgo bcad par gyur na rtsig drung ngam shing ljon pa'i drung du stan bzhag ste 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gal te sgo la zhes bya ba 'di la bcad par gyur na zhes bya ba
analyzed: gal te 'ong ba ni khyim gzhan du mgron du bos shing sgo bcad par gyur na rtsig drung ngam shing ljon pa'i drung du stan bzhag ste 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gal te sgo la zhes bya ba 'di la bcad par gyur na zhes bya ba
translated: If the door is closed, he should enter after placing his seat near the wall or a tree.

original: 'di dang 'brel to //
analyzed: 'di dang 'brel to //
translated: This is connected to the phrase “if the door is closed.”

original: 'dir rtsig drung ngam shing ljon pa'i drung du zhes smos pa ni nyi tshan bskyab pa'i dpe tsam du zad do //
analyzed: 'dir rtsig drung ngam shing ljon pa'i drung du zhes smos pa ni nyi tshan bskyab pa'i dpe tsam du zad do //
translated: Here, the mention of “near a wall or a tree” is merely an example for protection from the sun.

original: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba'i yi ge kha cig las rtsig drung ngam shing ljon pa'i drung ngam nyi mas chud zos par mi 'gyur na gzhag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba'i yi ge kha cig las rtsig drung ngam shing ljon pa'i drung ngam nyi mas chud zos par mi 'gyur na gzhag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the text here says, “One should place it where it will not be damaged by rain, sun, or wall or tree.”

original: der stan dag g-yar por sbyin no zhes bya ba la der zhes bya ba ni khyim gyi nang du'o //
analyzed: der stan dag g-yar por sbyin no zhes bya ba la der zhes bya ba ni khyim gyi nang du'o //
translated: “One should borrow a seat there” means in the house.

original: rang gis bskur bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni @196b khyim gyi nang nas dge slong gi gnas mal lo //
analyzed: rang gis bskur bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni @196b khyim gyi nang nas dge slong gi gnas mal lo //
translated: “One should not carry it oneself” means that the monk’s bedding should not be carried from the house.

original: de ni khyim pa dang dge tshul dag gi'o zhes bya ba ni stan bskur ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni khyim pa dang dge tshul dag gi'o zhes bya ba ni stan bskur ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “That is for householders and novices” means that the seat should be carried.

original: med na bskyal ba'i phyir khyim pa la bcol te 'dong bar bya'o zhes bya ba la med na zhes bya ba ni khyim pa dang dge tshul dag go //
analyzed: med na bskyal ba'i phyir khyim pa la bcol te 'dong bar bya'o zhes bya ba la med na zhes bya ba ni khyim pa dang dge tshul dag go //
translated: “If there is none, one should go after entrusting it to a householder for safekeeping” means that if there is no householder or novice, one should go after entrusting it to a householder for safekeeping.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong zan zos nas stan rang gi mchan khung gis blangs te 'gro ba na bram ze dang khyim bdag dag ci 'phags pa dag rol mo ltar 'dong ngam zhes co 'dri bar byed nas /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong zan zos nas stan rang gi mchan khung gis blangs te 'gro ba na bram ze dang khyim bdag dag ci 'phags pa dag rol mo ltar 'dong ngam zhes co 'dri bar byed nas /
translated: When a monk eats food and then leaves, taking his seat with his armpit, brahmins and householders ridicule him, saying, “Do the noble ones go like dancers?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: rang gis stan bskur bar mi bya bar khyim pa dang dge tshul dag gis bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang gis stan bskur bar mi bya bar khyim pa dang dge tshul dag gis bskur bar bya'o //
translated: “One should not take one’s own seat. It should be taken by a layperson or novice monk.

original: gal te khyim pa dang dge tshul dag med par gyur na khyim bdag de nyid la bcol te 'dong bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te khyim pa dang dge tshul dag med par gyur na khyim bdag de nyid la bcol te 'dong bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If there are no laypeople or novice monks, one should leave, entrusting it to the householder himself.”

original: bdag cag gis bskyal lo zhes zer na bzhag ste 'dong bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag cag gis bskyal lo zhes zer na bzhag ste 'dong bar bya'o //
translated: If they say, “We will carry it,” one should leave, placing it there.

original: de dag gis ma bskyal na gnas par byed pa dag gis blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la de rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni khyim pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de dag gis ma bskyal na gnas par byed pa dag gis blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la de rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni khyim pa rnams kyis so //
translated: If they do not carry it, those who remain should take it.” “ Those” refers to laypeople.

original: de ltar khas ma blangs nas ma bskyal na gnas par byed pa rnams kyis blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar khas ma blangs nas ma bskyal na gnas par byed pa rnams kyis blang bar bya'o //
translated: If it is not accepted in this way and not carried out, then those who are in charge should take it.

original: med na rang gis so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: med na rang gis so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If there are none, then oneself.

original: gnas par byed pa dag kyang med na rang gis blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas par byed pa dag kyang med na rang gis blang bar bya'o //
translated: If there are no ones in charge, then oneself should take it.

original: thams cad kyis na gand'i brdung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad kyis na gand'i brdung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In all cases, the gandi should be struck.

original: gal te dge slong thams cad kyis blang bar bya dgos pa zhig yod na thams cad 'dus te gand'i brdungs te blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dge slong thams cad kyis blang bar bya dgos pa zhig yod na thams cad 'dus te gand'i brdungs te blang bar bya'o //
translated: If it is something that must be taken by all the monks, then all should assemble, strike the gandi, and take it.🔽If the patron invites the monks to the monastery for his own sake, he should give the mats.

original: yon bdag gis gtsug lag khang du rang gi don du stan dag g-yar por byed na sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang rnams kyis spyan 'dren la sbyin pa de rnams gal te gtsug lag khang du rang gi don du gdan cha dag g-yar por byed na
analyzed: yon bdag gis gtsug lag khang du rang gi don du stan dag g-yar por byed na sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang rnams kyis spyan 'dren la sbyin pa de rnams gal te gtsug lag khang du rang gi don du gdan cha dag g-yar por byed na
translated: If those who invite the monks to the monastery for their own sake borrow mats from the monastery,

original: de rnams la g-yar bo sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams la g-yar bo sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is that they should give the borrowed mats.

original: de dag bsrung ba'i phyir dge slong yang gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gdan rnams la'o //
analyzed: de dag bsrung ba'i phyir dge slong yang gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gdan rnams la'o //
translated: For the sake of protecting those, a monk should also be placed means that a monk should be placed for the sake of the seats.

original: des phyogs gcig tu bsdad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bzhag pa'i dge slong gis so //
analyzed: des phyogs gcig tu bsdad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bzhag pa'i dge slong gis so //
translated: One should sit in one place means that the monk who is placed should sit.

original: rang gi las bya'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang kha ton byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi las bya'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang kha ton byed pa'o //
translated: One should do one's own work means that one should do meditation and recitation.

original: sems gtad pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gdan rnams la sems gtad bar byed cing gnas par bya'o //🔽dong nas brtul bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni spyan 'dren par byed pa rnams dong nas gdan cha de rnams brtul bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems gtad pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gdan rnams la sems gtad bar byed cing gnas par bya'o // dong nas brtul bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni spyan 'dren par byed pa rnams dong nas gdan cha de rnams brtul bar bya'o //
translated: One should also direct the mind means that one should direct the mind to the seats and remain.🔽Having gone, one should remove means that having gone, those who invite should remove those seats.

original: ma rung ba dag byi dor bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang gis ma rung ba byas pa'i byi dor gang gis bya @197a * //
analyzed: ma rung ba dag byi dor bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang gis ma rung ba byas pa'i byi dor gang gis bya @197a * //
translated: One should repair those that are damaged means that one should repair those that are damaged by what.

original: zhe na / de'i phyir chang gis na chu dag gis so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhe na / de'i phyir chang gis na chu dag gis so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: By what? Therefore, it is said by water if by alcohol.

original: chang gi snyigs mas ma rung bar byas pa rnams ni chu 'ba' zhig gis bkru zhing byi dor bya'o //
analyzed: chang gi snyigs mas ma rung bar byas pa rnams ni chu 'ba' zhig gis bkru zhing byi dor bya'o //
translated: Those that are spoiled by the dregs of alcohol are to be cleaned with water alone.

original: snum gyis na chal gyis so zhes bya ba ni snum gyis ma rung bar gyur pa rnams ni 'dag pa'i chal gyis byi dor bya'o //🔽mi gtsang bas na sa'am lci skam mam lci bas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snum gyis na chal gyis so zhes bya ba ni snum gyis ma rung bar gyur pa rnams ni 'dag pa'i chal gyis byi dor bya'o // mi gtsang bas na sa'am lci skam mam lci bas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Those that are spoiled by oil are to be cleaned with a cleansing agent.🔽Those that are spoiled by filth are to be cleaned with earth, ashes, or cow dung.

original: gdan cha rnams mi gtsang bas ma rung bar gyur nas sa'am lci skam mam lci ba rnams kyis byi dor bya ba'o //
analyzed: gdan cha rnams mi gtsang bas ma rung bar gyur nas sa'am lci skam mam lci ba rnams kyis byi dor bya ba'o //
translated: If the bedding is spoiled by filth, it is to be cleaned with earth, ashes, or cow dung.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gzhan du sa tsam la 'dir bzung ba zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gzhan du sa tsam la 'dir bzung ba zhes gsungs te /
translated: Here, the text says that earth alone is to be used, but it is understood that the other two are also to be used.

original: de ni mtshon pa tsam du rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni mtshon pa tsam du rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: This is just an illustration.

original: de dang 'di 'gal bar shes par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de dang 'di 'gal bar shes par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not understand this to contradict the other two.

original: thags ma ma dag na gcad par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thags ma ma dag na gcad par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: If the cloth is not clean, it is to be cut.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gal te re zhig sbyang bar nus na de lta na legs /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gal te re zhig sbyang bar nus na de lta na legs /
translated: Here, the text says that if the cloth can be cleaned, then that is good.

original: gal te mi nus na 'breng pa bcad de dor bar bya zhing 'breng bu gsar pa rnams kyis kyang slar gso bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te mi nus na 'breng pa bcad de dor bar bya zhing 'breng bu gsar pa rnams kyis kyang slar gso bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one is unable to do so, one should cut the rope and discard it, and then restore it with new ropes.

original: khyim pa 'dug 'dug pa'i stan ma bsdus pa mthong na bsdu bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang dag gis de dag mthong ba nyid kyis de dag bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyim pa 'dug 'dug pa'i stan ma bsdus pa mthong na bsdu bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang dag gis de dag mthong ba nyid kyis de dag bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: If one sees a seat belonging to a layperson that has been left behind, one should put it away. This means that the monks who see it should put it away.

original: gal te rgas pa dang na ba yin na dge skos kyis so zhes bya ba ni gal te mthong ba po rgas pa'am na ba yin na dge skos kyis bsdu bar bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: gal te rgas pa dang na ba yin na dge skos kyis so zhes bya ba ni gal te mthong ba po rgas pa'am na ba yin na dge skos kyis bsdu bar bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: If the person who sees it is old or sick, the rector should do it. This means that if the person who sees it is old or sick, the rector should put it away.

original: des sbran par bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rgan po'am nad pa mthong ba po des sbran par bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: des sbran par bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rgan po'am nad pa mthong ba po des sbran par bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: He should inform the rector. This means that the old or sick person who sees it should inform the rector.

original: gang la sbran par bya snyam du dogs pa la 'dir bskos pa la zhes bya ba don gyis dang dbang du byas pa shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gang la sbran par bya snyam du dogs pa la 'dir bskos pa la zhes bya ba don gyis dang dbang du byas pa shes par bya'o //
translated: In case of doubt about who should be informed, here it should be understood that the one appointed should be informed, and that the rector should be informed.

original: thams cad kyi nad pa blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni de'i khang bu'i gnas su nye bar 'gro ba na gsar bu'am rgan po 'ga' zhig gis ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad kyi nad pa blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni de'i khang bu'i gnas su nye bar 'gro ba na gsar bu'am rgan po 'ga' zhig gis ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should look at all the sick, means that when one goes to the sick ward, one should not look at only some of the sick, whether they are young or old.

original: ci 'greng ste blta bar bya ba 'am zhe na ma yin te de'i phyir 'dug ste'o //
analyzed: ci 'greng ste blta bar bya ba 'am zhe na ma yin te de'i phyir 'dug ste'o //
translated: Should one look at them while standing? No, one should not. Therefore, it is said, sitting down.

original: der stan thogs te 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: der stan thogs te 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: One should not go there taking a seat with one.

original: der zhes bya ba ni nang pa lta ba la'o //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni nang pa lta ba la'o //
translated: There means in the sick ward.

original: nad pa'i nad g-yog gis der stan dag bsham par bya'o //
analyzed: nad pa'i nad g-yog gis der stan dag bsham par bya'o //
translated: The attendant of the sick should prepare a seat there.

original: mkhan po'am slob dpon dge ba'i phyogs la 'gro na gal te gzhan gyis dge ba'i phyogs mi 'phel na phyi bzhin 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gal te ma yin na gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mkhan po'am slob dpon dge ba'i phyogs la 'gro na gal te gzhan gyis dge ba'i phyogs mi 'phel na phyi bzhin 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gal te ma yin na gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the preceptor or the teacher is going to a virtuous place, if the virtuous place does not increase for others, one should follow him. If not, then not.

original: de'i phyi bzhin 'gro ba ma gtogs par klog pa'am gdams ngag gam rjes su bstan pa brtsams pa las @197b so sor nye bar 'dug par gyur pa la 'dir slob dpon nam mkhan po smos pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyi bzhin 'gro ba ma gtogs par klog pa'am gdams ngag gam rjes su bstan pa brtsams pa las @197b so sor nye bar 'dug par gyur pa la 'dir slob dpon nam mkhan po smos pa'o //
translated: The teacher or preceptor is mentioned here because he is present separately from those who follow him, having begun to read or give instructions or further teachings.

original: gal te ma yin na gzhan du zhes bya ba 'di las rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te ma yin na gzhan du zhes bya ba 'di las rtogs par bya'o //
translated: If not, it should be understood from elsewhere, meaning if not from him.

original: de bas gnas kyi slob dpon dang klog pa'i slob dpon dag las gzhan pa'i slob dpon 'dir smos pa zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas gnas kyi slob dpon dang klog pa'i slob dpon dag las gzhan pa'i slob dpon 'dir smos pa zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the teacher mentioned here is different from the teacher of the place and the teacher of reading.

original: de'i phyir rang gi stan bskur bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi stan bskur bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, one's own seat should be given up.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mkhan po'am slob dpon gyi phyir ro //🔽'gro ba ma zhus par mi bskur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mkhan po'am slob dpon gyi phyir ro // 'gro ba ma zhus par mi bskur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, therefore means for the sake of the preceptor or teacher.🔽One should not give up without asking permission to go.

original: bdag nyid kyang phyi bzhin 'gro bar 'gyur ba 'di ltar ma zhus par bskur bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang phyi bzhin 'gro bar 'gyur ba 'di ltar ma zhus par bskur bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that one should not give up one's own seat without asking permission to follow him, thinking I too will go after him.

original: de rang nyid kyis bskur ro zhes bya ba ni de zhes bya ba ni rang nyid kyis bskur bar bstan no //
analyzed: de rang nyid kyis bskur ro zhes bya ba ni de zhes bya ba ni rang nyid kyis bskur bar bstan no //
translated: The phrase he himself should carry it indicates that he himself should carry it.

original: bla gab med par chos nyan pa na rlung dang char byung ba na bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: bla gab med par chos nyan pa na rlung dang char byung ba na bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: When listening to the Dharma in the open air, if wind or rain occurs, one should gather it up.

original: rgan po rnams kyis ni rang gis mi nus na gzhon nu rnams dang lhan cig brje bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhon nu rnams kyi gnas mal gang yin pa de ni yang ba'i phyir rgan po rnams kyis bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgan po rnams kyis ni rang gis mi nus na gzhon nu rnams dang lhan cig brje bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhon nu rnams kyi gnas mal gang yin pa de ni yang ba'i phyir rgan po rnams kyis bskur bar bya'o //
translated: If the elders are unable to do it themselves, they should exchange it with the young. This means that the bedding of the young should be carried by the elders because it is light.

original: rgan po rnams kyi ni lci ba nyid kyi phyir gzhon nu rnams kyis bskur bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgan po rnams kyi ni lci ba nyid kyi phyir gzhon nu rnams kyis bskur bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The bedding of the elders should be carried by the young because it is heavy.

original: mthun pa dang mthun par gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang gis gang mthun pa dang mthun pa de nyid dang lhan cig tu de gzhag par bya'i mi mthun pa dang ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mthun pa dang mthun par gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang gis gang mthun pa dang mthun pa de nyid dang lhan cig tu de gzhag par bya'i mi mthun pa dang ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It should be placed in a suitable place. This means that it should be placed together with what is suitable, not with what is unsuitable.

original: gtsug lag khang gzhan du gdan cha dang rdzas brnyan bskur bar bya'o zhes bya ba la dang gi sgra ni brnyan bskur bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gzhan du gdan cha dang rdzas brnyan bskur bar bya'o zhes bya ba la dang gi sgra ni brnyan bskur bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ba'i don du'o //
translated: The word “and” is for the purpose of connecting the phrase “should be transferred.”

original: 'dir rdzas ni mchod pa'i dbang du byas te blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir rdzas ni mchod pa'i dbang du byas te blta bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the term “articles” should be understood in terms of worship.

original: ci zhig nges pa nyid du bskur bar bya'am zhe na ma yin te ;
analyzed: ci zhig nges pa nyid du bskur bar bya'am zhe na ma yin te ;
translated: What is it that should definitely be transferred? It is not that.

original: de'i phyir gal te char 'bab pa dang 'bab du dogs pa med na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te char 'bab pa dang 'bab du dogs pa med na'o //
translated: Therefore, if there is no rain or fear of rain,

original: gal te lam khar rlung dang char byung na shing ljon pa'am rtsig drung du bcer bar bya'o zhes smos te /
analyzed: gal te lam khar rlung dang char byung na shing ljon pa'am rtsig drung du bcer bar bya'o zhes smos te /
translated: if wind and rain occur on the road, one should enter a tree or a wall.

original: rtsig pa'i zhes bya ba ni drung du'o //
analyzed: rtsig pa'i zhes bya ba ni drung du'o //
translated: “Wall” means near.

original: rdzas ngan pa gcig gis g-yogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rdzas ngan pa gcig gis g-yogs par bya'o //
translated: One should cover it with a single bad article.🔽Having arrived at the temple, the articles should be dried.

original: gtsug lag khang du phyin nas rdzas rnams ni bskam par bya'o zhes bya ba la 'dir gzhung ni khyim bdag gcig la gtsug lag khang gnyis yod de /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du phyin nas rdzas rnams ni bskam par bya'o zhes bya ba la 'dir gzhung ni khyim bdag gcig la gtsug lag khang gnyis yod de /
translated: Here, the text has two temples belonging to a single householder,

original: dgon pa pa dang grong mtha' pa ste /
analyzed: dgon pa pa dang grong mtha' pa ste /
translated: one in the wilderness and one on the outskirts of the village.

original: dge slong dgon pa pa rnams kyis grong mtha' pa'i gtsug lag khang nas gos dag dang gnas mal g-yar ba dang / dge slong grong mtha' pa dag @198a * //
analyzed: dge slong dgon pa pa rnams kyis grong mtha' pa'i gtsug lag khang nas gos dag dang gnas mal g-yar ba dang / dge slong grong mtha' pa dag @198a * //
translated: Monks in the wilderness borrowed robes and bedding from the monastery of the village monks.

original: gis ma ster nas /
analyzed: gis ma ster nas /
translated: The village monks did not return them.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa brnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa brnyan par bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, “They should be taken back.”

original: kha dog sna tshogs pa'i gos rnams ni char bab na nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha dog sna tshogs pa'i gos rnams ni char bab na nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: The robes were of various colors and were damaged by rain.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: gal te char pa 'bab pa'am 'bab tu dogs na brnyan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gal te char pa 'bab pa'am 'bab tu dogs na brnyan par mi bya'o //
translated: “If it is raining or feared that it will rain, they should not be taken back.

original: gal te lam kar char 'bab na shing ljon pa'i drung du gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te lam kar char 'bab na shing ljon pa'i drung du gnas par bya'o //
translated: If it rains on the road, they should stay under a tree.

original: gtsug lag khang du song nas gos rnams bskam par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du song nas gos rnams bskam par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Having gone to the monastery, the robes should be dried.”

original: me shor ram chu byung na dge 'dun gyi yang gdon par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas mal gyi phyir 'di brjod pa ste /
analyzed: me shor ram chu byung na dge 'dun gyi yang gdon par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas mal gyi phyir 'di brjod pa ste /
translated: If a fire or flood occurs, the property of the Saṅgha should also be removed. This is said for the sake of bedding.

original: skyed pa'i dbang gis 'di yang dag par bsten pa'o //
analyzed: skyed pa'i dbang gis 'di yang dag par bsten pa'o //
translated: This is properly relied upon by the power of the cause.

original: gzhan la yang cho ga 'dis sbyar ba ste de bas na khyad par med par nye bar brtags pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la yang cho ga 'dis sbyar ba ste de bas na khyad par med par nye bar brtags pa'o //
translated: It is also applied to others by this procedure. Therefore, it is examined without distinction.

original: rang gi lhung bzed dang chos gos thon zin na'o zhes bya ba ni je dang por rang gi lhung bzed dang chos gos gdon par bya zhing de'i 'og tu dge 'dun gyi yang gdon par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi lhung bzed dang chos gos thon zin na'o zhes bya ba ni je dang por rang gi lhung bzed dang chos gos gdon par bya zhing de'i 'og tu dge 'dun gyi yang gdon par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When one’s own bowl and robes are finished, means that first one’s own bowl and robes should be taken out, and then the Saṅgha’s should be taken out.

original: gang zag ni phongs par 'gyur gyi dge 'dun ni ma yin zhes bya ba byas nas so //
analyzed: gang zag ni phongs par 'gyur gyi dge 'dun ni ma yin zhes bya ba byas nas so //
translated: The individual is in need, but the Saṅgha is not.

original: bton zin pa bsrung ba'i phyir dge slong chen po mi nus pa gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni stobs chung ba nyid kyi phyir las gzhan la mi sbyar zhes par dgongs so //
analyzed: bton zin pa bsrung ba'i phyir dge slong chen po mi nus pa gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni stobs chung ba nyid kyi phyir las gzhan la mi sbyar zhes par dgongs so //
translated: In order to protect what has been taken out, a senior monk who is unable should be left behind. The meaning is that he should not be assigned any other task because of his weakness.

original: mi bzod pa nyid du 'jug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi bzod pa nyid du 'jug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not engage in impatience.

original: me dang chu dag mi bzod pa nyid la gdon pa'i ched du 'jug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: me dang chu dag mi bzod pa nyid la gdon pa'i ched du 'jug par mi bya'o //
translated: The meaning is that one should not engage in taking out fire and water out of impatience.

original: gnas mal gyi ltung byed do /
analyzed: gnas mal gyi ltung byed do /
translated: This is the downfall of a monk who is in charge of bedding and seats.

original: // / khyim gzhan du gding bar byas pa khyim bdag la dris pa de dor bar bya'o zhes bya ba la byas pa zhes bya ba ni rang gis sam bskos pas so //
analyzed: // / khyim gzhan du gding bar byas pa khyim bdag la dris pa de dor bar bya'o zhes bya ba la byas pa zhes bya ba ni rang gis sam bskos pas so //
translated: If one spreads it in another house, one should ask the householder and then discard it.

original: dgon par yang na slong bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dgon par yang na slong bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “In a monastery” means in a temple.🔽“Or one should request it” means

original: yang na dor bar bya zhes bya ba la yang na zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rnam par rtog pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang na dor bar bya zhes bya ba la yang na zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rnam par rtog pa'i don to //
translated: “or one should discard it.” The word “or” has the meaning of an alternative.

original: de ni mgo'am mjug bzlog par byas pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni mgo'am mjug bzlog par byas pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: “One should turn it upside down, either at the head or at the foot.”

original: de zhes bya ba ni slong bar byas pa la'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni slong bar byas pa la'o //
translated: “It” refers to the mat.

original: 'dir gzhung ni de rnams slong bar byed na nyes dmigs de nyid du 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni de rnams slong bar byed na nyes dmigs de nyid du 'gyur ro ;
translated: The text says, “If one requests it, that is the same as discarding it.”

original: / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: mgo'am mjug bzlog pa slong bar byas te /
analyzed: mgo'am mjug bzlog pa slong bar byas te /
translated: “One should request it, turning it upside down either at the head or at the foot,

original: 'gro bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gro bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and then one should go.”

original: gos dag bskam pa'i phyir rtsva gding ba yang dor bar bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: gos dag bskam pa'i phyir rtsva gding ba yang dor bar bya ba nyid do //
translated: One should also discard the grass mat for drying the robes.

original: slong pa la dor ba khas len na sbyin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: slong pa la dor ba khas len na sbyin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: If one accepts the giving away to beggars, one should give.

original: sbyin pa zhes bya ba ni gnang ba'i @198b rtsva rnams so //
analyzed: sbyin pa zhes bya ba ni gnang ba'i @198b rtsva rnams so //
translated: The term giving refers to the grass that is permitted.

original: 'chags dag tu rkang mthil gnyis la rtsub na rtsva dag gding bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'chags dag tu rkang mthil gnyis la rtsub na rtsva dag gding bar bya'o //
translated: If the soles of one's feet are rough, one should spread out grass on the walking paths.

original: de dag kyang dor bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni gnang ba'i rtsva rnams so //🔽gtong na dor bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid du ma gyur pa dor bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag kyang dor bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni gnang ba'i rtsva rnams so // gtong na dor bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid du ma gyur pa dor bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The term that which is to be discarded refers to the grass that is permitted.🔽If one gives it away, one should discard that which is not to be discarded. The term if one gives it away refers to the time when one gives up walking.

original: gtong na zhes bya ba ni 'chag pa gtong ba'i dus la dor bar bya ba dor ba'o //
analyzed: gtong na zhes bya ba ni 'chag pa gtong ba'i dus la dor bar bya ba dor ba'o //
translated: The term discard means to discard that which is to be discarded.

original: ci gnas skabs thams cad du yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: ci gnas skabs thams cad du yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Is it in all circumstances? No, it is not.

original: de'i phyir dor bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid du ma gyur pa la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dor bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid du ma gyur pa la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, the term that which is not to be discarded is stated.

original: gyur pa la ni gyur pa nyid kho na byas pa nyid dor ba zhes bya ba don gyis thob bo //
analyzed: gyur pa la ni gyur pa nyid kho na byas pa nyid dor ba zhes bya ba don gyis thob bo //
translated: That which is to be discarded is that which is to be discarded by the one who has become. The term that which is to be discarded is understood by implication.

original: gzhan gyi tshe ni dus su so sor brtag pa dang bsgyur log bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe ni dus su so sor brtag pa dang bsgyur log bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: At other times, one should examine and reverse the order.

original: gzhan gyi tshe zhes bya ba ni gtong ba'i dus las so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe zhes bya ba ni gtong ba'i dus las so //
translated: At other times means at the time of giving up.🔽One should examine and reverse the order every day in a place with oily or sweet earth.

original: sa snum pa dang mngar ba ni nyin re bzhin no zhes bya ba ni sril la sogs pa las byung ba'i nyes pa spang ba'i phyir nyi ma re rer bsgyur bzlog bya ba'o //
analyzed: sa snum pa dang mngar ba ni nyin re bzhin no zhes bya ba ni sril la sogs pa las byung ba'i nyes pa spang ba'i phyir nyi ma re rer bsgyur bzlog bya ba'o //
translated: In order to avoid the fault of eating garlic and so on, one should reverse the order every day.

original: yul gang nas sa snum pa dang mngar ba ni sril rnams la sdug bsngal 'byung bas te ;
analyzed: yul gang nas sa snum pa dang mngar ba ni sril rnams la sdug bsngal 'byung bas te ;
translated: In a place where the earth is oily and sweet, suffering arises in the intestines.

original: de'i phyir na snum pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir na snum pa'i tshig go //
translated: Therefore, it is called oily.

original: de ltar yang yul 'di ni snum pa dang 'jam pa'i sa dang ldan pa zhes bya bas ni snum pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang yul 'di ni snum pa dang 'jam pa'i sa dang ldan pa zhes bya bas ni snum pa brjod pa'o //
translated: Thus, in this place, the earth is said to be oily and smooth.🔽In other places, every half month.

original: gzhan du zla ba phyed phyed cing ngo zhes bya ba ni sa snum pa dang mngar ba las gzhan pa'i yul du ni zla ba phyed phyed cing lan re bsgyur bzlog bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zla ba phyed phyed cing ngo zhes bya ba ni sa snum pa dang mngar ba las gzhan pa'i yul du ni zla ba phyed phyed cing lan re bsgyur bzlog bya'o //
translated: In places other than those with oily and sweet earth, one should reverse the order once every half month.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gal te sa phyogs snum pa dang mngar ba yin na bting ba nyin re zhing bsgyur bzlog bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gal te sa phyogs snum pa dang mngar ba yin na bting ba nyin re zhing bsgyur bzlog bya'o //
translated: The text says: If the ground is oily and sweet, the bedding should be turned over daily.

original: gal te sa phyogs snum pa dang mngar ba ma yin na ni zla ba phyed cing bsgyur bzlog bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te sa phyogs snum pa dang mngar ba ma yin na ni zla ba phyed cing bsgyur bzlog bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If the ground is not oily and sweet, it should be turned over every half month.

original: 'chags dag tu rtsva'i chun po dag thag pas bcings te shing la gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'chags dag tu rtsva'i chun po dag thag pas bcings te shing la gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In the rainy season, bundles of grass should be tied with rope and hung on trees.

original: lci ba gyo mor gzhag par bya'o //🔽gnas nas 'phags par 'gyur ba na zhes bya ba yan chad sngar thal ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lci ba gyo mor gzhag par bya'o // gnas nas 'phags par 'gyur ba na zhes bya ba yan chad sngar thal ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The ashes should be placed on a platform.🔽The rest is as was declared earlier.

original: sngar mdo las gnas nas 'phags par 'gyur ba na sngar gyi bslab pa'i gzhi de dang 'brel pa gang yin pa de 'dir rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar mdo las gnas nas 'phags par 'gyur ba na sngar gyi bslab pa'i gzhi de dang 'brel pa gang yin pa de 'dir rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The rest is as was declared earlier means that the earlier sutra should be understood here as well.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong 'khod pa la yang ma bcol na gzhan la de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs te ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa'i ltung ba bstan pa'i gzhung rgya cher 'byung ba de dag gnas mal ltung ba'i lam zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong 'khod pa la yang ma bcol na gzhan la de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs te ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa'i ltung ba bstan pa'i gzhung rgya cher 'byung ba de dag gnas mal ltung ba'i lam zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The text of the rule that is stated in the Vibhanga is called “the path of offenses related to bedding and seats.”

original: de bzhin du 'dir kha cig ni 'dir gzhan de 'dra ba'i rkyen las zhes bya ba 'di nyam nga ba dang phrad par mi 'gyur ba lta na zhes bya ba @199a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir kha cig ni 'dir gzhan de 'dra ba'i rkyen las zhes bya ba 'di nyam nga ba dang phrad par mi 'gyur ba lta na zhes bya ba @199a * //
translated: Similarly, here, “except in special circumstances” means “except if there is no danger.”

original: ni ma yin pa dgag pa ste 'brel pa mang po nyid du bya ba mi 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: ni ma yin pa dgag pa ste 'brel pa mang po nyid du bya ba mi 'jug pa yin no //
translated: “If there is no danger” is a negative particle. It is not used in the sense of many connections.

original: de'i phyir 'di med par rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di med par rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that this is not the case.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi 'di dag la rnam pa gcig tu gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi 'di dag la rnam pa gcig tu gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because these training rules are of one type.

original: de bas na ma brjod pa'i don la yang 'dir snga ma'i rjes su 'brang bas thob pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na ma brjod pa'i don la yang 'dir snga ma'i rjes su 'brang bas thob pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning that is not stated here is also obtained by implication from the previous rule.

original: gzhan dag na cher pas phan phun du gyur pas 'dir mi 'jud do zhes zer na de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na cher pas phan phun du gyur pas 'dir mi 'jud do zhes zer na de yang mi rigs te /
translated: Others say: It is not included here because it is a great offense. That also is not correct.

original: 'dir 'dis kyang sa gzhi chud zos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir 'dis kyang sa gzhi chud zos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this is also a waste of the earth.🔽It is not so in the case of what is not to be touched.

original: reg par bya ba ma yin pa nyid la ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la 'dir don mi snang bas log pa'o //
analyzed: reg par bya ba ma yin pa nyid la ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la 'dir don mi snang bas log pa'o //
translated: Here the meaning is not seen, so it is wrong.

original: gnas mal 'di sdus shig ces bya ba 'dir 'di la gnas mal gyi gnas su gding ba gtogs par don gyis grub bo //
analyzed: gnas mal 'di sdus shig ces bya ba 'dir 'di la gnas mal gyi gnas su gding ba gtogs par don gyis grub bo //
translated: In this case, “Gather the bedding,” the meaning is established by implication that it is spread as a place for bedding.

original: de bas na de'i 'og tu thams cad la dmigs kyis bsal ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na de'i 'og tu thams cad la dmigs kyis bsal ba'o //
translated: Therefore, after that, all are exceptions.

original: cig car spyod pa ni 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya ba thams cad la khyab pa dang ldan pa yin gyis langs pa la ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cig car spyod pa ni 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya ba thams cad la khyab pa dang ldan pa yin gyis langs pa la ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Simultaneous practice is just like that. The meaning is that it is associated with pervading everything, not with rising.

original: dge 'dun gyi ma yin par ni gnas pa'i bdag po rnams la yang dri bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgras ni dge slong la yang zhes bya ba dge 'dun gyi gnas ma yin par gnang ba'i gding ba la gnas de'i bdag🔽po rnams la dri bar bya zhing dor bar bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi ma yin par ni gnas pa'i bdag po rnams la yang dri bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgras ni dge slong la yang zhes bya ba dge 'dun gyi gnas ma yin par gnang ba'i gding ba la gnas de'i bdag po rnams la dri bar bya zhing dor bar bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: The word also indicates that it is also to be asked of the monks.

original: rnams la zhes mang po'i tshig tu bstan pa ni 'dir bu dang chung ma la sogs pa dag kyang de'i dngos po la bdag por gyur pa la khongs su bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnams la zhes mang po'i tshig tu bstan pa ni 'dir bu dang chung ma la sogs pa dag kyang de'i dngos po la bdag por gyur pa la khongs su bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: The word owners indicates that sons, wives, and so on who are masters of that property are also included.

original: gcig gi tshig gis khyim bdag gcig kho na la bzung bar shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig gi tshig gis khyim bdag gcig kho na la bzung bar shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: The singular form of the word owner indicates that it is understood to refer to a single householder.

original: 'dir yan lag gang rnams la ltung ba'i byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir yan lag gang rnams la ltung ba'i byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Here, what are the limbs of the one who commits the downfall?

original: de'i phyir dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang nyid dang rdo ba dang bye ma'i gzhi nyid la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa nyid dang de lta bu'i nyes dmigs yod pa nyid kyis gzhir rang dang bskos pas gding ba bya ba nyid lta bu ni byed pa
analyzed: de'i phyir dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang nyid dang rdo ba dang bye ma'i gzhi nyid la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa nyid dang de lta bu'i nyes dmigs yod pa nyid kyis gzhir rang dang bskos pas gding ba bya ba nyid lta bu ni byed pa
translated: Therefore, the very temple of the Saṅgha, the very ground of stones and sand, etc., is not their nature.  And because of the existence of such faults, the ground is the agent of the action of spreading out, as it were, by itself and by those appointed by it.

original: po nyid yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: po nyid yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The agent is just that.

original: rdo ba dang zhes bya ba ni rung ba nyid la 'di bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rdo ba dang zhes bya ba ni rung ba nyid la 'di bstan pa ste /
translated: “Stones, etc.” indicates suitability.

original: de lta bu'i bdag nyid rung ba nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i bdag nyid rung ba nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: That is, it is suitable to be of such a nature.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni rdo ba la sogs pas ma yin par 'gyur ba bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni rdo ba la sogs pas ma yin par 'gyur ba bzung ngo //
translated: The word “etc.” includes what is not stones, etc.

original: rdo ba dang bye ma la sogs pa sa gang la yod pa ma yin pa de ni rdo ba dang bye ma'i gzhi'o //
analyzed: rdo ba dang bye ma la sogs pa sa gang la yod pa ma yin pa de ni rdo ba dang bye ma'i gzhi'o //
translated: That which is not of the nature of stones, sand, etc., is the ground of stones and sand.

original: de'i dngos po dang rdo ba dang bye ma'i gzhi nyid de rnams kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po dang rdo ba dang bye ma'i gzhi nyid de rnams kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: The state of being that, the nature of stones and sand, is their self.

original: de lta bu'i nyes dmigs yod pa nyid kyis rung ba nyid ces bya ba ni sril la @199b sogs pa'i nye bar 'tshe ba rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i nyes dmigs yod pa nyid kyis rung ba nyid ces bya ba ni sril la @199b sogs pa'i nye bar 'tshe ba rung ba nyid do //
translated: Since there is such a fault, the term “suitable” means that the harm of thorns, etc. is suitable.

original: rang dang bskos pas gding ba byas pa nyid lta bu ni byed pa po dag yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang dang bskos pas gding ba byas pa nyid lta bu ni byed pa po dag yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The agent is the one who spreads the bedding himself or has it spread by another.

original: sngar thal ba'o zhes bya ba 'di las dngos gzhi'i mtha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dir rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar thal ba'o zhes bya ba 'di las dngos gzhi'i mtha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dir rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The term “the conclusion of the main part” should be understood here in the same way that it was explained in the previous context.

original: gding ba'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: gding ba'i ltung byed do /
translated: It is a downfall that requires relinquishment and confession.🔽What is the agent in the downfall of driving out?

original: // / skrod pa'i ltung byed la byed pa po nyid gang yin zhe na de'i phyir dge slong nyid dang dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang nyid dag ni byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: // / skrod pa'i ltung byed la byed pa po nyid gang yin zhe na de'i phyir dge slong nyid dang dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang nyid dag ni byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The agent is a fully ordained monk and the place is a monastery of the saṅgha.

original: ci bsam pa thams cad kyis de nyid byed pa po yin nam zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci bsam pa thams cad kyis de nyid byed pa po yin nam zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: Is the agent the one who does all the actions?

original: gal te de la gnod pa dang dge 'dun 'khrug pa skye ba nye bar zhi bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnyen por 'dod pa ma yin na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gal te de la gnod pa dang dge 'dun 'khrug pa skye ba nye bar zhi bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnyen por 'dod pa ma yin na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If he does not wish to pacify the harm and the arising of a schism in the Saṅgha.

original: dge slong nyid gang la byed pa po nyid du brjod pa de la srog gtong ba la sogs pas gnod pa ni de la gnod pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong nyid gang la byed pa po nyid du brjod pa de la srog gtong ba la sogs pas gnod pa ni de la gnod pa'o //
translated: The harm is the harm to that person by taking his life, etc.🔽The arising of harm and the arising of a schism in the Saṅgha are not pacified by the two, the act of excommunication and the act of banishment.

original: de la gnod pa dang dge 'dun 'khrug pa dag la skye ba dang skrod pa gnyis la nye bar zhi bar mi 'gyur bar dogs pa yod pa las bsam pa gzhan la 'di dag las byed pa po nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la gnod pa dang dge 'dun 'khrug pa dag la skye ba dang skrod pa gnyis la nye bar zhi bar mi 'gyur bar dogs pa yod pa las bsam pa gzhan la 'di dag las byed pa po nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: If he has the intention that these two will not be pacified, then he is the agent of these two acts.

original: de gnyis gang la byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gnyis gang la byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
translated: With regard to which two acts is he the agent?

original: de'i phyir skrod pa la'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir skrod pa la'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says, “with regard to the act of banishment.”

original: sus she na /
analyzed: sus she na /
translated: By whom?

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “also by another.”

original: rang nyid gcig pu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang nyid gcig pu ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not only by himself alone.

original: gzhan gyis rjes su 'jug pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis rjes su 'jug pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also by another who is following him.

original: gzhan dag bskos nas skrod par byed na ltung ba med pa'am na smad pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan dag bskos nas skrod par byed na ltung ba med pa'am na smad pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one expels others by appointing them, there is no offense.

analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis skrod par byed na gnyi ga la ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The text here states that if a fully ordained monk expels, there is an offense of wrongdoing for both.

translated: Here, the text states: “There is no offense if one is sick or in danger.”

original: de ni dpe ste mtho btsams par 'dun pas dge slong la mtho btsams pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni dpe ste mtho btsams par 'dun pas dge slong la mtho btsams pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: That is the example. Also, one should not insult a bhikṣu with the intention of insulting him.

original: 'dir gzhung ni bar sngom la /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bar sngom la /
translated: Here, the text is summarized:🔽Bad, good, straight, crooked,🔽copper, medicine,🔽yoga, recitation,

original: ngan dang bsod dang drang ngo dang // chol zangs dang ni bkru sman dang // rnal 'byor mthun dang kha ton dang // @200b 'jigs dang bcas dang 'jigs med do //
analyzed: ngan dang bsod dang drang ngo dang // chol zangs dang ni bkru sman dang // rnal 'byor mthun dang kha ton dang // @200b 'jigs dang bcas dang 'jigs med do //
translated: with fear, and without fear.🔽Whatever a bhikṣu does to insult a bhikṣu, all of it is a downfall.

original: zhes bya bas dge slong gis dge slong la ji tsam cung zad tho 'tshams par byed na thams cad ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang dang 'brel pa'i gnas kyi sgo la rjes su mthun pa'i sa phyogs su yang dag par
analyzed: zhes bya bas dge slong gis dge slong la ji tsam cung zad tho 'tshams par byed na thams cad ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang dang 'brel pa'i gnas kyi sgo la rjes su mthun pa'i sa phyogs su yang dag par
translated: This is the correct place for the door of the dwelling connected to the saṅgha's temple.

original: zhugs pa'am phongs pa bsgrub pas rnam par 'tshe ba skyed pa'am 'gags pas gang zhig tho 'tshams par byed na de 'dir mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba mdor byas pa ni bslab pa'i gzhi rjes su 'brangs pas rtogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: zhugs pa'am phongs pa bsgrub pas rnam par 'tshe ba skyed pa'am 'gags pas gang zhig tho 'tshams par byed na de 'dir mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba mdor byas pa ni bslab pa'i gzhi rjes su 'brangs pas rtogs pa bya'o //
translated: If one causes harm or obstructs the accomplishment of the needs or desires of others, then one is said to be “desiring to harm.” The summary is to be understood by following the rules of training.

original: bsgo ba rna la gzon pa dang skrod par byed pa dang / des tshig dang dgag dbye dang 'debs par byed pa dang / spyod pa dang / bsdigs pa dang / yo byad 'jog pa dang / bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la gzhan du bslab pa'i gzhi las ltung ba tha mi dad pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgo ba rna la gzon pa dang skrod par byed pa dang / des tshig dang dgag dbye dang 'debs par byed pa dang / spyod pa dang / bsdigs pa dang / yo byad 'jog pa dang / bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la gzhan du bslab pa'i gzhi las ltung ba tha mi dad pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one disobeys, or disregards, or evades, or speaks against, or disputes, or threatens, or confiscates the requisites, or trains in the rules of training in a different way, then one commits a downfall that is not different from the downfall in the rules of training.

original: 'dir yang dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang la gnas pa rten pa don med pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ma smos pa'i cho ga gzhan la rnam par 'tshe ba la ni nyes byas su rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang la gnas pa rten pa don med pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ma smos pa'i cho ga gzhan la rnam par 'tshe ba la ni nyes byas su rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand that there is an offense of wrong conduct for the other forms of harm that are not mentioned, such as staying in a temple of the saṅgha without a purpose, because it would follow that it would be meaningless to rely on the saṅgha.

original: phyis gnon gyi ltung byed do /
analyzed: phyis gnon gyi ltung byed do /
translated: The downfall is not to be in harmony with the saṅgha.

original: // / dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi steng gi thog nyid ni byed pa po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: // / dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi steng gi thog nyid ni byed pa po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The one who does the work on the upper story of the Saṅgha's temple is the creator.

original: dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi steng gi thog nyid ni ltung ba'i byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi steng gi thog nyid ni ltung ba'i byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: The one who does the work on the upper story of the Saṅgha's temple is the creator of the downfall.

original: ci rnam pa thams cad la de byed pa po yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: ci rnam pa thams cad la de byed pa po yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Is he the creator in all cases? No, he is not.

original: gal te byin gyis gzhol ba nyid dam spang leb nyid dam /
analyzed: gal te byin gyis gzhol ba nyid dam spang leb nyid dam /
translated: If it is not sloping toward the drain, or if it is not covered with planks,

original: de dang 'dra bas g-yogs pa nyid ma yin na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bas g-yogs pa nyid ma yin na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: or if it is covered in a similar way.

original: de dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni spang leb kyi rnam pa bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni spang leb kyi rnam pa bzung ba yin no //
translated: By similar, the form of planks is included.

original: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni byin gyis gzhol ba yin na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni byin gyis gzhol ba yin na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the text here states, If it is sloping toward the drain, there is no offense.

original: gal te rkang pa 'byung ba'i glags med pa zhes bya ba 'di 'dir bsdus pa'i don du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te rkang pa 'byung ba'i glags med pa zhes bya ba 'di 'dir bsdus pa'i don du rig par bya'o //
translated: If there is no opportunity for the feet to come out, this should be understood as the meaning of included.

original: ci 'di nyid gcig tu byed pa po yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: ci 'di nyid gcig tu byed pa po yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Is he the creator in this case alone? No, he is not.

original: 'di'i phyir gnon par 'os pa'i rtsa ba phur bu lta bu nyid kyang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir gnon par 'os pa'i rtsa ba phur bu lta bu nyid kyang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, the root of what should be suppressed is like a stake.

original: khri dang khri'u smos pa 'dir byas te khri'u dor cig ces bya ba 'dir mtshon pa tsam du rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: khri dang khri'u smos pa 'dir byas te khri'u dor cig ces bya ba 'dir mtshon pa tsam du rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Here, a bed and a bench are mentioned. The phrase “throw away the bench” is merely an illustration.

original: yod pa nyid kyi phyir 'di lta bur gyur pa gzhan la yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yod pa nyid kyi phyir 'di lta bur gyur pa gzhan la yang 'di lta ste /
translated: Because it exists, this is the case for other things as well.

original: khri'u rkang pa dang 'das pa dang bcas pa 'dra ba la nyes dmigs 'dra ba nyid kyis der nges par gnas pa la sogs pa ste /🔽de'i phyir gnon par @201a * //
analyzed: khri'u rkang pa dang 'das pa dang bcas pa 'dra ba la nyes dmigs 'dra ba nyid kyis der nges par gnas pa la sogs pa ste / de'i phyir gnon par @201a * //
translated: For example, a bench with legs and a back is similar to a bed. Due to the similarity of the fault, it is definitely established as a bed.

original: 'os pa zhes bya ba'i tshig byas so //
analyzed: 'os pa zhes bya ba'i tshig byas so //
translated: Therefore, the term “what should be suppressed” is used.

original: ci gnas skabs thams cad du 'di la byed pa po nyid yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: ci gnas skabs thams cad du 'di la byed pa po nyid yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Is one always the agent of this? No, he is not.

original: de'i phyir bkan pa nyid dang rkang rten bcug pa nyid ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bkan pa nyid dang rkang rten bcug pa nyid ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, the root text states, “except for sitting and lying down.”

original: mnan par 'os pa zhes bya ba dbang du byed pa las shes par byed do //🔽mngon par 'dug par bya ba'am /
analyzed: mnan par 'os pa zhes bya ba dbang du byed pa las shes par byed do // mngon par 'dug par bya ba'am /
translated: “In the case of sitting down” means “in the case of sitting down in a manifest way.”🔽“In the case of sitting down” means “in the case of sitting down in a manifest way.”🔽“In the case of sitting down” means “in the case of sitting down in a manifest way.”🔽“In the case of sitting down” means “in the case of sitting down in a manifest way.”

translated: “In the case of sitting down” means “in the case of sitting down in a manifest way.”🔽“In the case of sitting down” means “in the case of sitting down in a manifest way.”🔽“In the case of sitting down” means “in the case of sitting down in a manifest way.”🔽“In the case of sitting down” means “in the case of sitting down in a manifest way.”🔽“In the case of sitting down” means “in the case of sitting down in a manifest way.”🔽“In the case of sitting down” means “in the case of sitting down in a manifest way.”🔽“In the case of sitting down” means “in the case of sitting down in a manifest way.”🔽“In the case of sitting down” means “in the case of sitting down in a manifest way.”🔽“In the case of sitting down” means “in the case of sitting down in a manifest way.”🔽“In the case of sitting down” means “in the case of sitting down in a manifest way.”🔽“In the case of sitting down” means “in the case of sitting down in a manifest way.”🔽“In the case of sitting down” means “in the case of sitting down in a manifest way.”🔽“In the case of sitting down” means “in the case of sitting down in a manifest way.”🔽“In the case of sitting down” means “in the case of sitting down in a manifest way.”🔽“In the case of sitting down” means “in the case of sitting down in a manifest way.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gang shes bzhin du zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gang shes bzhin du zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
translated: “In the case of sitting down” means “in the case of sitting down in a manifest way.”

original: rnam par 'byed pa las kyang 'dir rang nyid kyis rig par gyur pa'am gzhan dag gis brjod pas so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa las kyang 'dir rang nyid kyis rig par gyur pa'am gzhan dag gis brjod pas so zhes gsungs so //
translated: Here, one should understand this oneself or through the statements of others.

original: dge slong gnon par byas pa'i gleng gzhi dang sbyin pa gcad pa'i phyir 'di rnams brtags pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gnon par byas pa'i gleng gzhi dang sbyin pa gcad pa'i phyir 'di rnams brtags pa'o //
translated: This was composed in order to investigate the basis for the offense of a monk who is being suppressed and the basis for the offense of cutting off generosity.

original: rtsa ba 'byung ba la 'dug pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: rtsa ba 'byung ba la 'dug pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: The root text states: The downfall of sitting in a concealed place.

original: // / yang gang zhig bslab pa'i gzhi 'di la yang dge slong gang shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva 'am zhes bya ba dang / gang zhig yang slar shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod na zhes bya ba gcig po nyid gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: // / yang gang zhig bslab pa'i gzhi 'di la yang dge slong gang shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva 'am zhes bya ba dang / gang zhig yang slar shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod na zhes bya ba gcig po nyid gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, in this training rule, the Buddha said, “A monk who knowingly uses water containing living beings to water grass,” and “A monk who knowingly uses water containing living beings,” which is the same as the first.

original: yul gyi bye brag gis ni de gnyis ltung ba tha dad pa nyid yin pas gang zhig der cho ga de nyid ces bya ba mngon par brten nas yul gang la 'di dang de zhes bya ba de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yul gyi bye brag gis ni de gnyis ltung ba tha dad pa nyid yin pas gang zhig der cho ga de nyid ces bya ba mngon par brten nas yul gang la 'di dang de zhes bya ba de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: These two are separate downfalls due to the difference in the object. Therefore, in order to demonstrate the object of the first rule, the root text states, “In that place.”

original: rang spyod pa'i don nyid de las gzhan pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rang spyod pa'i don nyid de las gzhan pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “Other than that” means other than the very meaning of one’s own practice.

original: rang spyod pa nyid gzhag par bya ba gzhan la shes gtso bo zhes bya ba de la ni srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa zhes bya ba'i lhag ma de nyid las rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rang spyod pa nyid gzhag par bya ba gzhan la shes gtso bo zhes bya ba de la ni srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa zhes bya ba'i lhag ma de nyid las rtogs par bya'o //
translated: “One should place one’s own practice” means that the remainder, “one should know the principal one,” should be understood from just that.

original: srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: The downfall is “to engage in sexual intercourse with a living being.”

original: // / sgo cha gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgo cha zhes bya ba ni sgo skyes la sogs pa sgo dang 'brel pa'i yo byad do //
analyzed: // / sgo cha gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgo cha zhes bya ba ni sgo skyes la sogs pa sgo dang 'brel pa'i yo byad do //
translated: “One should install the door fittings” means that the “door fittings” are the articles connected with the door, such as the door bolt.

original: 'di ltar ya phubs las gzhan sgo skyes bzung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gis rtogs par @201b bya'o ;
analyzed: 'di ltar ya phubs las gzhan sgo skyes bzung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gis rtogs par @201b bya'o ;
translated: “In this way, other than the upper part, the door bolt is grasped,” should be understood from the words.

original: / sgo glegs dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba na 'dir sgo glegs zhes bya ba sgo leb la bya ste /
analyzed: / sgo glegs dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba na 'dir sgo glegs zhes bya ba sgo leb la bya ste /
translated: “The door panels as well” means that here the “door panels” are the door leaves.

original: de yang sgo glegs zhes smos pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: de yang sgo glegs zhes smos pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: That is also from the words “the door panels.”

original: skar khung dag kyang gdod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: skar khung dag kyang gdod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'jug par bya'o //
translated: And the windows should be opened.

original: ltung ba 'di la byed pa po nyid gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: ltung ba 'di la byed pa po nyid gang yin zhe na /
translated: Who is the agent in this downfall?

original: de'i phyir gtsug lag khang ni byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtsug lag khang ni byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore it says, “The agent is the one who builds the temple.”

original: 'di la tshad ji tsam la byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /🔽de'i phyir spyod lam bzhi shong ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di la tshad ji tsam la byed pa po nyid yin zhe na / de'i phyir spyod lam bzhi shong ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: What is the measure of a temple?🔽Therefore it says, “It is large enough for four people to practice walking meditation.”

original: gang du spyod lam rnam bzhi byar rung zhing shong ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang du spyod lam rnam bzhi byar rung zhing shong ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that it is large enough for the four modes of behavior.

original: ci gtsug lag khang tshad de tsam dang ldan pa thams cad byed pa po yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci gtsug lag khang tshad de tsam dang ldan pa thams cad byed pa po yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is anyone who builds a temple of that size an agent in this downfall?

original: de'i phyir gal te thams cad rdo'am so phag gam shing las byas pa ma yin na'o zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te thams cad rdo'am so phag gam shing las byas pa ma yin na'o zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Therefore it says, “If it is not made of stone, brick, or wood.”

original: thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyis thams cad du gtsug lag khang la yang da ltar khyim la dbang ba zhes bya ba bye brag ma smos pa'i phyir rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyis thams cad du gtsug lag khang la yang da ltar khyim la dbang ba zhes bya ba bye brag ma smos pa'i phyir rtogs pa'o //
translated: The word all is understood to mean in all ways, because it is not specified that the monastery is the object of the present rule.

original: 'dir bye brag gzhan yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir bye brag gzhan yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here, another distinction should be stated.

original: char chu bskyab pa'i g-yogs ma yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gal te thams cad nyi ma re re zhing bya ba byas pa zhes bya ba don gyis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: char chu bskyab pa'i g-yogs ma yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gal te thams cad nyi ma re re zhing bya ba byas pa zhes bya ba don gyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: A roof to protect from rain is also allowed. If it is understood that all means that each day the work should be done, then the roof should be removed at the end of the day.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa dge slong dag yod de /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa dge slong dag yod de /
translated: Here is the text:

original: rtsig pa rim pa gnyis sam gsum las lhag par rtsig cing de la ltung byed du yang mi 'gyur ba mchis sam /
analyzed: rtsig pa rim pa gnyis sam gsum las lhag par rtsig cing de la ltung byed du yang mi 'gyur ba mchis sam /
translated: The venerable monks asked, Lord, is it permissible to build a wall more than two or three stories high, and not commit an offense?

original: yod de rtsva dag gis g-yogs par byed na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: yod de rtsva dag gis g-yogs par byed na ltung ba med do //
translated: Lord Buddha replied, Yes, if it is covered with grass, there is no offense.

original: spang leb dag gis g-yogs par byed na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: spang leb dag gis g-yogs par byed na ltung ba med do //
translated: If it is covered with wooden boards, there is no offense.

original: shing leb dag gis g-yogs par byed na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: shing leb dag gis g-yogs par byed na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If it is covered with wooden boards, there is no offense.

original: rtsa ba'i ltung ba 'byin par byed na thams cad la 'di byed pa po nyid yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i ltung ba 'byin par byed na thams cad la 'di byed pa po nyid yin nam zhe na /
translated: If one causes a root downfall, is one always the perpetrator?

original: ma yin te de'i phyir yon bdag gis byas sam zin nam blta'o zhes ma smras pa la'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ma yin te de'i phyir yon bdag gis byas sam zin nam blta'o zhes ma smras pa la'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: No, therefore it says, “If one does not say, ‘I will see whether the patron has finished or not,’ ”

original: smras pa la ni nyes pa med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: smras pa la ni nyes pa med pa nyid yin no //
translated: but if one does say it, there is no offense.

original: gang la de byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang la de byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
translated: To whom is one the perpetrator?

original: de'i phyir pha gu rim pa gsum las lhag pa la'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir pha gu rim pa gsum las lhag pa la'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore it says, “If it has more than three layers of bricks or stone.”

original: ci bdag nyid kho nas sam zhe na /
analyzed: ci bdag nyid kho nas sam zhe na /
translated: Is one the perpetrator only if one does it oneself?

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “If others do it,”

original: 'dir gzhung ni byed du bcug na yang zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni byed du bcug na yang zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and the text says, “If one has it done.”

original: gang gi tshe brtsigs she na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe brtsigs she na /
translated: When is it built?

original: de'i phyir nyi ma de la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyi ma de la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “On that day.”

original: nyi ma gang la rim pa gsum brtsigs pa'i nyi ma de nyid la gal @202a * //🔽te lhag par brtsigs na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyi ma gang la rim pa gsum brtsigs pa'i nyi ma de nyid la gal @202a * // te lhag par brtsigs na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that if he builds up more than the three layers on another day, then on that very day, the number should be known.🔽But not on another, without clay.🔽The meaning is that if he builds up more than the three layers of clay on another day, then on that very day, the number should be known.🔽But not on another, without clay.

original: rim pa gang dang gang la nyi ma gzhan la brtsigs pa nyid de la ni 'dir grangs shes par bya ba ma yin no //

translated: The phrase more than three stories is connected to this.

translated: The meaning is that there is no offense for the first three who are the cause of a downfall, in the order of the higher wall.

original: gtsug lag khang gi @202b ltung byed do /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi @202b ltung byed do /

original: // / pham par gyur pa ma byung ba mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang ma mo 'dzin pa lo nyi shu las mi nyung ba grong khyer pa'i skad smra ba dge slong ma la lus nye bar gzhol ba nyid kyi phyir bcos pa byas pa dge slong ma'i ston
analyzed: // / pham par gyur pa ma byung ba mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang ma mo 'dzin pa lo nyi shu las mi nyung ba grong khyer pa'i skad smra ba dge slong ma la lus nye bar gzhol ba nyid kyi phyir bcos pa byas pa dge slong ma'i ston
translated: One who has not incurred a defeating offense, who is at least twenty years old, who speaks the language of the town, who has been corrected by the nuns because of physical intimacy, should be appointed as the teacher of the nuns.
