analyzed: gang der tshul khrims kyis smos pa de la ni bsgrub pa'i tshig 'di dang 'gal bar shes par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The one who is mentioned there through morality should not be understood to contradict this statement about practice.

original: 'dir dam pa rnams kyis spyod pa thams cad la tshul khrims nyid du gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir dam pa rnams kyis spyod pa thams cad la tshul khrims nyid du gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Here, the practice of all the holy ones is said to be morality.

original: de bas na rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa rnams la go rims kyis shes pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa rnams la go rims kyis shes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the stream-enterer, etc., are to be understood in order.

original: rjes su bsgrub pa 'di byed pa po @207a * //
analyzed: rjes su bsgrub pa 'di byed pa po @207a * //
translated: If one is the agent of this subsequent practice,

original: nyid yin zhe na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nyid yin zhe na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then one should be called a stream-enterer.

original: zos pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i phyir de ni mid na de'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zos pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i phyir de ni mid na de'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To show the nature of what is eaten, he says, “When it is swallowed, it is that.”

original: zos pa de ni mid na dngos gzhir gyur pa'i zos pa'o //
analyzed: zos pa de ni mid na dngos gzhir gyur pa'i zos pa'o //
translated: When that which is eaten is swallowed, it becomes the actual basis of what is eaten.

original: gang zhig 'dun nas zhes bya ba 'dir don ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig 'dun nas zhes bya ba 'dir don ma yin no //
translated: “When one eats with desire” is not the meaning here.

original: gzhan gyi don du na na smad par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don du dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa gzhan gyis za ba la nyes byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du na na smad par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don du dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa gzhan gyis za ba la nyes byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “If it is for the benefit of others, it is blameworthy” means that if a nun eats what was prepared by another for the benefit of others, it is a misdeed.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las gzhan gyi don du sbyor du bcug par shes bzhin du zos na nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las gzhan gyi don du sbyor du bcug par shes bzhin du zos na nyes byas so //
translated: Here, the text says, “If one eats knowing that it was prepared for the benefit of others, it is a misdeed.

original: mi shes pa la ni ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi shes pa la ni ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one does not know, there is no offense.”

original: rang gi chos med pa la ji lta bu'i rnam par nye bar 'tshe ba lta bu ni gzhan gyi chos la ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi chos med pa la ji lta bu'i rnam par nye bar 'tshe ba lta bu ni gzhan gyi chos la ma yin te /
translated: It is not like the harm that one’s own Dharma has, for the harm of another’s Dharma is not like that.

original: gang gi phyir yang ba ni 'di yin te de bas na 'di shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang ba ni 'di yin te de bas na 'di shes pa'o //
translated: Because it is light, it is known to be like this.

original: bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na byin cig ces zer ba yang ngo zhes bya ba ni byin cig ces bya ba 'di ltar na smad pa nyid byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na byin cig ces zer ba yang ngo zhes bya ba ni byin cig ces bya ba 'di ltar na smad pa nyid byas pa nyid do //
translated: When he enters for alms, he should say, Give! and he should say, Give! in this way, he is censured.

original: ci'i don du byin cig ces brjod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i don du byin cig ces brjod pa yin zhe na /
translated: For what purpose should he say, Give!?

original: de'i phyir bsod snyoms la zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsod snyoms la zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, for alms.

original: gnas skabs gang la ltung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gnas skabs gang la ltung ba yin zhe na /
translated: In what state is there a downfall?

original: de'i phyir zhugs pa na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhugs pa na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, when he enters.

original: bsod snyoms la zhes bya ba sbyar ro //
analyzed: bsod snyoms la zhes bya ba sbyar ro //
translated: It is connected with for alms.

original: khyim gyi nang du zhes bya ba shugs kyis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: khyim gyi nang du zhes bya ba shugs kyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood by implication that in a house.

original: khyim gyi nang du bsod snyoms kyi phyir zhugs pa la ltung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don bsdus pa dang / byin cig ces bya ba yang brjod pa la na smad pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyim gyi nang du bsod snyoms kyi phyir zhugs pa la ltung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don bsdus pa dang / byin cig ces bya ba yang brjod pa la na smad pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is summarized as when he enters a house for alms, there is a downfall. The meaning of he should say, 'Give!' and he should say, 'Give!' in this way, he is censured.🔽Here, the text for confessing the first [downfall] is:

original: 'dir dang po bshags par bya ba'i gzhung ni zhu ba las bcun pa re zhig dge slong bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na /
analyzed: 'dir dang po bshags par bya ba'i gzhung ni zhu ba las bcun pa re zhig dge slong bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na /
translated: In the Questions of Upāli, it says, First, when a monk enters for alms,🔽he should not enter a house with a mind of desire.

original: de na dge slong ma zhig khyim bdag la 'di skad ces dge slong 'di la bsod snyoms byin cig ces mchi zhing dge slong des kyang de blangs te 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: de na dge slong ma zhig khyim bdag la 'di skad ces dge slong 'di la bsod snyoms byin cig ces mchi zhing dge slong des kyang de blangs te 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: A nun said to a householder, “Give alms food to this monk.” The monk accepted it and ate it. What is the offense?

original: nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “It is an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: sbyor du bcug pa la rigs 'dri ba 'di ni tshig yin te /
analyzed: sbyor du bcug pa la rigs 'dri ba 'di ni tshig yin te /
translated: This is the text for asking about the kind of family that has been engaged.

original: de'i phyir 'di dang 'brel ba nyid la kha na ma tho ba 'di la de dang 'brel pa nyid ces bya ba 'dir grags pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dang 'brel ba nyid la kha na ma tho ba 'di la de dang 'brel pa nyid ces bya ba 'dir grags pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is well known as “the offense of being related to that person” in the sense of being related to that person.

original: dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: It is a downfall to engage a nun.

original: // / khyim gzhan du yang zan la bos pa dang du blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / khyim gzhan du yang zan la bos pa dang du blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: “You should accept an invitation to a meal in another’s house.”

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gtsug lag khang 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi khyim gzhan du yang ngo zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gtsug lag khang 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi khyim gzhan du yang ngo zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: The word “also” indicates that it is not only in a monastery, but also in another’s house.

original: gnas mal gyi @207b ltung byed las 'di la sogs pa skom gyi phyir zhes bya ba'i bar du 'di drangs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas mal gyi @207b ltung byed las 'di la sogs pa skom gyi phyir zhes bya ba'i bar du 'di drangs pa'o //
translated: This is cited in the downfall of sleeping in the same place as a monk, up to “for the sake of drink.”

original: dus shes par bya ste 'jug par bya'i snga tshoms su mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir khyim gzhan du gang du bos pa 'di dang du blangs par gyur na zhes bya ba de ma thag pa las rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dus shes par bya ste 'jug par bya'i snga tshoms su mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir khyim gzhan du gang du bos pa 'di dang du blangs par gyur na zhes bya ba de ma thag pa las rtogs pa'o //
translated: “One should know the time and enter, not before.” Here, “if one is invited to another’s house” is understood from the immediately preceding passage.

original: ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de'i phyir gand'i brdungs te rang gi 'khor la blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gand'i brdungs te rang gi 'khor la blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “Having struck the ghaṇṭā, one should look at one’s retinue.”

original: khyim gzhan du mgron du bos pa la'o //
analyzed: khyim gzhan du mgron du bos pa la'o //
translated: This is for one who is invited as a guest to another’s house.

original: glo bur du 'ongs pa la ni gnas brtan gyis so zhes bya ba ni 'khor de la gnas brtan gang yin pa des blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don gyis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: glo bur du 'ongs pa la ni gnas brtan gyis so zhes bya ba ni 'khor de la gnas brtan gang yin pa des blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don gyis rtogs pa'o //
translated: “The elder should look at the one who has come suddenly.” This is understood by the meaning of “the elder who is in that retinue should look.”

original: 'dir dge 'dun gyis gnas pa brtan la gnas brtan du brjod pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir dge 'dun gyis gnas pa brtan la gnas brtan du brjod pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the saṅgha is called the elder who is firm in the practice.

original: de bas na 'dir gzhung ni yid ches pa'i 'khor gyi nang du spyod pa'i dge slong gi 'khor la bltas te 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir gzhung ni yid ches pa'i 'khor gyi nang du spyod pa'i dge slong gi 'khor la bltas te 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, here the text is looking at the retinue of monks who are practicing in a retinue of trustworthy people.

original: gang zhig dge slong glo bur du 'ongs pa de la ni dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig dge slong glo bur du 'ongs pa de la ni dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is said that the elder of the saṅgha should look after any monk who is a newcomer.

original: gya tshom du zan gcad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gya tshom du zan gcad par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not fast out of recklessness.

original: skom gyi phyir gsol ba dag 'debs na bsdad par bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: skom gyi phyir gsol ba dag 'debs na bsdad par bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If one is asked for water, one should stay.

original: yang yang za ba'i ltung byed la byed pa po gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang yang za ba'i ltung byed la byed pa po gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the agent of the downfall of eating again?

original: de'i phyir cig car yang rung phyis kyang rung ste gos kyi rnyed pa med pa'i mgron du bos pa rnyed pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir cig car yang rung phyis kyang rung ste gos kyi rnyed pa med pa'i mgron du bos pa rnyed pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “whether at the same time or later, it is the obtaining of an invitation to a meal without the acquisition of cloth.”

original: gos kyi rnyed pa med pa'i mgron du bos pa gnyis pa rnyed pa ni byed pa po yin te /
analyzed: gos kyi rnyed pa med pa'i mgron du bos pa gnyis pa rnyed pa ni byed pa po yin te /
translated: The agent is the obtaining of a second invitation to a meal without the acquisition of cloth.

original: cig car ram dus gang la mgron du bos pa gcig la rnyed pa de nyid la yang rnyed pa gzhan gyi phyi nas so zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽cig car dang du len par byed pa la gnyis ka la yang gal te gos med pa nyid yin na gang la phyis bza' ba mthong ba de las chos nyid kyis nyes byas bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: cig car ram dus gang la mgron du bos pa gcig la rnyed pa de nyid la yang rnyed pa gzhan gyi phyi nas so zhes bya ba'i don to // cig car dang du len par byed pa la gnyis ka la yang gal te gos med pa nyid yin na gang la phyis bza' ba mthong ba de las chos nyid kyis nyes byas bskyed pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that the one who is invited at one time or another to a meal obtains the other meals after that.🔽If both are without robes, then the one who sees the meal later generates an offense by natural law.

original: gal te gcig la gos med pa zhes bya ba rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te gcig la gos med pa zhes bya ba rig par bya'o //
translated: If one is with a robe and the other is without a robe, it should be understood that the one with a robe is not at fault.

original: 'dir gos dang bcas pa dang gos med pa dang gos dang bcas shing gos kyi rin dang yang bcas pa yang /
analyzed: 'dir gos dang bcas pa dang gos med pa dang gos dang bcas shing gos kyi rin dang yang bcas pa yang /
translated: Here, one with a robe, one without a robe, one with a robe and the price of a robe, and one without a robe and not the price of a robe.

original: gos med cing gos kyi rin yang med pa rnam pa bzhis ltung ba bstan par mdzad do //🔽de la gos dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni gos dang bcas pa gzhan nas 'dir gos la bos pa'o //
analyzed: gos med cing gos kyi rin yang med pa rnam pa bzhis ltung ba bstan par mdzad do // de la gos dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni gos dang bcas pa gzhan nas 'dir gos la bos pa'o //
translated: The four types of downfalls are taught.🔽Among them, one with a robe is one who has a robe, but is called here with a robe.

original: gos med pa zhes bya ba ni gos dang bcas pa gzhan nas 'dir gos med pa la bos pa'o //
analyzed: gos med pa zhes bya ba ni gos dang bcas pa gzhan nas 'dir gos med pa la bos pa'o //
translated: One without a robe is one who has a robe, but is called here without a robe.

original: gos dang bcas shing gos kyi rin dang yang bcas pa dang / gos med cing gos kyi rin yang med pa gnyis ka @208a * //
analyzed: gos dang bcas shing gos kyi rin dang yang bcas pa dang / gos med cing gos kyi rin yang med pa gnyis ka @208a * //
translated: one who has the robe, but not the price of the robe; and one who has neither the robe nor the price of the robe.

original: brtsams pa yin te /
analyzed: brtsams pa yin te /
translated: The author of the treatise

original: de ni 'dir mi 'dus par shes par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dir mi 'dus par shes par mi bya'o //
translated: should not be understood to be referring to this case.🔽The point here is that one who has a single robe, or many robes, or any robe,

original: gos gcig pa yin mod du ma 'am gang yang rung ba gos dang bcas pa nyid kyi 'dir dgos pa'o //
analyzed: gos gcig pa yin mod du ma 'am gang yang rung ba gos dang bcas pa nyid kyi 'dir dgos pa'o //
translated: is one who has the robe.

original: de bas na de la 'di bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na de la 'di bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this is what is being taught here.

original: kha cig ni gos dang bcas shing gos kyi rin dang yang bcas pa zhes bya ba dang / gos med cing rin yang med pa zhes bya ba la rnam pa gnyis po 'di dag la gos kyi rin zhes bya ba ni gos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba smras pa yin te /
analyzed: kha cig ni gos dang bcas shing gos kyi rin dang yang bcas pa zhes bya ba dang / gos med cing rin yang med pa zhes bya ba la rnam pa gnyis po 'di dag la gos kyi rin zhes bya ba ni gos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba smras pa yin te /
translated: Some say that the two types, one who has the robe but not the price of the robe, and one who has neither the robe nor the price of the robe, are called one who has the robe and one who has the price of the robe.

original: 'dis kyang gos dang bcas pa nyid rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis kyang gos dang bcas pa nyid rig par bya'o //
translated: This also should be understood as one who has the robe.

original: de bas na de la 'di bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na de la 'di bstan pa ste /
translated: Therefore, this is what is being taught here.

original: de yang 'dir bsdus par shes par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'dir bsdus par shes par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: And that should not be understood as included here.

original: gos brtag pa nyid kyis de'i rin thang bzung ba ste /
analyzed: gos brtag pa nyid kyis de'i rin thang bzung ba ste /
translated: The value of the gift is determined by the quality of the cloth.

original: zas tsam la brten nas slar mgron du bos pa la 'dod pa tshol bar mngon pa yin gyi /
analyzed: zas tsam la brten nas slar mgron du bos pa la 'dod pa tshol bar mngon pa yin gyi /
translated: If he accepts the invitation to a meal, he is obviously seeking a better offer.

original: rnyed pa gzhan la brten nas 'jug pa la 'di skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa gzhan la brten nas 'jug pa la 'di skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: But if he accepts another gift, he is not seeking a better offer.

original: ci zhig la mgron du bos pa la yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig la mgron du bos pa la yin zhe na /
translated: With regard to the phrase “to an invitation,”

original: de'i phyir bza' bar bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bza' bar bya'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: the text adds “to a meal.”

original: ji ltar la yin na de'i phyir lnga'i khongs su gtogs pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar la yin na de'i phyir lnga'i khongs su gtogs pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: With regard to the phrase “to a meal,” the text adds “to one of the five kinds of meals.”

original: 'bras chan dang zan dron dang lde dgu dang sha dang snum khur zhes bya ba lnga po gang yang rung ba la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras chan dang zan dron dang lde dgu dang sha dang snum khur zhes bya ba lnga po gang yang rung ba la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The five kinds of meals are: cooked grain, porridge, flour cakes, meat, and pastries.

original: mgron du bos pa snga ma las gnyis pa'i rnyed pa byed pa po yin zhe na /
analyzed: mgron du bos pa snga ma las gnyis pa'i rnyed pa byed pa po yin zhe na /
translated: If the monk who has accepted the invitation to a meal obtains a better offer, does he commit an offense?

original: de'i phyir gal te gzhan yang de nyid yin na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te gzhan yang de nyid yin na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says, “If he obtains another, he commits an offense.”

original: gal te bza' bar bya ba de nyid kyi khongs su gtogs pa lnga pos dang por mgron du bos pa rnyed pa de la ni byed pa po nyid yin la gal te de nyid ma yin na ltung ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te bza' bar bya ba de nyid kyi khongs su gtogs pa lnga pos dang por mgron du bos pa rnyed pa de la ni byed pa po nyid yin la gal te de nyid ma yin na ltung ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If the food that is to be eaten is included in the five that were first invited, then it is the agent. If it is not that, there is no downfall. This is the meaning.🔽Here the text is as follows:

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa re zhig dge slong sngar bza' ba ma lags pa la g-yar drangs na /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa re zhig dge slong sngar bza' ba ma lags pa la g-yar drangs na /
translated: “Venerable, if a monk is first invited to eat non-food,

original: de slad kyis bza' ba la g-yar drangs te des de 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur nye ba 'khor ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de slad kyis bza' ba la g-yar drangs te des de 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur nye ba 'khor ltung ba med do //
translated: and later is invited to eat food, and he eats that, what downfall does he incur?”🔽“Upāli, there is no downfall.”

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong bza' ba lnga po rnams ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i bza' ba dag la sngar g-yar drangs nas de slad kyis bza' ba lnga po rnams la g-yar drangs te nges de 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong bza' ba lnga po rnams ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i bza' ba dag la sngar g-yar drangs nas de slad kyis bza' ba lnga po rnams la g-yar drangs te nges de 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: “Venerable, if a monk is first invited to eat food other than the five foods, and later is invited to eat the five foods, and he eats that, what downfall does he incur?”

original: nye ba 'khor ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Upāli, there is no downfall.”

original: ci thams cad la ltung ba 'di byed pa po yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci thams cad la ltung ba 'di byed pa po yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is this downfall incurred by all?

original: de'i phyir na ba ma yin pa dang las ma byas pa dang / lam du ma song ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir na ba ma yin pa dang las ma byas pa dang / lam du ma song ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “not if one is sick, not if one has not done the action, not if one is on the road.”

original: na ba la sogs par gnas pa'i dus @208b dang ldan pa rnams la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: na ba la sogs par gnas pa'i dus @208b dang ldan pa rnams la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no downfall for those who are sick and so forth, when they are in that state.

original: gnas pa ma yin pa'i dus thams cad la ni nye byas so zhes gsungs pa mi gnas pa'i dus la nyes byas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnas pa ma yin pa'i dus thams cad la ni nye byas so zhes gsungs pa mi gnas pa'i dus la nyes byas zhes bya ste /
translated: It is said that there is an offense for all times that are not the proper occasion.

original: de bas na nyes byas so gtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na nyes byas so gtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that it is an offense that is included in the category of wrong actions.

original: rnyed pa gang la gang gi byed pa po yin zhe na /
analyzed: rnyed pa gang la gang gi byed pa po yin zhe na /
translated: With regard to the acquisition of a downfall, what is the agent?

original: de blangs na nyes byas kyi'o //
analyzed: de blangs na nyes byas kyi'o //
translated: It says, “if one accepts it, it is a wrong action;

original: zos na dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zos na dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: if one eats it, it is a root downfall.”

original: dang du blangs yid kyi yin pa'i phyir de ni bsdam par bya ba'i nyes byas su gsungs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dang du blangs yid kyi yin pa'i phyir de ni bsdam par bya ba'i nyes byas su gsungs par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that it is said to be a wrong action that is to be restrained because it is an offense that is accepted by the mind.

original: 'dir khar za ba'i mdun rol du 'gro ba la sogs pa rjes su bsgrub pa bstan par bya ba rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir khar za ba'i mdun rol du 'gro ba la sogs pa rjes su bsgrub pa bstan par bya ba rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Here, it should be understood that the subsequent practice is taught, such as going in front of a person who is eating.

original: 'dir gos kyi mthar gyur pa ni khru gang gi khyon no zhes bya ba ni 'di las chung ba'i chos gos dang ldan pa la bos pa ni gos med pa nyid ni 'dir dngos gzhi kho na ste /
analyzed: 'dir gos kyi mthar gyur pa ni khru gang gi khyon no zhes bya ba ni 'di las chung ba'i chos gos dang ldan pa la bos pa ni gos med pa nyid ni 'dir dngos gzhi kho na ste /
translated: Here, the end of the robe is one cubit in size. One who possesses a Dharma robe smaller than this is called without a robe. Here, the actual basis is just that.

original: de bas 'di la 'di byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas 'di la 'di byed pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is done for that.

original: ji tsam du spang ba'i byed pa po de nyid de tsam la gzhan du yang yan lag nyid de bas na de la 'di bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ji tsam du spang ba'i byed pa po de nyid de tsam la gzhan du yang yan lag nyid de bas na de la 'di bstan pa yin no //
translated: To the extent that there is the act of abandoning, to that extent there is also a branch. Therefore, this is taught for that.

original: de'i phyir gos sbyin par bya ba dang gos bya ba la sogs pa la yang 'di tsam la mthar thug par 'gyur ba nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gos sbyin par bya ba dang gos bya ba la sogs pa la yang 'di tsam la mthar thug par 'gyur ba nyid du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in giving a robe, making a robe, and so on, it should be understood that this is the limit.

original: chung ba nyid sbyin pa dang byed pa la nyes byas su rnam par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: chung ba nyid sbyin pa dang byed pa la nyes byas su rnam par gnas pa yin te /
translated: In giving and making something smaller, it is established as a minor offense.

original: 'dir ni dngos gzhi kho na'o zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni dngos gzhi kho na'o zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, it should be understood that it is only the actual basis.

original: lam ni dpag tshad phyed do zhes bya ba ni 'dir las 'di ni mthar thug par gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: lam ni dpag tshad phyed do zhes bya ba ni 'dir las 'di ni mthar thug par gyur pa nyid do //
translated: This is the limit of the path.

original: gzhan la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni yang yang za ba las gzhan pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi dag la 'dus shing za ba la sogs pa'i don du 'di yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni yang yang za ba las gzhan pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi dag la 'dus shing za ba la sogs pa'i don du 'di yin no //
translated: Also in other cases means that this is the limit of the path for the other bases of training, such as eating while socializing.

original: 'dir ram gyur 'gro ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dir ram gyur 'gro ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here or on the way.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni lam la ste /
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni lam la ste /
translated: Here means on the path.

original: thang gi lam nyid kyi yul la 'di'i mthar thug par gyur pa'i lam gyi tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: thang gi lam nyid kyi yul la 'di'i mthar thug par gyur pa'i lam gyi tshad ma yin no //
translated: This is the limit of the path in terms of the place of the path on the plain.

original: 'on kyang gyur 'gro ba la yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang gyur 'gro ba la yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: However, it is also on the way means that it is also on the way to the place.

original: las kyi ngo bo ci zhig yin zhe na /🔽de'i phyir las ni phyag dar re lde tsam mam /
analyzed: las kyi ngo bo ci zhig yin zhe na / de'i phyir las ni phyag dar re lde tsam mam /
translated: What is the nature of the action?

original: dkyil 'khor ba mal tsam yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ba mal tsam yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, the action is the size of a handspan or a mat.

original: 'di ni las kyi mthar gyur pa'i tshad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni las kyi mthar gyur pa'i tshad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the limit of the action.

original: gzhan la yang ngo zhes bya ba 'di sbyar bar bya'o ;
analyzed: gzhan la yang ngo zhes bya ba 'di sbyar bar bya'o ;
translated: Also in other cases means that this should be applied to other cases.

original: / de yang dge 'dun nyid dam mchod rten nyid na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / de yang dge 'dun nyid dam mchod rten nyid na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Moreover, it is in the Saṅgha or in the caitya.

original: las 'di'i rab tu dbye ba 'di dag rig par bya'o //
analyzed: las 'di'i rab tu dbye ba 'di dag rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the analysis of this action.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i yan lag 'di brjod pa shes par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i yan lag 'di brjod pa shes par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement: “One should know the expression of this limb in this way.”

original: na ba nyid kyi tshad ni mi nus pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan la yang ngo zhes bya ba 'dir yang sbyar bar bya'o//
analyzed: na ba nyid kyi tshad ni mi nus pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan la yang ngo zhes bya ba 'dir yang sbyar bar bya'o//
translated: The measure of sickness is the inability to do anything.

original: @209a * // bshams pa ni mgron du bos pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: @209a * // bshams pa ni mgron du bos pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The meaning of the statement: “One who is invited is not invited” is this:

original: gang zhig gtan du ba'am bar ma las byung ba bshams par gyur pa de ni bos par rtogs par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gtan du ba'am bar ma las byung ba bshams par gyur pa de ni bos par rtogs par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: One who is invited for a long time or for a short time is not to be understood as invited.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las /
translated: Here is the text of some questioners:

original: mngon par lhag pa zos na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: mngon par lhag pa zos na ltung ba med do //
translated: “There is no offense if one eats what is left over after serving.”

original: mngon par lhag pa zhes bya ba ni dge slong la bshams pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po la brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon par lhag pa zhes bya ba ni dge slong la bshams pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po la brjod pa yin te /
translated: “What is left over” is said to be the heap of merit that is set out for a monk.

original: de zos pa na ltung ba med ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de zos pa na ltung ba med ces bya ba'o //
translated: There is no offense if one eats that.

original: dge slong gi phyir bshams pa ni dge slong la bshams pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi phyir bshams pa ni dge slong la bshams pa'o //
translated: “Arranged for a monk” means arranged for a monk.

original: kun du lta ba yang ngo zhes bya ba ni yang mgron du bos pa nyid ma yin pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang ngam bshes pa'i dbang gis 'bod pa nyid ni kun du lta ba'o //🔽'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las spyan gzigs sam gsol la gcugs tshod tsam gzhan du gsol cig ces zer ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: kun du lta ba yang ngo zhes bya ba ni yang mgron du bos pa nyid ma yin pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang ngam bshes pa'i dbang gis 'bod pa nyid ni kun du lta ba'o // 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las spyan gzigs sam gsol la gcugs tshod tsam gzhan du gsol cig ces zer ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: “Also looking around” means not just invited, but invited by the power of worldly convention or the power of friendship.🔽Here the text says, “If someone says to a monk, ‘Please eat at my house,’ and the monk replies, ‘I will eat at the house of whoever invites me,’ then there is no offense.

original: 'di nyid du dge slong gsol zhing gzhan 'tshol bar byed na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: 'di nyid du dge slong gsol zhing gzhan 'tshol bar byed na ltung ba med do //
translated: If a monk asks for food here and seeks more elsewhere, there is no offense.

original: 'di nyid du dge slong bsod snyoms tsam po 'tshol zhing lhag ma gzhan nas tshol bar byed na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid du dge slong bsod snyoms tsam po 'tshol zhing lhag ma gzhan nas tshol bar byed na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If a monk seeks almsfood here and seeks the rest elsewhere, there is no offense.”

original: yang yang za ba la ni nyes pa med pa'i tshig 'di yin gyi thams cad du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang yang za ba la ni nyes pa med pa'i tshig 'di yin gyi thams cad du ni ma yin no //
translated: This is the text that states that there is no offense for eating again and again, but not for everything.

original: dgag dbye nyid yod par gyur pa la stang cig la za ba las 'da' bar byed pa'i ltung ba las ldang ba yod pa yin no //
analyzed: dgag dbye nyid yod par gyur pa la stang cig la za ba las 'da' bar byed pa'i ltung ba las ldang ba yod pa yin no //
translated: If the lifting of restrictions itself exists, then there is the arising of a downfall that transgresses the rule of eating at one time.

original: mgron du bos pa gzhan yod na zan blang ba la spang ba bsrung zhing 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: mgron du bos pa gzhan yod na zan blang ba la spang ba bsrung zhing 'jug par bya'o //
translated: If there is another invitation, one should guard against abandoning the first and should enter the second.

original: tho 'tshams pas byas pa ni ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni mgron du bos pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: tho 'tshams pas byas pa ni ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni mgron du bos pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is not the case that it is done by one who is hostile.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa re zhig dge slong sngar tho 'tshams pa'i rtog pa can gyis g-yar drangs par gyur nas slad kyi tha mal pa'i gnas skabs su g-yar drangs pa gzhan rnyed cing de 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa re zhig dge slong sngar tho 'tshams pa'i rtog pa can gyis g-yar drangs par gyur nas slad kyi tha mal pa'i gnas skabs su g-yar drangs pa gzhan rnyed cing de 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: The text here is as follows: “Lord, if a monk who is hostile and suspicious is invited first, and later another who is in a normal state is invited and he eats that food, what is the offense?”

original: nye ba 'khor ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Upāli, there is no offense.”

original: thob 'tshams pa'i rtog pa zhes bya ba ni tho 'tshams pa'i rtog pa ste gzhan la zhes bya ba 'di nyams pa'o //
analyzed: thob 'tshams pa'i rtog pa zhes bya ba ni tho 'tshams pa'i rtog pa ste gzhan la zhes bya ba 'di nyams pa'o //
translated: “Hostile and suspicious” means hostile and suspicious of others.

original: mi rung ba zhes bya ba ni byas pa la med pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi rung ba zhes bya ba ni byas pa la med pa nyid do //
translated: The term improper means not existing in the object of the action.

original: de bas na bos pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni bza' bar bya ba mi rung ba nyid kyi phyir skyes par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na bos pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni bza' bar bya ba mi rung ba nyid kyi phyir skyes par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the word also means that the monk is understood to be improper because he is not fit to be eaten.

original: de'i phyir ma yin par dge 'dun yang ngo zhes bya ba ni de la brten nas dge 'dun spyan drangs pa de'i med pa nyid na de'i phyir rnam par gcad par bya ba la mngon par brten pa nyid kyi @209b phyir gzhan la ni med pa nyid do
analyzed: de'i phyir ma yin par dge 'dun yang ngo zhes bya ba ni de la brten nas dge 'dun spyan drangs pa de'i med pa nyid na de'i phyir rnam par gcad par bya ba la mngon par brten pa nyid kyi @209b phyir gzhan la ni med pa nyid do
translated: Therefore, the word also means that the Saṅgha is not fit to be invited, because the Saṅgha is invited in dependence on him. Since he does not exist, the Saṅgha is not invited because of the absence of the basis.

original: // 'dir khungs ni gang gi phyir 'phags pa legs 'ongs kyi phyir te /
analyzed: // 'dir khungs ni gang gi phyir 'phags pa legs 'ongs kyi phyir te /
translated: Here, the source is because of the noble one's welcome.

original: gang de la brten na chu srin byis pa gsod kyi ri pa rnams kyis dge 'dun spyan 'dren pa la bram ze spyan drangs par gyur pas bram ze rnams 'ongs nas byis pa gsod pa'i ri pa'i bram ze dang khyim bdag rnams kyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa
analyzed: gang de la brten na chu srin byis pa gsod kyi ri pa rnams kyis dge 'dun spyan 'dren pa la bram ze spyan drangs par gyur pas bram ze rnams 'ongs nas byis pa gsod pa'i ri pa'i bram ze dang khyim bdag rnams kyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa
translated: Because of that, the Saṅgha was invited by the Makaras, but the brahmins invited the brahmins. When the brahmins came, the Makara brahmins and householders invited the Buddha and the Saṅgha.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun zhag bdun bshos la spyan drangs pas de'i tshe bas dang du ma blangs so zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun zhag bdun bshos la spyan drangs pas de'i tshe bas dang du ma blangs so zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The Buddha said, I have not accepted food for seven days because I invited the community of monks to a meal.

original: de'i phyir mdo 'di byas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo 'di byas so //
translated: Therefore, this sūtra was composed.

original: dgag dbye so sor rjes su gnang ba dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dgag dbye so sor rjes su gnang ba dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It should be applied to the permission for the individual observance day ceremony.

original: gzhan du lnga po 'jog pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni mgron du bos pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan du lnga po 'jog pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni mgron du bos pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The other five are also set aside, means that it is not an invitation.

original: sil bu dag las dang po lnga po zhes bya ba 'di brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: sil bu dag las dang po lnga po zhes bya ba 'di brjod pa yin te /
translated: From the scattered texts, the first five are mentioned.

original: de bas na gzhung ni yi ge gzhan las dge slong bca' ba dang bza' ba'i zan gnyis dang mgron du bos pas gcig dge slong la rnam par rtog par byed na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de bas na gzhung ni yi ge gzhan las dge slong bca' ba dang bza' ba'i zan gnyis dang mgron du bos pas gcig dge slong la rnam par rtog par byed na ltung ba med do //
translated: Therefore, the text is from another source. If a monk thinks about two meals of cooked food and one invitation, there is no offense.

original: dge slong ma la rnam par rtog par byed na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: dge slong ma la rnam par rtog par byed na ltung ba med do //
translated: If he thinks about a nun, there is no offense.

original: de bzhin du dge slob ma dang dge tshul ma la rnam par rtog par byed na yang ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slob ma dang dge tshul ma la rnam par rtog par byed na yang ltung ba med do //
translated: Similarly, if he thinks about a female novice trainee or a female novice, there is no offense.

original: de bzhin du sde pa lnga po thams cad la rnam par rtog par byed na yang ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sde pa lnga po thams cad la rnam par rtog par byed na yang ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, if one analyzes all five orders, there is no offense.

original: sil bu dag las kyang dge slong dang dge slong ma dang dge slob ma dang dge tshul dang dge tshul ma rnams las 'dir lnga nyid kyi tshig gis gsungs so //
analyzed: sil bu dag las kyang dge slong dang dge slong ma dang dge slob ma dang dge tshul dang dge tshul ma rnams las 'dir lnga nyid kyi tshig gis gsungs so //
translated: And in the Ksudraka Collection, it says, “Here, the five are stated: monks, nuns, probationary nuns, novices, and female novices.”

original: 'phags pa 'di byed par mi rigs so zhe na 'dir brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'di byed par mi rigs so zhe na 'dir brjod par bya ste /
translated: If you say that this is not the practice of the noble ones, then we reply:🔽It is proper for one who is righteous.

original: de ni chos dang ldan pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni ci zhan la bos pas gzung bar 'dod pa nyid med pa la 'di rigs pa nyid yin nam 'on te yod pa la yang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ni chos dang ldan pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni ci zhan la bos pas gzung bar 'dod pa nyid med pa la 'di rigs pa nyid yin nam 'on te yod pa la yang yin zhe na /
translated: If you ask whether it is proper only for one who is not invited to accept an invitation, or whether it is proper for one who is invited to accept another invitation,

original: de'i phyir gzhan blang pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan blang pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then we reply: It is proper for one who accepts another invitation.

original: mgron du bos pa gzhan blang ba yod pa la 'jog pa la chos dang ldan pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mgron du bos pa gzhan blang ba yod pa la 'jog pa la chos dang ldan pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is proper for one who is invited to accept another invitation.

original: mu ge byung na mgron du bos pa ji snyed byung ba dag bdag gir bya'o zhes bya ba ni snga ma snga ma bzhag kyang ji snyed byung ba de snyed rnams la'o //
analyzed: mu ge byung na mgron du bos pa ji snyed byung ba dag bdag gir bya'o zhes bya ba ni snga ma snga ma bzhag kyang ji snyed byung ba de snyed rnams la'o //
translated: “If there is famine, I will take as many as come as guests” means that even if the previous ones are set aside, it is for as many as come.

original: zos nas yang ngo zhes bya ba ni mgron du bos pa ji snyed byung ba'i spyan drangs pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: zos nas yang ngo zhes bya ba ni mgron du bos pa ji snyed byung ba'i spyan drangs pa rnams la'o //
translated: “After eating, again” means for as many as come as invited guests.

original: sbyin du yang rung ngo zhes bya ba ni lnga po lnga po zhes sngar bstan pa'i rjes su 'brengs te shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin du yang rung ngo zhes bya ba ni lnga po lnga po zhes sngar bstan pa'i rjes su 'brengs te shes par bya'o //
translated: “It is also suitable to give” should be understood as following the previous explanation of “five by five.”

original: sbyin pa po mngon par mi dga' bar 'gyur ba lta na kham gnyis sam gsum zos pa'i 'og tu khyim bdag dge @210a * //
analyzed: sbyin pa po mngon par mi dga' bar 'gyur ba lta na kham gnyis sam gsum zos pa'i 'og tu khyim bdag dge @210a * //
translated: “If the donor becomes displeased” means that after eating two or three mouthfuls, the householder should be pleased by saying,

original: slong 'di bsod snyoms kyis phongs pa yin gyi rjes su yi rang bar gyis shig dang 'di la sbyin par bya'o zhes mngon par dga' bar byas nas so zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa pho de lnga po dag la sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: slong 'di bsod snyoms kyis phongs pa yin gyi rjes su yi rang bar gyis shig dang 'di la sbyin par bya'o zhes mngon par dga' bar byas nas so zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa pho de lnga po dag la sbyin pa'o //
translated: “This monk is in need of alms, so rejoice and give to him.” This is giving to the five by the donor.

original: yang yang za ba'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: yang yang za ba'i ltung byed do /
translated: The second offense of eating again is a result of eating again after eating.

original: // /'dug gnas su za ba'i ltung byed la byed pa po gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: // /'dug gnas su za ba'i ltung byed la byed pa po gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the agent of the downfall of eating in a dwelling?

original: de'i phyir chos 'di pa'i ma yin pa bdag po khyim pa dang bcas pa ya mtshan can thams cad ma yin pa'i 'dug gnas so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos 'di pa'i ma yin pa bdag po khyim pa dang bcas pa ya mtshan can thams cad ma yin pa'i 'dug gnas so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “It is not a Buddhist, but a non-Buddhist, a householder, or a heretic, in a dwelling.”

original: chos 'di la zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos 'dul bar bya ba gang yin pa de ni chos 'di pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'di la zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos 'dul bar bya ba gang yin pa de ni chos 'di pa'o //
translated: “In this Dharma” means that one who is to be disciplined by the Buddha’s Dharma is a Buddhist.

original: de las gzhan pa ni chos 'di pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni chos 'di pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: One who is other than that is not a Buddhist.

original: bdag po khyim pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag po khyim pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “A householder” means

original: bdag po khyim pa dang lhan cig 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni bdag po khyim pa dang bcas pa'i 'dug gnas so //
analyzed: bdag po khyim pa dang lhan cig 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni bdag po khyim pa dang bcas pa'i 'dug gnas so //
translated: that a dwelling where a householder is present is a dwelling with a householder.

original: rang bzhin can yang bdag tu byas nas sbyin pa'am byed du 'jug pa la 'dir nyes pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin can yang bdag tu byas nas sbyin pa'am byed du 'jug pa la 'dir nyes pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Here, the fault is established for one who gives or causes to be given to a householder, taking him to be a natural Buddhist.

original: de bas na khyim pas byed du 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na khyim pas byed du 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the phrase “caused by a householder” is used.

original: ya mtshan can thams cad ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni ya mtshan can thams cad la 'dir chos 'di pa nyid kyang yod pas nyes pa byed pa po nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: ya mtshan can thams cad ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni ya mtshan can thams cad la 'dir chos 'di pa nyid kyang yod pas nyes pa byed pa po nyid ma yin no //
translated: Not all wondrous people are so, because even those who are Dharma practitioners here may be so. Therefore, they are not the ones who commit the offense.

original: 'dug gnas so zhes bya ba ni 'di las 'dir byed pa po rnams zhes bya ba 'di las yongs su gyur pa la so sor nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dug gnas so zhes bya ba ni 'di las 'dir byed pa po rnams zhes bya ba 'di las yongs su gyur pa la so sor nye bar gnas pa'o //
translated: The dwelling is the place where the one who does this is fully transformed and resides individually.

original: ltung ba 'byin par byed pa ji lta bu la de byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ltung ba 'byin par byed pa ji lta bu la de byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
translated: What kind of one who causes the downfall is the one who does this?

original: de'i phyir mi na ba la'o zhes sbyin bdag gis ma bstabs pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi na ba la'o zhes sbyin bdag gis ma bstabs pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, not when sick, meaning not when the host has not offered.

original: 'di ni yid kyi bya ba ste de la yongs su longs spyod pa ma yin pa rnams la ma bstabs pa gang yin pa 'di der ya mtshan can thams cad dang 'dra bar 'dir nyes mi skyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yid kyi bya ba ste de la yongs su longs spyod pa ma yin pa rnams la ma bstabs pa gang yin pa 'di der ya mtshan can thams cad dang 'dra bar 'dir nyes mi skyed pa'o //
translated: This is a mental action. There is no offense for those who do not fully enjoy it, and for those who do not accept it, like all wondrous people here.

original: phyir mi 'byung ba la cho ga 'di dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: phyir mi 'byung ba la cho ga 'di dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The one who has this rule does not return.

original: phyir 'byung ba la ni sbyin bdag phyug po med pas bstabs pa nyid la yang dngos gzhi kho na ste gzhan la brten pa ni 'dir skyon yin te /
analyzed: phyir 'byung ba la ni sbyin bdag phyug po med pas bstabs pa nyid la yang dngos gzhi kho na ste gzhan la brten pa ni 'dir skyon yin te /
translated: Since there is no wealthy patron for the return, the actual basis is just the offering itself.

original: de yongs su gsal ba'i don du bslab pa'i gzhi 'di yin no //
analyzed: de yongs su gsal ba'i don du bslab pa'i gzhi 'di yin no //
translated: This is the basis of training for the purpose of clarifying that.

original: 'dir gang du gang la byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir gang du gang la byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Here, where is one the actual perpetrator?

original: de'i phyir zos na zos pa la dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zos na zos pa la dngos gzhi'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “If one eats, it is the actual basis for eating.”

original: gnas na zhag lon pa la nyes byas kyi'o zhes bya ba smos te /🔽de'i bsod snyoms gcig za zhing gnyis pa za ba la dngos gzhi'i byed pa po nyid do //
analyzed: gnas na zhag lon pa la nyes byas kyi'o zhes bya ba smos te / de'i bsod snyoms gcig za zhing gnyis pa za ba la dngos gzhi'i byed pa po nyid do //
translated: If one stays, it is a misdeed for staying overnight.🔽One is the actual perpetrator of the actual basis for eating one’s alms and the second is the actual perpetrator of the misdeed for staying overnight on the second day.

original: zhag gcig lon pa'i nyi ma gnyis @210b pa la nyes byas kyi byed pa po nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhag gcig lon pa'i nyi ma gnyis @210b pa la nyes byas kyi byed pa po nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: nyi ma dang po la ni gnas pa dang zos pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: nyi ma dang po la ni gnas pa dang zos pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: On the first day, there is no offense for staying or eating.

original: 'dir gzhung ni der gnas pa na nyes byas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni der gnas pa na nyes byas su 'gyur la /
translated: Here, the text says, “If one stays there, it is a misdeed.”

original: der za ba la ltung byed du 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: der za ba la ltung byed du 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The text says, One commits a downfall by eating there.

original: nyi ma gnyis pa la gnas pa dang za ba'i dbang du mdzad nas tshig 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: nyi ma gnyis pa la gnas pa dang za ba'i dbang du mdzad nas tshig 'di gsungs so //
translated: This statement is made from the perspective of staying and eating on the second day.

original: 'dug gnas gcig tu zhag lon pa'i dge slong mi na bas bsod snyoms gcig bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dug gnas gcig tu zhag lon pa'i dge slong mi na bas bsod snyoms gcig bza' bar bya'o //
translated: A fully ordained monk who has stayed overnight in the same dwelling should eat one alms-offering.

original: de'i phyir dang po 'di dag la rjes su gnang ba nyid yin pas de bas na 'dir nye bar btags pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dang po 'di dag la rjes su gnang ba nyid yin pas de bas na 'dir nye bar btags pa'o //
translated: Because this is permitted for them from the beginning, it is applied here.

original: bdag po med pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'i ma yin pa ya mtshan can thams cad ma yin pa'i 'dug gnas de bdag po med pa yin na yang nyes byas byed pa po yin no //
analyzed: bdag po med pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'i ma yin pa ya mtshan can thams cad ma yin pa'i 'dug gnas de bdag po med pa yin na yang nyes byas byed pa po yin no //
translated: Also without an owner means that if the dwelling belongs to no one, to no non-Buddhist, it is a misdeed to eat there.

original: 'di la rab tu byung ba 'di pa ni mu stegs can dang 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'di la mu stegs can dang 'dra ba nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la rab tu byung ba 'di pa ni mu stegs can dang 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'di la mu stegs can dang 'dra ba nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Here, this renunciant is just like a tīrthika means that here this renunciant should be seen as just like a tīrthika.

original: ji ltar mu stegs can rab tu byung ba'i bdag po yin pa'i 'dug gnas de nyes byas kyi byed pa po yin pa de bzhin du rab tu byung ba 'di pa bdag po yin la chos 'di pa ya mtshan can thams cad ma yin pa'i 'dug gnas kyang
analyzed: ji ltar mu stegs can rab tu byung ba'i bdag po yin pa'i 'dug gnas de nyes byas kyi byed pa po yin pa de bzhin du rab tu byung ba 'di pa bdag po yin la chos 'di pa ya mtshan can thams cad ma yin pa'i 'dug gnas kyang
translated: Just as the non-Buddhist who is the owner of the dwelling is the agent of the offense, so too this Buddhist who is the owner of the dwelling is the agent of the offense.

original: nyes byas kyi byed pa po yin te /
analyzed: nyes byas kyi byed pa po yin te /
translated: But all Buddhists who are not of this sect are not the agent of the offense.

original: 'dir ni ltung ba med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir ni ltung ba med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no downfall here.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong rab tu byung bas 'dug gnas bgyid du stsal ba der dge slong gis gdugs gcig las lhag par 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong rab tu byung bas 'dug gnas bgyid du stsal ba der dge slong gis gdugs gcig las lhag par 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here the text says, “If a fully ordained monk who is the owner of the dwelling allows it to be used, what downfall does he incur if he uses it for more than one day?” The answer is, “He commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: nye dus kyang ngo zhes bya ba mu stegs can dang 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: nye dus kyang ngo zhes bya ba mu stegs can dang 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “Even if it is a relative” is to be applied as “it is just like the non-Buddhist.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni bdag po nyid de dus bgyid du stsal ba lags na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bdag po nyid de dus bgyid du stsal ba lags na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: Here the text says, “If the owner himself allows it to be used, what downfall does he incur?”

original: nyes byas kyi byed pa por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes byas kyi byed pa por 'gyur ro //
translated: The answer is, “He becomes the agent of the offense of wrong conduct.”

original: kha cig ni 'di dag la ltung ba med ces zer to de ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: kha cig ni 'di dag la ltung ba med ces zer to de ni mi rigs so //
translated: Some say: There is no offense in these cases. But that is not correct.

original: gang yang rung ba gcig rab tu byung ba la brten pa'i don 'dzin pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba gcig rab tu byung ba la brten pa'i don 'dzin pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not proper to hold the meaning of the scriptures based on just anyone.

original: 'dug gnas gcig tu za ba'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: 'dug gnas gcig tu za ba'i ltung byed do /
translated: The downfall is called “eating in one place” because it is a downfall that occurs when one eats in the same place as a layperson.

original: // bsod snyoms ni byed pa po yin zhes bya ba gsungs na /
analyzed: // bsod snyoms ni byed pa po yin zhes bya ba gsungs na /
translated: The term “alms” refers to the person who gives.

original: de la su dang 'brel pa'i bsod snyoms 'di byed pa po yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la su dang 'brel pa'i bsod snyoms 'di byed pa po yin zhe na /
translated: In that case, whose alms are they?

original: de'i phyir stobs pa'i 'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir stobs pa'i 'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The term “of the benefactor” is stated.

original: ma gtogs pa nyid bzung bas ma byin par len pa nyid bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: ma gtogs pa nyid bzung bas ma byin par len pa nyid bskyed pa'o //
translated: The term “except” indicates that the alms are not to be taken from anyone else.

original: ji ltar stobs pa'i zhe na /🔽de'i phyir yongs su spags par ro zhes @211a * //
analyzed: ji ltar stobs pa'i zhe na / de'i phyir yongs su spags par ro zhes @211a * //
translated: What kind of benefactor?

original: bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bya ba smos te /
translated: The term “who has prepared” is stated.

original: rgya che ba tsam rab tu bstan pa la spags pa gang yin pa de ni sbyin pa 'jug pas ma yin no //
analyzed: rgya che ba tsam rab tu bstan pa la spags pa gang yin pa de ni sbyin pa 'jug pas ma yin no //
translated: The alms are not to be taken from someone who has prepared a large amount of food for the sake of giving it to many people.

original: der nyes pa 'di bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: der nyes pa 'di bskyed pa ste /
translated: The fault that arises from taking alms from such a person is as follows.

original: gal te yongs su spyod pa 'di yin na 'di tsam sbyin par bya zhes bya ba spags pa gang yin pa de la ni rgya che ba tsam du bstan pas spags pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gal te yongs su spyod pa 'di yin na 'di tsam sbyin par bya zhes bya ba spags pa gang yin pa de la ni rgya che ba tsam du bstan pas spags pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: The answer is: it is not complete giving if it is taught as merely extensive.

original: de bas na 'dir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault here.

original: ci ma spags pa thams cad la stobs pa byed pa po yin nam zhe na /🔽de'i phyir ci bder ma byas par ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ci ma spags pa thams cad la stobs pa byed pa po yin nam zhe na / de'i phyir ci bder ma byas par ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Is the one who gives to all who are not complete?🔽The answer is: he gives as much as he can.

original: sbyin pa la 'jug pas stobs pa de yin te /
analyzed: sbyin pa la 'jug pas stobs pa de yin te /
translated: The one who gives in this way is the one who gives in the practice of giving.

original: gang zhig ci bder ma byas par ro zhes bya ba 'di la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gang zhig ci bder ma byas par ro zhes bya ba 'di la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in this, since he gives as much as he can.

original: ci 'di thams cad la yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'di thams cad la yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is this the case for all?

original: de'i phyir khyim pa'i 'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyim pa'i 'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The answer is: for the householder.

original: tshad ji tsam pa la de dang 'brel pa'i bsod snyoms byed pa po yin zhe na /
analyzed: tshad ji tsam pa la de dang 'brel pa'i bsod snyoms byed pa po yin zhe na /
translated: How much is the measure of the alms that he gives?

original: de'i phyir bre'u chung dag gi tshad ni 'bras thug po che ma gadh'a'i bre'u chung gi phyed dang lnga btsos pa tshod ma ma gtogs pa las lhag pa'i bsod snyoms te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bre'u chung dag gi tshad ni 'bras thug po che ma gadh'a'i bre'u chung gi phyed dang lnga btsos pa tshod ma ma gtogs pa las lhag pa'i bsod snyoms te /
translated: Therefore, the measure of a small container is a half-measure of a small Magadha container, which is filled with boiled rice, except for vegetables.

original: grogs kyi skal ba dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: grogs kyi skal ba dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The alms-food is more than that, together with a share for a companion.

original: bre'u chung phyed dang lnga btsos pa las lhag pa'i bsod snyoms ni byed pa po yin no //
analyzed: bre'u chung phyed dang lnga btsos pa las lhag pa'i bsod snyoms ni byed pa po yin no //
translated: The alms-food is more than a half-measure of a small Magadha container, which is filled with boiled rice, except for vegetables.

original: bre'u chung dag gi tshad ni ji tsam zhe na /
analyzed: bre'u chung dag gi tshad ni ji tsam zhe na /
translated: What is the measure of a small Magadha container?

original: de'i phyir btsos pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir btsos pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “boiled rice.”

original: 'bras btsos pa ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung gi tshad bre gang rnams la yod pa de rnams la'o //
analyzed: 'bras btsos pa ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung gi tshad bre gang rnams la yod pa de rnams la'o //
translated: It is in those that have the measure of a small Magadha container, which is filled with boiled rice.

original: tshod ma ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshod ma ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Except for vegetables.

original: 'dir tshod ma brtsi bar mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir tshod ma brtsi bar mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that vegetables are not to be measured here.

original: 'dus nas len pa la grogs dang lhan cig tu len pa gang yin pa de ni de'i brtsi bar bya 'am 'on te ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dus nas len pa la grogs dang lhan cig tu len pa gang yin pa de ni de'i brtsi bar bya 'am 'on te ma yin zhe na /
translated: Is that which is taken together with a companion to be measured or not?

original: de'i phyir grogs kyi skal ba dang yang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir grogs kyi skal ba dang yang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is shared with a portion of the companion.

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'dod na dge slong de dag gi lhung bzed gang ba gnyis sam gsum blang bar bya'o zhes thams cad byed pa po nyid kyis gnyis sam gsum gyi tshig ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'dod na dge slong de dag gi lhung bzed gang ba gnyis sam gsum blang bar bya'o zhes thams cad byed pa po nyid kyis gnyis sam gsum gyi tshig ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text says, “If one wishes, one should take two or three filled begging bowls from those monks.” All of this is said by the agent himself, with the words “two or three.”

original: gang du 'di'i 'og tu 'di dang 'brel pa'i bsod snyoms byed pa po yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang du 'di'i 'og tu 'di dang 'brel pa'i bsod snyoms byed pa po yin zhe na /
translated: Where is the one who practices this alms-gathering connected to this?

original: de'i phyir zos pa la'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir zos pa la'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “after eating.”

original: ci zos so cog thams cad la'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci zos so cog thams cad la'am zhe na /
translated: Is it for all that is eaten?

original: de'i phyir mnos pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mnos pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “after accepting.”

original: rnyed pa bzhag pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnyed pa bzhag pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: after setting aside the gain.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las de nyid du 'dug cing don ji srid du zos kyang ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las de nyid du 'dug cing don ji srid du zos kyang ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text says, “One should remain right there and eat as much as one wishes. There is no offense.”

original: de la ni nyes byas kyi'o zhes bya ba ni byed pa po ste 'dir ni ma nos pa @211b la'o ;
analyzed: de la ni nyes byas kyi'o zhes bya ba ni byed pa po ste 'dir ni ma nos pa @211b la'o ;
translated: There, it is a misdeed. The agent is said here to be one who does not accept.

original: /'dir nyes byas kyi byed pa po yin no //
analyzed: /'dir nyes byas kyi byed pa po yin no //
translated: Here, the one who commits the offense is the one who receives it.

original: gzhan gyis mnos pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis mnos pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also, if one receives it from another,

original: gzhan nod du bcug la zos na yang nyes byas kyi byed pa po yin no //
analyzed: gzhan nod du bcug la zos na yang nyes byas kyi byed pa po yin no //
translated: if one makes another receive it and then eats it, the one who commits the offense is the one who receives it.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
translated: Here, the text of the Vinaya says:

original: lde gu dag dang snum khur dag bstabs pa de las 'og tu lhung bzed gnyis sam gsum las lhag par gzhan nod du bcug na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lde gu dag dang snum khur dag bstabs pa de las 'og tu lhung bzed gnyis sam gsum las lhag par gzhan nod du bcug na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “If one receives more than two or three extra alms-bowls of gruel or oil-cakes, it is an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: gzhan la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba la /
translated: There is no offense if one receives it from another.

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here, the text of the Vinaya says:

original: de nyid du 'dug ste ma bstabs par zos kyang ltung ba med ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid du 'dug ste ma bstabs par zos kyang ltung ba med ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “If one eats without offering it to those who are present, there is no offense.”

original: 'dir mdo 'di ni nyes byas su dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir byas so //
analyzed: 'dir mdo 'di ni nyes byas su dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir byas so //
translated: Here, this sūtra was composed to dispel doubt about an offense.🔽There is also no offense if it is not prepared as work.

original: las su ma byas pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'bras la sogs pa rngo btags ma byas pa mnos te za ba la ltung ba med pa ste /
analyzed: las su ma byas pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'bras la sogs pa rngo btags ma byas pa mnos te za ba la ltung ba med pa ste /
translated: This means that there is no offense if one receives and eats uncooked rice and so on.

original: nyes pa med pa la dgongs pa yin gyi 'bru tsam pa len pa'i nyes pa gzhan ni yod do //
analyzed: nyes pa med pa la dgongs pa yin gyi 'bru tsam pa len pa'i nyes pa gzhan ni yod do //
translated: It is intended that there is no offense if one is sick, but there is another offense for accepting more than a mere handful.

original: de bas na 'di la yang 'dir 'di las med par rtogs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di la yang 'dir 'di las med par rtogs par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not understand that there is no offense in this case.

original: blang bar bya ba gal te mang ba nyid yin na dge slong dag la bgo bsha' bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: blang bar bya ba gal te mang ba nyid yin na dge slong dag la bgo bsha' bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If there is a great deal to be accepted, it should be shared with the monks.

original: 'dir blang bar 'os pa bre'u chung phyed dang lnga'i mthar thug pa de dang rjes su mthun pa'i tshod ma dang lhan cig tu gang yin pa de las gal te lhag pa yin par blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir blang bar 'os pa bre'u chung phyed dang lnga'i mthar thug pa de dang rjes su mthun pa'i tshod ma dang lhan cig tu gang yin pa de las gal te lhag pa yin par blang bar bya'o //
translated: Here, if there is more than what is proper to accept, up to half an āḍhaka, together with vegetables that are suitable, then one should accept it.

original: 'dir mang po la yang dag par bsten pa la gzhung ni dge slong dag la bgo bsha' bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir mang po la yang dag par bsten pa la gzhung ni dge slong dag la bgo bsha' bya ste /
translated: Here, if there is a great deal, it should be shared with the monks.

original: lhung bzed gang ba gnyis sam gsum blangs nas zhes bya ba'i tshig gis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed gang ba gnyis sam gsum blangs nas zhes bya ba'i tshig gis rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood from the words, “Having accepted two or three full alms bowls,”

original: lhung bzed do gsum tsam las lhag par len pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: lhung bzed do gsum tsam las lhag par len pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct for accepting more than three alms bowls.

original: // / ji tsam gyis chog pa bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: // / ji tsam gyis chog pa bza' bar bya'o //
translated: One should eat as much as is appropriate.

original: zas brtsams pas ldang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zas brtsams pas ldang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not rise from a meal.

original: zas la brtsams pa'i ngo bo gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: zas la brtsams pa'i ngo bo gsungs pa ni /
translated: The nature of a meal is stated:

original: tha na lan tshva yan chad bza' bar bya ba gang yang rung ba cung zad cig blangs na rnam pa de nyid yin no zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tha na lan tshva yan chad bza' bar bya ba gang yang rung ba cung zad cig blangs na rnam pa de nyid yin no zhes bya ste /
translated: Whatever is eaten, even as little as a lump of salt, is of that nature.

original: cung zad cig ces bya ba ni nyung du yang na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cung zad cig ces bya ba ni nyung du yang na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “ Whatever” means “even a little.”

original: gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'di ston par byed de /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'di ston par byed de /
translated: “ Whatever” shows that

translated: Here, the text says, “Venerable, if a monk relinquishes things other than the five foods, and later eats the five foods, there is no offense.”

analyzed: des slad kyi tha mal pa'i gnas skabs su byin lan bstabs pa de 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur /

original: nye ba 'khor ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //

translated: “One who has the idea of harming” means that one who has the idea of harming should be understood in this way.

original: spang ba bstan zin to /
analyzed: spang ba bstan zin to /
translated: The explanation of the abandonment is finished.

original: // / da ni lhag bor bya ba bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni lhag bor bya ba bstan par bya ste /
