translated: Here, the former passage is taken as the basis, and the prohibition of those is not included in the internal cooking.

original: dus kyi phyir zhes bya ba 'di bstan to //
analyzed: dus kyi phyir zhes bya ba 'di bstan to //
translated: This is taught by the phrase “because of the time.”

original: phyi ma ni 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba zhes bya ba 'di dang rjen par spangs pa yang mdzad pa yin te de'i don ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: phyi ma ni 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba zhes bya ba 'di dang rjen par spangs pa yang mdzad pa yin te de'i don ni 'di yin no //
translated: The latter passage is the abandonment of the raw, and it is the abandonment of the prohibition of eating for the duration of life. This is its meaning.

original: lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa rnams bza' bar bya'i /
analyzed: lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa rnams bza' bar bya'i /
translated: Those that are held in the hand and so on should be eaten.🔽But not at another time.

original: dus gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba dus kyi phyir bza' ba dgag par byas pa gang yin pa de bkag pas 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba dag bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: dus gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba dus kyi phyir bza' ba dgag par byas pa gang yin pa de bkag pas 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba dag bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The prohibition of eating because of the time is abandoned by that, and the eating for the duration of life is included.

original: de rnams ji skad bstan pa'i cho gas lag tu blangs pa ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bza' bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams ji skad bstan pa'i cho gas lag tu blangs pa ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bza' bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should eat them for as long as one lives, taking them up in the manner taught.

original: lhag par gnas pa rnams la ni tshul 'di yin no //
analyzed: lhag par gnas pa rnams la ni tshul 'di yin no //
translated: This is the rule for those who have performed the consecration.

original: lhag par mi gnas pa rnams la ni dus kyi phyir bsdus pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: lhag par mi gnas pa rnams la ni dus kyi phyir bsdus pa nyid yin no //
translated: For those who have not performed the consecration, it is simply for the time being.

original: 'bags pa ni zas kyi phyed nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'bags pa ni zas kyi phyed nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: The defiled is half of the food.

original: lhung bzed la sogs pa zas la sogs pas 'bags pa gang yin pa de ni zas phyed nyid yin gyi zas rdzogs pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lhung bzed la sogs pa zas la sogs pas 'bags pa gang yin pa de ni zas phyed nyid yin gyi zas rdzogs pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: Whatever is defiled by food, etc., in the begging bowl, etc., is half of the food, not the whole food.

original: na smad par byas pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: na smad par byas pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not to be eaten.

original: 'di ni bza' bar gyur pa nyid la tha snyad du gdags pa ma yin pa 'dis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bza' bar gyur pa nyid la tha snyad du gdags pa ma yin pa 'dis shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood by this convention that is not in the nature of food.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis lhung bzed dang lhung bzed chung ngu dang kha @219a * //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis lhung bzed dang lhung bzed chung ngu dang kha @219a * //
translated: Here the text is: A monk should not eat from a begging bowl, a small begging bowl, or a

original: gzar dang tshva khug dang lhung bzed kyi snod dang gos dang me shel dang / khri dang khri'u dang khar pa dang bum pa dang ril ba dang lde mig dang lde mig kyog po dang gsog 'jog byas pas 'bags pa za na thams cad nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzar dang tshva khug dang lhung bzed kyi snod dang gos dang me shel dang / khri dang khri'u dang khar pa dang bum pa dang ril ba dang lde mig dang lde mig kyog po dang gsog 'jog byas pas 'bags pa za na thams cad nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and a bowl, a robe, a sun glass, a bed, a bench, a cushion, a water pot, a water filter, a key, a hook, and a storehouse.

original: 'dir zas kyi phyir 'bags pa ste zos na'o zhes bya ba'i tshig ste rang longs spyod pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir zas kyi phyir 'bags pa ste zos na'o zhes bya ba'i tshig ste rang longs spyod pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, “defiled” means “used for food,” not “used for one’s own enjoyment.”

original: 'di rnams ni mtha' med par byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams ni mtha' med par byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because these are made without limit.

original: gsog 'jog gi mtshan nyid la de dang 'dres pa'i kha zas za ba ni 'dir de yongs su longs spyod par mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: gsog 'jog gi mtshan nyid la de dang 'dres pa'i kha zas za ba ni 'dir de yongs su longs spyod par mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of a storehouse is that food mixed with it is eaten. Here, it is established that one who uses it has the desire to enjoy it.

original: kha dri ma can gyis bza' ba dang btung ba dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba kha'i nang ma dag pas bza' ba dang btung ba dag zos sam 'thungs na de dang reg pas kha dri ma can du gyur pas zan gyi phyir nyid de gzhan du 'jug par
analyzed: kha dri ma can gyis bza' ba dang btung ba dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba kha'i nang ma dag pas bza' ba dang btung ba dag zos sam 'thungs na de dang reg pas kha dri ma can du gyur pas zan gyi phyir nyid de gzhan du 'jug par
translated: If one eats or drinks food and drink that is unclean in the mouth, then by the contact with that, the mouth becomes unclean. If one puts something else in the mouth for the sake of food,

original: byed na ltung ba med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byed na ltung ba med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: there is no offense. This is the meaning.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis kha ma bkrus par skom 'thungs na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis kha ma bkrus par skom 'thungs na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here the text says, “If a monk drinks water without washing his mouth, he commits an offense.”

original: ji tsam gyis ni kha dag pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis ni kha dag pa yin zhe na /
translated: By how much is the mouth clean?

original: de'i phyi rol ni lci ba'am sa kun nas drung de chus bshal na dag pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol ni lci ba'am sa kun nas drung de chus bshal na dag pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If it is outside, it is clean if one washes it with water.

original: mchu gnyis ni dag pa 'dis rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: mchu gnyis ni dag pa 'dis rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: The two lips are clean in this way.

original: sil bu rnams las 'di la sogs pa yang dag par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sil bu rnams las 'di la sogs pa yang dag par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is the end of the explanation of the individual cases.

original: nang ni chu ma khur ba do'am gsum gyis bshal na'o zhes bya ba ni kha'i nang gi dag pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: nang ni chu ma khur ba do'am gsum gyis bshal na'o zhes bya ba ni kha'i nang gi dag pa 'di yin no //
translated: The inner is purified by rinsing three times with water that is not held in the mouth.

original: lhung bzed ni bsam pa thag pas lan gnyis sam lan gsum bkru bshal byas na sgra mi snyan yang dag pa yin no zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: lhung bzed ni bsam pa thag pas lan gnyis sam lan gsum bkru bshal byas na sgra mi snyan yang dag pa yin no zhes bya ba la ;
translated: The bowl is purified by washing it twice or three times with a sincere mind.

original: lhung bzed ni bsam pa thag pas gus par bya ste lan gnyis lan gsum du bsgyur log bya zhing tho rangs kyi chu la sogs pas bkru bshal byas na sgra mi snyan cing sgra sang sang po ma byung du zin kyang dag pa nyid yin no zhes bya🔽ba'i don to //🔽rtsi langs pa la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed la zhes bya ba'i sgra 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: lhung bzed ni bsam pa thag pas gus par bya ste lan gnyis lan gsum du bsgyur log bya zhing tho rangs kyi chu la sogs pas bkru bshal byas na sgra mi snyan cing sgra sang sang po ma byung du zin kyang dag pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // rtsi langs pa la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed la zhes bya ba'i sgra 'jug pa yin te /
translated: The bowl is purified by washing it twice or three times with a sincere mind, with respect, turning it over, and washing it with the water of dawn and so on, even if it does not make a pleasant sound.🔽There is no offense if it is a new bowl.

original: lhung bzed dag par byas pa la nga langs pa ni rtsi langs pa ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed dag par byas pa la nga langs pa ni rtsi langs pa ste /
translated: This means that if it is a new bowl, there is no offense if it does not make a pleasant sound.🔽There is no offense if it is a new bowl.

original: de la ni nyes pa med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la ni nyes pa med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that if it is a new bowl, there is no offense if it does not make a pleasant sound.

original: 'bags pa med par reg pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gang zhig lhung bzed bza' bar bya ba la reg kyang 'bags pa med na de la yang nyes pa med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bags pa med par reg pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gang zhig lhung bzed bza' bar bya ba la reg kyang 'bags pa med na de la yang nyes pa med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: If a monk touches a begging bowl that contains food, but it is not defiled, there is no offense.

original: @219b lci skam mam lci ba'am sa gang yang rung ba lan gsum bkrus pa la snum pa nyid kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni nyes pa med do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: @219b lci skam mam lci ba'am sa gang yang rung ba lan gsum bkrus pa la snum pa nyid kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni nyes pa med do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If it is washed three times with ashes, lye, or earth, and it is still oily, there is no offense.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa dge slong gis lhung bzed lci skam mam lci ba'am sas lan gsum 'khru bar bgyid cing de yang snum zhing snum bag chags par gyur na yongs su longs spyad par bgyi 'am /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa dge slong gis lhung bzed lci skam mam lci ba'am sas lan gsum 'khru bar bgyid cing de yang snum zhing snum bag chags par gyur na yongs su longs spyad par bgyi 'am /
translated: Here is the text: “Venerable! If a monk washes his begging bowl three times with ashes, lye, or earth, and it is still oily, should he use it?”

original: nye ba 'khor de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Upāli, it should be used.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni tha snyad du bya ba'i rin mi chog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni tha snyad du bya ba'i rin mi chog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not worth the trouble of using it conventionally.

original: 'dir lci skam la sogs pa gsum po 'di dpe tsam du zad kyi gzhan dag kyang rung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir lci skam la sogs pa gsum po 'di dpe tsam du zad kyi gzhan dag kyang rung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the three examples of a dirty vessel, etc. are merely examples, and one should understand that other things are also suitable.

original: langs pa bsal bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba de lhung bzed dag par byas pa la snum bag gam tshon rtsi'i bag sko la sogs pa dag phrad pas langs par gyur na bsal bar bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: langs pa bsal bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba de lhung bzed dag par byas pa la snum bag gam tshon rtsi'i bag sko la sogs pa dag phrad pas langs par gyur na bsal bar bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: The term to be removed means that if a stain of oil or dye, etc. appears on a pure alms-bowl, it is to be removed.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong zhig la lhung bzed 'phren chen zhig yod nas /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong zhig la lhung bzed 'phren chen zhig yod nas /
translated: Here is the text: A monk had a large alms-bowl.

original: des der khu ba byin len byas pa na snum bag 'thon cing steng du zhag nya mig chags shing 'dug nas dge slong de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: des der khu ba byin len byas pa na snum bag 'thon cing steng du zhag nya mig chags shing 'dug nas dge slong de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: When he received soup in it, oil came out and fish-eye fat formed on top. The monk felt regret, and the Blessed One said:

original: steng gi snum bsal te btung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: steng gi snum bsal te btung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Remove the oil on top and drink it.

original: 'bags pa'i phyogs nyi tshe bkru bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'bags pa'i phyogs nyi tshe bkru bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: The term 'to be washed' means that if a part of it is stained, it is to be washed.

original: de nyi tshe zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed kyi phyogs gang du 'bags par gyur pa'i phyogs de'o //
analyzed: de nyi tshe zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed kyi phyogs gang du 'bags par gyur pa'i phyogs de'o //
translated: The term just that refers to the side of the begging bowl that is soiled.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis lhung bzed 'phren can zhig des 'khru bar byed pa na 'phren rer 'bras chan gyi dum bu song ba zhig mthong nas de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis lhung bzed 'phren can zhig des 'khru bar byed pa na 'phren rer 'bras chan gyi dum bu song ba zhig mthong nas de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Here is the text: A monk had a cracked begging bowl. When he washed it, he saw that rice stuck in the crack. He felt regret, and the Blessed One said:

original: shing bus brud de chus lan gnyis sam gsum bshal nas yongs su spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: shing bus brud de chus lan gnyis sam gsum bshal nas yongs su spyad par bya ste /
translated: You should scrape it with a wooden stick, wash it two or three times with water, and use it.

original: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽bum pa la sogs pa snum can dag snum med par bya ba'i phyir chu'i rdzing bu zab mo'i nang du gzhug go //
analyzed: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // bum pa la sogs pa snum can dag snum med par bya ba'i phyir chu'i rdzing bu zab mo'i nang du gzhug go //
translated: You should not feel regret about this.🔽In order to remove oiliness from oil-stained vessels and so on, they should be placed in a deep pool of water.

original: nya'am rus sbal lam sbal pa'am chu srin byis pa gsod dam nya khyi ba dag gis ma lus par ldogs kyi bar du gzhag go //
analyzed: nya'am rus sbal lam sbal pa'am chu srin byis pa gsod dam nya khyi ba dag gis ma lus par ldogs kyi bar du gzhag go //
translated: They should be left there until they are completely cleaned by fish, turtles, frogs, alligators, or water rats.

original: bsregs pas kyang snum med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar ma lus par ldogs pa dang bsreg pa dag gis snum med par 'gyur ba'i bum pa la sogs pa dag ji ltar dag cing gtsang ba nyid du bya zhe na /🔽de'i phyir snum med par gyur pa ni bkrus pas so zhes @220a * //
analyzed: bsregs pas kyang snum med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar ma lus par ldogs pa dang bsreg pa dag gis snum med par 'gyur ba'i bum pa la sogs pa dag ji ltar dag cing gtsang ba nyid du bya zhe na / de'i phyir snum med par gyur pa ni bkrus pas so zhes @220a * //
translated: If a pot, etc. is completely destroyed by burning and devoid of oil, how can it be purified and cleansed?

original: bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “It becomes devoid of oil through washing.”

original: dag pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba de dang 'di 'brel te /
analyzed: dag pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba de dang 'di 'brel te /
translated: It is said that it is purified.

original: gang gis bkru zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis bkru zhe na /
translated: By what is it washed?

original: de'i phyir lci skam mam lci bas dag pa nyid do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir lci skam mam lci bas dag pa nyid do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “It is purified by ashes or alkaline substances.”

original: tho rangs kyi chu'am lci bas dag pa ste snum med par gyur pa ni dag pa nyid do //
analyzed: tho rangs kyi chu'am lci bas dag pa ste snum med par gyur pa ni dag pa nyid do //
translated: It is purified by ashes or alkaline substances, and it becomes devoid of oil.

original: lan tshva la sogs pa tshva chu dang 'gyur byed kyi chu dang rnyog chur gyur pa ni phyed nyid do zhes bya ba ni lan tshva dang 'gyur byed dang / rnyog pa dag las tshva chur gyur pa dang 'gyur byed kyi tshur gyur pa dang rnyog pa rnyog chur gyur pa 'thung ba ni phyed nyid de nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lan tshva la sogs pa tshva chu dang 'gyur byed kyi chu dang rnyog chur gyur pa ni phyed nyid do zhes bya ba ni lan tshva dang 'gyur byed dang / rnyog pa dag las tshva chur gyur pa dang 'gyur byed kyi tshur gyur pa dang rnyog pa rnyog chur gyur pa 'thung ba ni phyed nyid de nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Salt water, etc., become half for those who are not sick. This means that drinking salt water, etc., becomes half a transgression for those who are not sick.

original: de ni thams cad la dus ma yin par rung ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni lan tshva la sogs par gyur pa de ni rung ba nyid de nad pa ma yin pa thams cad kyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: de ni thams cad la dus ma yin par rung ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni lan tshva la sogs par gyur pa de ni rung ba nyid de nad pa ma yin pa thams cad kyis kyang ngo //
translated: This is the rule for all, that it is not the proper time. This means that salt water, etc., is the proper time for all who are not sick.

original: lan tshva dang 'gyur byed rang gi bya ba mi byed pa dag la ni med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'dir phyed nyid kyang med pa nyid de /
analyzed: lan tshva dang 'gyur byed rang gi bya ba mi byed pa dag la ni med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'dir phyed nyid kyang med pa nyid de /
translated: But for salt and alkali that do not perform their function, there is no offense. This means that even half is not an offense.

original: de la ni ltung ba med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de la ni ltung ba med pa kho na ste /
translated: There is no offense at all in that case.

original: nyes byas kyi ltung ba yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyes byas kyi ltung ba yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that there is no offense of a transgression, and also no offense of a minor transgression.

original: 'dir thams cad la lan tshva dang 'gyur byed ces smos pa ni lhan cig skyes pa yin par rig par bya'i nye bar sgrub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir thams cad la lan tshva dang 'gyur byed ces smos pa ni lhan cig skyes pa yin par rig par bya'i nye bar sgrub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the terms “alkaline” and “acid” are to be understood as referring to the natural state, not to the manufactured state.

original: nye bar bsgrubs pa de la 'byung khung gi dbang gis 'byung khung dag la ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni cho ga'o //
analyzed: nye bar bsgrubs pa de la 'byung khung gi dbang gis 'byung khung dag la ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni cho ga'o //
translated: In the case of the manufactured state, the rule is that the substance is not to be used if it comes from a source that is not pure.

original: gzhan la tha snyad btags par 'gyur ba ma yin pa la yang nyes pa yongs su rdzogs pa la byed pa po nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan la tha snyad btags par 'gyur ba ma yin pa la yang nyes pa yongs su rdzogs pa la byed pa po nyid do //
translated: And even in the case of a substance that is not normally considered to be a drug, if it has been completely transformed into a drug, then it is a drug.

original: gang la gnas pa la yang dang ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dus kyis bar du chus dag pa de'i tshe ni lhan cig skyes pa ma yin yang lhan cig skyes pa nyid dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang la gnas pa la yang dang ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dus kyis bar du chus dag pa de'i tshe ni lhan cig skyes pa ma yin yang lhan cig skyes pa nyid dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: And even if it is not a natural drug, if it is a substance that causes a clear state of mind when it is consumed, then it is to be understood as a natural drug.

original: 'dir phyed nyid kyi gzhung ni zhu ba las /
analyzed: 'dir phyed nyid kyi gzhung ni zhu ba las /
translated: Here is the text of the half-verse:

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis chab dbon tsha can du bgyis ba gsog 'jog bgyis te 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis chab dbon tsha can du bgyis ba gsog 'jog bgyis te 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: “Lord, if a monk were to consume a drug that has been stored by a druggist, what would be the offense?”

original: nyes byas so //
analyzed: nyes byas so //
translated: “An offense of wrong conduct.”

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis chab dbon tsha can du bgyis nas byin len ma bgyis pa 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur nyes byas so //
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis chab dbon tsha can du bgyis nas byin len ma bgyis pa 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur nyes byas so //
translated: “Lord, if a monk drinks water that has been boiled by a lay person and then does not re-purify it, what is he guilty of?” “He is guilty of a wrong doing.”

original: 'dir ni snga rol du yang dbon tsha can du bgyis pa zhes bya ba'i tshig ni gang gis shes byed yin snyam du shes par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni snga rol du yang dbon tsha can du bgyis pa zhes bya ba'i tshig ni gang gis shes byed yin snyam du shes par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Here, the phrase “having made it boiled by a lay person” is not to be understood as a reference to something that is done beforehand.

original: lhan cig skyes pa la yang sbyor ba 'di yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa la yang sbyor ba 'di yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this procedure is also applied to naturally boiled water.

original: gang gi phyir rang bzhin gyis kyang dbon tsha can gyi chu ni dbon tsha zhes bya bar smra ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang bzhin gyis kyang dbon tsha can gyi chu ni dbon tsha zhes bya bar smra ba yin te /
translated: Because it is said that water that is naturally boiled is “boiled by a lay person.”

original: nyams pa 'di la yang dbon tsha can du byas pa zhes bya ba rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: nyams pa 'di la yang dbon tsha can du byas pa zhes bya ba rang bzhin yin no //
translated: And in this case, “boiled by a lay person” is a natural property.

original: 'dir yang gzhung ni btsun pa re zhig @220b dge slong gis chab 'gyur byed can du byas pa byin len ma byas par 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir yang gzhung ni btsun pa re zhig @220b dge slong gis chab 'gyur byed can du byas pa byin len ma byas par 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: Here, the text says, “Lord, if a monk drinks water that has been boiled by a lay person and then does not re-purify it, what is he guilty of?”

original: nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “He is guilty of a wrong doing.”

original: 'gyur byed can du bgyis pa'i tshig kyang dbon tsha can du byas pa'i spyod pas bsal zin to //
analyzed: 'gyur byed can du bgyis pa'i tshig kyang dbon tsha can du byas pa'i spyod pas bsal zin to //
translated: The text is also confused, for example, when it says:

original: rnyog pa can gyi gzhung yang btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis chab rnyog pa can byin len ma byas par 'tshal na ltung bar cir 'gyur /
analyzed: rnyog pa can gyi gzhung yang btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis chab rnyog pa can byin len ma byas par 'tshal na ltung bar cir 'gyur /
translated: “If a monk gives water that is cloudy, and drinks it without purifying it, what is the offense?”

original: nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “It is an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: tha ma la ni gzugs brnyan byung na'o zhes bya ba ni lan tshva can dang 'gyur byed dag gi tha ma ni rnyog ma can gyi chur gyur pa nyid kyis bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan 'byung ba yod pa la med pa nyid do //
analyzed: tha ma la ni gzugs brnyan byung na'o zhes bya ba ni lan tshva can dang 'gyur byed dag gi tha ma ni rnyog ma can gyi chur gyur pa nyid kyis bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan 'byung ba yod pa la med pa nyid do //
translated: The last is when a reflection appears, that is, when the water is so cloudy that a reflection appears in it, even though it is not there.

original: ka ta ka'i 'bras bus chu shin tu dang bar 'gyur ro //🔽'gyur byed kyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni dang bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ka ta ka'i 'bras bus chu shin tu dang bar 'gyur ro // 'gyur byed kyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni dang bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Water becomes very clear with the fruit of the kataka tree.🔽It also becomes clear with the root of the kuśa plant.

original: zan gyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni rdzas gzhan 'dis dang bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zan gyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni rdzas gzhan 'dis dang bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It also becomes clear with this other substance, rice.

original: de mi 'jig par bya ba'i phyir snum gyis bsku'o zhes bya ba ni gzhug par bya ba'i zan des chu shin tu dang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de mi 'jig par bya ba'i phyir snum gyis bsku'o zhes bya ba ni gzhug par bya ba'i zan des chu shin tu dang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The water becomes very clear due to the flour that is being poured into it.

original: de ltar ma zhugs pa la 'byung khung du btab pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ma zhugs pa la 'byung khung du btab pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that the water is being poured into the flour.

original: de bas na 'di la tha snyad du gyur pa nyid la nye bar longs spyod pa ni shes par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di la tha snyad du gyur pa nyid la nye bar longs spyod pa ni shes par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the enjoyment of the conventional is to be understood in this way.🔽The pouring into the water is not the number of existents.

original: 'byung khung dag tu btab pa mi mngon pa ni yod pa'i grangs nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dge slong mang po 'dus dpag khron pa dag tu lhung bzed dag 'khru bar byed pa na /
analyzed: 'byung khung dag tu btab pa mi mngon pa ni yod pa'i grangs nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dge slong mang po 'dus dpag khron pa dag tu lhung bzed dag 'khru bar byed pa na /
translated: When many monks gather in a pond to wash their bowls,

original: kun dga' ra ba pa dang dge bsnyen dag gis de dag tu mar sar dang 'bru mar dang zho dang sbrang rtsi'i bum pa dag 'khru bar byed pas steng du snum gyi nya mig chil chil po dag chags par gyur nas /
analyzed: kun dga' ra ba pa dang dge bsnyen dag gis de dag tu mar sar dang 'bru mar dang zho dang sbrang rtsi'i bum pa dag 'khru bar byed pas steng du snum gyi nya mig chil chil po dag chags par gyur nas /
translated: the water is filled with oil, butter, sesame oil, yogurt, and honey pots that are being washed by the monastery workers and the lay devotees.

original: dge slong dag 'gyod pa skyes nas mi 'thung pa'i skabs de dge slong dag gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'gyod pa skyes nas mi 'thung pa'i skabs de dge slong dag gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: When the monks were remorseful and did not drink, the monks asked the Blessed One about it, and the Blessed One said:

original: dge slong dag de dag gis 'bags pa des zas kyi bya ba byar mi rung gi bsal la btung bar bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag de dag gis 'bags pa des zas kyi bya ba byar mi rung gi bsal la btung bar bya ste /
translated: Monks, it is not suitable to use food that is contaminated by alcohol. Remove it and drink.

original: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes pa de bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes pa de bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Do not be remorseful about this.🔽This is the summary.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dres par gyur na de nyid nyi tshe bsal ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni gang 'di 'dres par gyur pa'i phyogs de nyid la'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dres par gyur na de nyid nyi tshe bsal ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni gang 'di 'dres par gyur pa'i phyogs de nyid la'o //
translated: If it is mixed in one place, only that part should be removed.

original: khva'i mchus reg pa la ni than skor yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gang reg pa'i phyogs de nyid dang de'i than skor yang bsal bar bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: khva'i mchus reg pa la ni than skor yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gang reg pa'i phyogs de nyid dang de'i than skor yang bsal bar bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: If it is touched by a crow's beak, even the surrounding area.

original: 'o na mdo snga ma shos kyi dgongs pa med dam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na mdo snga ma shos kyi dgongs pa med dam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you ask whether the intention of the former sūtra does not exist, it is not so.

original: 'dir thams cad mi rung @221a * //
analyzed: 'dir thams cad mi rung @221a * //
translated: Here, everything is unsuitable.

original: bar 'gyur bar shes par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bar 'gyur bar shes par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not to be understood as a transformation.

original: de bas na de la 'di bstan gyi lhag ma la ni ma yin te btsog pa nyid spang ba'i phyir bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na de la 'di bstan gyi lhag ma la ni ma yin te btsog pa nyid spang ba'i phyir bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid du shes par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is taught in this context, but not in the remainder, because it is to be understood as not to be eaten in order to avoid the fault of impurity.

original: de bas na don 'di brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na don 'di brjod pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this meaning is stated.

original: de dang 'brel pa'i rgyun gyis reg pa ni de la reg pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gang dang 'brel pa'i rgyun la reg pa de 'o ma la sogs pa de la der reg pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa'i rgyun gyis reg pa ni de la reg pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gang dang 'brel pa'i rgyun la reg pa de 'o ma la sogs pa de la der reg pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Contact with the continuum connected to it is not contact with it itself. That which is contact with the continuum connected to it, such as milk, is not contact with it itself.

original: nor pa dang brjed pas kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni reg pa la reg pa nyid do //
analyzed: nor pa dang brjed pas kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni reg pa la reg pa nyid do //
translated: It is not by mistake or by forgetting. This is the contact of contact.

original: de gnyis kyis spos pa gzhag pa'i phyir yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nor ba dang brjed pa de nyid kyis spos pa phyir gzhag par bya ba'i don du reg pa yang reg pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis spos pa gzhag pa'i phyir yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nor ba dang brjed pa de nyid kyis spos pa phyir gzhag par bya ba'i don du reg pa yang reg pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not even for the purpose of setting aside what is carried by those two. The contact for the purpose of setting aside what is carried by just those two, mistake and forgetting, is not contact itself.

original: gnas kyi thag shin tu nye bar bskur ro zhes bya ba ni gnas gang du bar skabs kyi thag shin tu nye ba yod pa der spong ba la nye bar bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas kyi thag shin tu nye bar bskur ro zhes bya ba ni gnas gang du bar skabs kyi thag shin tu nye ba yod pa der spong ba la nye bar bskur bar bya'o //

original: gang zhig g-yel bas 'byung zhing rgyal mtshan de 'dzin pa de ni 'dir ngo tsha med pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa rnam par gnas pa yin gyi pham pa byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig g-yel bas 'byung zhing rgyal mtshan de 'dzin pa de ni 'dir ngo tsha med pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa rnam par gnas pa yin gyi pham pa byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the one who is shameless is considered to be the one who is not ashamed of violating the precepts, not the one who has committed a defeating offense.

original: de bas na de la 'dir bzung bar ma mdzad do //
analyzed: de bas na de la 'dir bzung bar ma mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, he should not be expelled from the order.

original: byin len stobs par 'os pa dang 'brel pa ma bral ba'i blang ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bza' par bya ba gang la byin len de stobs par 'os pa'i gang zag dang 'brel pa gang yin pa de dang ji srid du ma bral ba
analyzed: byin len stobs par 'os pa dang 'brel pa ma bral ba'i blang ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bza' par bya ba gang la byin len de stobs par 'os pa'i gang zag dang 'brel pa gang yin pa de dang ji srid du ma bral ba
translated: It is not the taking of what is connected with the one who is worthy of receiving the offering, nor is it the taking of what is not separated from the connection.

original: de'i blang ba yang lag nyar blangs pa nyid kyang ma yin la byin len byas pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i blang ba yang lag nyar blangs pa nyid kyang ma yin la byin len byas pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: It is not the taking of what is held in the hand, nor is it the taking of what has been offered.

original: des gzung ba'i thag pa la dang 'brel pa nyid ni 'brel pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des gzung ba'i thag pa la dang 'brel pa nyid ni 'brel pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The connection with the rope that is held by him is the connection.

original: des zhes bya ba ni byin len stobs par 'os pas so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni byin len stobs par 'os pas so //
translated: By him means by the one who is worthy of receiving the offering.

original: gzung ba'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzung ba'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is held means

original: gang zhig de thag pa la sogs pa de dang zas su 'brel pa nyid yin na byin len stobs par 'os pa'i zas dang 'brel pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig de thag pa la sogs pa de dang zas su 'brel pa nyid yin na byin len stobs par 'os pa'i zas dang 'brel pa nyid yin no //
translated: If it is connected with a rope, etc., it is connected with food that is suitable for the strength of the precepts.

original: sdom pas mnyam pa lta ba tha mi dad pa dag @221b gis gsog 'jog byas pa dang / byin len byas pa dang lag nyar blangs pa dag ni gcig pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sdom pas mnyam pa lta ba tha mi dad pa dag @221b gis gsog 'jog byas pa dang / byin len byas pa dang lag nyar blangs pa dag ni gcig pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is stored by those who are equal in the vows and do not differ in view, the stored, the received, and the held are the same.

original: lta ba tha dad pa'i phyir 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
analyzed: lta ba tha dad pa'i phyir 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
translated: This is the text in the Questions of Upāli:🔽“Venerable, should one eat what has been received and accepted by one who does not agree?”

original: btsun pa rjes su khas ma blangs pas byin len bgyis pa 'tshal bar bgyi 'am nye ba 'khor mi bya'o //
analyzed: btsun pa rjes su khas ma blangs pas byin len bgyis pa 'tshal bar bgyi 'am nye ba 'khor mi bya'o //
translated: “Upāli, one should not.”

original: btsun pa rjes su khas blangs pas byin len bgyis pa 'tshal bar bgyi 'am /
analyzed: btsun pa rjes su khas blangs pas byin len bgyis pa 'tshal bar bgyi 'am /
translated: “Venerable, should one eat what has been received and accepted by one who agrees?”🔽“Upāli, one should not.”

original: nye ba 'khor mi bya'o zhes bya ba 'di ni lta ba tha mi dad pa dag gis zhes bya ba 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor mi bya'o zhes bya ba 'di ni lta ba tha mi dad pa dag gis zhes bya ba 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: This is included in the phrase “by those who do not differ in view.”

original: mchog dang mchog ma yin par ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mchog dang mchog ma yin par ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Superior and inferior” means

original: mchog dang zhes bya ba ni sdom pa mchog dang ldan pa des gzhan la sdom pa gcig pa nyid de gzhan dman pa gang yin pa de ni des gzhan mchog nyid la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mchog dang zhes bya ba ni sdom pa mchog dang ldan pa des gzhan la sdom pa gcig pa nyid de gzhan dman pa gang yin pa de ni des gzhan mchog nyid la ni ma yin no //
translated: The best means that one who possesses the best vows does not possess the same vows as another, but another who is inferior does not possess the best vows.

original: dge slong ma'i gsog 'jog byas pa ni dge slob ma dang bslab pa byin pa mos kyang gsog 'jog byas pa nyid la de gnyis kyis gsog 'jog byas pa ni dge slong mas gsog 'jog byas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de 'dir bsdus pa yin no
analyzed: dge slong ma'i gsog 'jog byas pa ni dge slob ma dang bslab pa byin pa mos kyang gsog 'jog byas pa nyid la de gnyis kyis gsog 'jog byas pa ni dge slong mas gsog 'jog byas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de 'dir bsdus pa yin no
translated: The accumulation of a fully ordained monk is also the accumulation of a female novice and a female novice who has received full ordination. But the accumulation of those two is not the accumulation of a fully ordained monk.

original: // skyes pa dang bud med dag ni phan tshun khyim pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: // skyes pa dang bud med dag ni phan tshun khyim pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Men and women are like laypeople in relation to each other.

original: dper na khyim pas lag nyar blangs pa dang byin len byas pa dang gsog 'jog byas pa dge slong la sogs pa'i lag nyar blangs pa dang byin len byas pa dang / gsog 'jog byas pa nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du dge slong dang dge slong ma dang bslab pa byin pas kyang dge slong dang dge slong ma dang bslab pa byin pa mo dang dge slong ma rnams kyi ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dper na khyim pas lag nyar blangs pa dang byin len byas pa dang gsog 'jog byas pa dge slong la sogs pa'i lag nyar blangs pa dang byin len byas pa dang / gsog 'jog byas pa nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du dge slong dang dge slong ma dang bslab pa byin pas kyang dge slong dang dge slong ma dang bslab pa byin pa mo dang dge slong ma rnams kyi ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that a novice monk and so on does not take possession, accept gifts, and store things like a fully ordained monk, a fully ordained nun, a female novice, and a fully ordained nun.

original: dge tshul dag gi reg pa nas sbed pa'i bar la nyes par mi 'gyur ba ni de bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge tshul dag gi reg pa nas sbed pa'i bar la nyes par mi 'gyur ba ni de bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not a fault for novice monks to touch alcohol and so on up to conceal it.

original: reg pa nas sbed pa'i bar la zhes bya ba ni de la reg pa nas sbed pa'i bdag nyid kyi reg pa'i bar la'o //
analyzed: reg pa nas sbed pa'i bar la zhes bya ba ni de la reg pa nas sbed pa'i bdag nyid kyi reg pa'i bar la'o //
translated: Touching alcohol and so on up to concealing it means that it is not a fault for a novice monk to touch alcohol and so on up to conceal it.

original: nyes par mi 'gyur ba ni de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyes par mi 'gyur ba ni de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Not a fault means it is not a fault.

original: gang gis lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa'i nyes par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du dge tshul dbang ba gang yin pa de dge slong gis sbed par byed du zin kyang des dge slong de nyid dang dge slong gzhan gang la rung ba ma yin pa nyid🔽du mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang gis lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa'i nyes par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du dge tshul dbang ba gang yin pa de dge slong gis sbed par byed du zin kyang des dge slong de nyid dang dge slong gzhan gang la rung ba ma yin pa nyid du mi 'gyur la /
translated: Just as there is no fault in taking hold of it and so on, similarly, if a fully ordained monk conceals the property of a novice monk, that novice monk and any other fully ordained monk are not unsuitable.

original: dge tshul ma dbang ba gang yin pa de dge slong mas sbed par byed du zin kyang des dge slong ma de nyid dang dge slong ma gzhan dag la rung ba ma yin pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge tshul ma dbang ba gang yin pa de dge slong mas sbed par byed du zin kyang des dge slong ma de nyid dang dge slong ma gzhan dag la rung ba ma yin pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If a fully ordained nun conceals the property of a novice nun, that novice nun and any other fully ordained nun are not unsuitable.

original: 'di dge tshul gyi yin pas na dge tshul gyi'o //
analyzed: 'di dge tshul gyi yin pas na dge tshul gyi'o //
translated: This is the property of a novice monk, thus it is a novice monk's property.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pas byin pa ni @222a * //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pas byin pa ni @222a * //
translated: That which is given with reliance is given with reliance.

original: btang ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gang zhig lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa la ltos pa dang bcas pas gzhan la ster na des de za ba la lag nyar blangs pa nyid dang gsog 'jog gi phyed nyid de nyes byas so zhes bya🔽ba'i don to //🔽ltos pa med par btang ba la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid ni phyed nyid do zhes bya ba ni gsog 'jog dang lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa la ltos pa med par btang ba la ltos pa dang bcas pa yod na byin len bya ba dang
analyzed: btang ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gang zhig lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa la ltos pa dang bcas pas gzhan la ster na des de za ba la lag nyar blangs pa nyid dang gsog 'jog gi phyed nyid de nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i don to // ltos pa med par btang ba la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid ni phyed nyid do zhes bya ba ni gsog 'jog dang lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa la ltos pa med par btang ba la ltos pa dang bcas pa yod na byin len bya ba dang
translated: This means that if one gives to another with dependence on taking into one’s own hand and so on, then one’s eating it is taking into one’s own hand and one’s storing it is half of it, which is a misdeed.🔽Giving without dependence is half of it.

original: bza' ba la phyed nyid de nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bza' ba la phyed nyid de nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that if one gives without dependence on storing, taking into one’s own hand and so on, then one’s eating it is taking into one’s own hand and one’s storing it is half of it, which is a misdeed.🔽Therefore, one should not take it.

original: de'i phyir de blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ltos pa med par gtang pa de ni ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyed nyid yin pa de bas na 'di blang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ltos pa med par gtang pa de ni ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyed nyid yin pa de bas na 'di blang bar mi bya ste /
translated: This means that because giving without dependence is half of it due to being dependent, therefore one should not take it.

original: bza' ba'i don du zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bza' ba'i don du zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: for the purpose of eating.

original: gang gi phyir blangs pa la nges par ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid skye ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir blangs pa la nges par ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid skye ba yin no //
translated: Because it is only when one definitely relies on what has been received that it arises.

original: shes bzhin du mi blang ngo zhes bya ba ni ltos pa med par gtad pa de shes bzhin du phyir blangs na rtogs pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: shes bzhin du mi blang ngo zhes bya ba ni ltos pa med par gtad pa de shes bzhin du phyir blangs na rtogs pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: One should not receive it knowingly means that if one receives back that which has been given without reliance, knowingly, it becomes received with understanding.

original: mi shes pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi shes pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: But not if it is unknowingly.

original: de bas na shes bzhin du blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na shes bzhin du blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not receive it knowingly.

original: mi shes pas blangs pa la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: mi shes pas blangs pa la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in receiving it unknowingly.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis kun dga' ra ba 'am dge tshul la zas brtsal ba de gnyis kyi de nyid la slar brtsal na 'tshal bar bgyi 'am /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis kun dga' ra ba 'am dge tshul la zas brtsal ba de gnyis kyi de nyid la slar brtsal na 'tshal bar bgyi 'am /
translated: Here, the text of the question is: “Venerable, if a monk or novice monk seeks food in a monastery, should they seek it again in that very place?

original: gal te mngon par ma bsams na bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te mngon par ma bsams na bza' bar bya'o //
translated: If they do not think about it, they should eat it.

original: blang bar bgyi'am nye ba 'khor mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: blang bar bgyi'am nye ba 'khor mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Should they receive it? Upāli, they should not.”

original: mngon par ma bsams na zhes bya ba ni 'thob bo snyam du yid kyis ma bsams na'o //
analyzed: mngon par ma bsams na zhes bya ba ni 'thob bo snyam du yid kyis ma bsams na'o //
translated: If one does not think about it means if one does not think with the mind, “I will obtain it.”

original: gleng gzhi dag las kyang ltos pa dang bcas pas zos na'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gleng gzhi dag las kyang ltos pa dang bcas pas zos na'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And in the nidana, it is said, “If one eats with dependence, etc.”

original: shas mnod pa dang de 'gugs pa'i phyir reg pa ni rkyen de lta bu dag yod na rung ba ma yin pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shas mnod pa dang de 'gugs pa'i phyir reg pa ni rkyen de lta bu dag yod na rung ba ma yin pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: If one touches in order to take a portion and to summon it, it is not improper if such conditions exist.

original: shas mnod pa zhes bya ba ni skal pa slong ba'o //
analyzed: shas mnod pa zhes bya ba ni skal pa slong ba'o //
translated: Taking a portion means to request a portion.

original: bkug par 'gyur ba ni 'di gtsug lag khang du khyer ba byed pa nyid ces bya ba skal ba len pa gsungs pa gang yin pa de la reg pa la mi rung ba nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bkug par 'gyur ba ni 'di gtsug lag khang du khyer ba byed pa nyid ces bya ba skal ba len pa gsungs pa gang yin pa de la reg pa la mi rung ba nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Summoning means that one should bring it to the monastery. This is what is said in the request for a portion. There is no impropriety in touching it.

original: ci dus thams cad du 'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci dus thams cad du 'am zhe na /
translated: Is it at all times?

original: ma yin zhes bya ba bstan pa ni de'i phyir rkyen de lta bu dag yod na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ma yin zhes bya ba bstan pa ni de'i phyir rkyen de lta bu dag yod na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The answer is no. The explanation is given: If such conditions exist.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dag med pa'am nad pa nyid la gru dang shing rta gnas pa la sbyar ba 'di dag la gzhan @222b med pa la grogs byed pa po dang grogs byed pa la zhugs pa gzhan med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams so
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dag med pa'am nad pa nyid la gru dang shing rta gnas pa la sbyar ba 'di dag la gzhan @222b med pa la grogs byed pa po dang grogs byed pa la zhugs pa gzhan med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams so
translated: The exception is when there is no one else to do it, and when one is helping someone else who is sick, and so on.🔽In the case of a carriage, the exception is when there is no seat for the driver.

original: // shing rta la ni kha lo ba'i stan ma gtogs pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'di dag thams cad kyang rkyen de lta bu dag yod pa na zhes bya ba'i rjes su sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: // shing rta la ni kha lo ba'i stan ma gtogs pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'di dag thams cad kyang rkyen de lta bu dag yod pa na zhes bya ba'i rjes su sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: All of these exceptions should be understood as applying to the phrase “when the conditions are like that.”

original: rkyen de lta bu rnams ni shing rta bskul bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dir gsungs so //
analyzed: rkyen de lta bu rnams ni shing rta bskul bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dir gsungs so //
translated: The conditions like that are stated in the passage that begins, “When the conditions are like that, one may drive a carriage.”

original: mi bya bar brjod pa tsam du zad pa 'di rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: mi bya bar brjod pa tsam du zad pa 'di rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: This is the only exception to the rule.

original: bza' bar bya ba nang du bcug pa'i shing rta ni reg par bya ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: bza' bar bya ba nang du bcug pa'i shing rta ni reg par bya ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: A carriage that is used to transport food is not to be touched.

original: mi reg tu mi rung ba'i rkyen de lta bu dag yod na de'i tshe yang kha lo ba'i stan gcig po ste gtogs pa'i shing rta la reg par bya'o //
analyzed: mi reg tu mi rung ba'i rkyen de lta bu dag yod na de'i tshe yang kha lo ba'i stan gcig po ste gtogs pa'i shing rta la reg par bya'o //
translated: If there are such conditions that make it improper to touch, then at that time also the driver's seat, which is connected to the chariot, should be touched.

original: 'dir shing rta la reg pa la mi rung ba nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir shing rta la reg pa la mi rung ba nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: Here, it is not improper to touch the chariot.

original: shing rta dang 'brel pa'i zas su bya ba la 'di bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shing rta dang 'brel pa'i zas su bya ba la 'di bstan pa'o //
translated: This is taught for the purpose of eating in connection with the chariot.

original: gang ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'bras la sogs pas kha lo ba'i stan gyis shing rta nyid spangs pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'bras la sogs pas kha lo ba'i stan gyis shing rta nyid spangs pa nyid do //
translated: Also when full means that the driver's seat is abandoned when the chariot is full of rice, etc.

original: nad pa zhon pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba na zas kyis stong pa'i shing rta dag yang kha lo ba'i stan spangs pa nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: nad pa zhon pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba na zas kyis stong pa'i shing rta dag yang kha lo ba'i stan spangs pa nyid kho na'o //
translated: Also when carrying a sick person means that when the chariot is empty of food, the driver's seat is abandoned.

original: gru la ni ru skya'o zhes bya ba ni de dang 'brel pa'i bza' bar bya ba bcug pa'i gru dang de dag 'brel pas gang ba'i gru dang grur 'jug pa la ru skya spangs pa nyid do //
analyzed: gru la ni ru skya'o zhes bya ba ni de dang 'brel pa'i bza' bar bya ba bcug pa'i gru dang de dag 'brel pas gang ba'i gru dang grur 'jug pa la ru skya spangs pa nyid do //
translated: In a boat, on a reed mat means that when a boat is loaded with food connected to it, or when a boat is full by connection with them, the reed mat is abandoned in entering the boat.

original: na ba med kyang 'dir 'jug pa rigs pa zhes gsungs pa de bas na na ba'i sgras ni 'di las bzlog pas shes pa'o //
analyzed: na ba med kyang 'dir 'jug pa rigs pa zhes gsungs pa de bas na na ba'i sgras ni 'di las bzlog pas shes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the term “sick” should be understood as the opposite of this.

original: de 'dzin pa'i stan yang ngo zhes bya ba ni ru skya 'dzin pa'i don can gyi stan las de 'brel pa'i kha zas su byas pa la reg pa dang gang ba dang grur 'jug pa na spang bar bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de 'dzin pa'i stan yang ngo zhes bya ba ni ru skya 'dzin pa'i don can gyi stan las de 'brel pa'i kha zas su byas pa la reg pa dang gang ba dang grur 'jug pa na spang bar bya ba nyid do //
translated: Also, the seat for holding it: in the sense of holding a reed, it is to be abandoned when touching, filling, or entering a boat that is made related to it through food.

original: dge 'dun gyi sman dag ldud pa ni bskyam pa dang dbyung ba dang gzar bu'i las dang dbog pa dag la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi za ba la sogs pa sman dag dang gang zag gi yang rung ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi sman dag ldud pa ni bskyam pa dang dbyung ba dang gzar bu'i las dang dbog pa dag la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi za ba la sogs pa sman dag dang gang zag gi yang rung ste /
translated: Also, when administering medicine for the Saṅgha, in the actions of sprinkling, extracting, using a spoon, and pouring.

original: de dag ldud pa na bskyam pa la sogs pa'i phyir reg pa la yang mi rung ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ldud pa na bskyam pa la sogs pa'i phyir reg pa la yang mi rung ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When administering those, it is not improper to touch for the sake of sprinkling and so on.

original: ci dang po nyid du 'di dag rnam pa 'di la bu nyid la reg par bya ba nyid yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang po nyid du 'di dag rnam pa 'di la bu nyid la reg par bya ba nyid yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are these initially only to be touched in this way?

original: de'i phyir dang por shing dbri ba dang me gsad pa dang gos kyi thu ba la sogs pas rlung g-yab pas 'bad par bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dang por shing dbri ba dang me gsad pa dang gos kyi thu ba la sogs pas rlung g-yab pas 'bad par bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, first of all, one should make an effort to remove the wood, extinguish the fire, and fan the area with one's robes, etc.

original: dang po kho nar lud pa zhi bar bya ba'i phyir 'di ltar 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: dang po kho nar lud pa zhi bar bya ba'i phyir 'di ltar 'bad par bya'o //
translated: One should make an effort in this way in order to remove the phlegm.

original: de ltar gnyen por bya ba ma grub pa la bskyam pa la sogs pa bya zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽gnyen po byed @223a * //
analyzed: de ltar gnyen por bya ba ma grub pa la bskyam pa la sogs pa bya zhes bya ba'i don to // gnyen po byed @223a * //
translated: The meaning is that one should not be discouraged about the non-establishment of the antidote.🔽If one is not able to act as an antidote, there is no fault in not fanning, etc.

original: pa'i nus pa med na ma reg par bskyam pa la sogs pa la nyes pa med ces bya ba 'dir de la rtse gcig pa nyid du rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'i nus pa med na ma reg par bskyam pa la sogs pa la nyes pa med ces bya ba 'dir de la rtse gcig pa nyid du rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Here, one should remain in one-pointedness.

original: de bas na 'di ltar shes par gyur pa la gnyen por bya ba ma yin pa nyid de dang por bskyam pa la sogs pa nyes pa med ces bya ba rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar shes par gyur pa la gnyen por bya ba ma yin pa nyid de dang por bskyam pa la sogs pa nyes pa med ces bya ba rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that it is not the antidote, and that there is no fault in not fanning, etc. at the beginning.

original: chu klung rgal ba'i phyir ram khur tsha ba snyeg pa'i phyir lag nyar blangs pa'i lam brgyags rung ste /
analyzed: chu klung rgal ba'i phyir ram khur tsha ba snyeg pa'i phyir lag nyar blangs pa'i lam brgyags rung ste /
translated: For example, when crossing a river or carrying a heavy load, one should take a rest.

original: cho ga ma 'byor tam lam brgyags gzhan med na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: cho ga ma 'byor tam lam brgyags gzhan med na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If there is no ritual, or if there is no other food.

original: rung ste zhes bya ba ni bzar rung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rung ste zhes bya ba ni bzar rung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “ If it is suitable” means if it is suitable to eat.

original: cho ga ma 'byor tam zhes bya ba ni gang gis reg pa la blangs pa nyid ma yin na des ni chu klung rgal ba dang snyeg pa 'di dag la bya ba nyid do //🔽des gnas pa la rang gi yan lag gam de dang 'brel pa gzhan gyis shes par bya ba 'di la bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: cho ga ma 'byor tam zhes bya ba ni gang gis reg pa la blangs pa nyid ma yin na des ni chu klung rgal ba dang snyeg pa 'di dag la bya ba nyid do // des gnas pa la rang gi yan lag gam de dang 'brel pa gzhan gyis shes par bya ba 'di la bya ba nyid do //
translated: “ If there is no ritual” means if it is not obtained by one who has the ritual, then it is suitable for one who has crossed a river or is traveling.🔽“ If there is no other” means if there is no other who is able to carry a heavy load, then it is suitable for one who is unable to carry a heavy load.

original: gzhan med na'o zhes bya ba ni gal te gzhan khur tsha ba med par gyur na de la cho ga ma grub pa'i dbang gis 'dir don du bskur ba la rung ba nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan med na'o zhes bya ba ni gal te gzhan khur tsha ba med par gyur na de la cho ga ma grub pa'i dbang gis 'dir don du bskur ba la rung ba nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: “ If there is no other” means if there is no other who is able to carry a heavy load, then it is suitable for one who is unable to carry a heavy load.🔽“ If there is no other” means if there is no other who is able to carry a heavy load, then it is suitable for one who is unable to carry a heavy load.🔽“ If there is no other” means if there is no other who is able to carry a heavy load, then it is suitable for one who is unable to carry a heavy load.🔽“ If there is no other” means if there is no other who is able to carry a heavy load, then it is suitable for one who is unable to carry a heavy load.

original: khur tsha ba med na sbyin bdag spro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni lam brgyags de khyer ba'i khur tsha ba gzhan med na de sbyin bdag gis de la bskur bar spro ba bskyed par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khur tsha ba med na sbyin bdag spro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni lam brgyags de khyer ba'i khur tsha ba gzhan med na de sbyin bdag gis de la bskur bar spro ba bskyed par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that if there is no other heavy burden to carry, one should encourage the patron to give it to him.🔽If there is no one to carry it, one should do it oneself.

original: khyer ba med na rang gis so zhes bya ba ni sbyin bdag la bcol ba yang ma grub na /
analyzed: khyer ba med na rang gis so zhes bya ba ni sbyin bdag la bcol ba yang ma grub na /
translated: If it is not possible to entrust it to the patron,

original: de'i tshe rang gis lam brgyags bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe rang gis lam brgyags bskur bar bya'o //
translated: at that time one should carry the provisions oneself.🔽In that very text, it is said that one should accomplish the exchange and taking of the gift.

original: de nyid las sbyin par brje zhing blang ba bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan khyer du gzhug pa ma grub cing rang gis khyer bar gyur na /
analyzed: de nyid las sbyin par brje zhing blang ba bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan khyer du gzhug pa ma grub cing rang gis khyer bar gyur na /
translated: If it is not possible to make someone else carry it, and one oneself has to carry it,

original: rang gis khyer ba de nyid las gzhan la sbyin bas lam brgyags brje zhing blang ba bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gis khyer ba de nyid las gzhan la sbyin bas lam brgyags brje zhing blang ba bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is that one should accomplish the exchange and taking of the provisions by giving that very thing one is carrying to another.

original: 'di ni gzhan la bsgrub pa la mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan la bsgrub pa la mi bya'o //
translated: This should not be done for the sake of accomplishing something for another.

original: de yang ma grub na de bza' bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni de yang de nyid kyi phyir sbyin pas brje zhing blang ba ma grub na rang gis khyer ba de yang bza' bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang ma grub na de bza' bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni de yang de nyid kyi phyir sbyin pas brje zhing blang ba ma grub na rang gis khyer ba de yang bza' bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If that is not established, then that which is to be eaten is just that.🔽The meaning is that if the exchange and acceptance of that is not established, then that which one carries oneself is also just that which is to be eaten.

original: byin len stobs pa med na byin len ma byas pa de 'am gzhan yang ngo zhes bya ba ni rang gis khur ba de 'am gzhan byin len byas pa med par gyur na byin len ma byas pa yang bza' bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i
analyzed: byin len stobs pa med na byin len ma byas pa de 'am gzhan yang ngo zhes bya ba ni rang gis khur ba de 'am gzhan byin len byas pa med par gyur na byin len ma byas pa yang bza' bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i
translated: If the strength of giving and receiving is not present, then that which is not given and received, or another, is also. The meaning is that if that which one carries oneself, or another, does not have giving and receiving, then that which is not given and received is also just that which is to be eaten.

original: don to // slar rang gis khyer ba dang byin len ma byas pa de gnyis gang gis bza' bar bya ba nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: don to // slar rang gis khyer ba dang byin len ma byas pa de gnyis gang gis bza' bar bya ba nyid yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the two, that which one carries oneself and that which is not given and received, being just that which is to be eaten?

original: de'i phyir zan bcad par byas pa'i 'o @223b zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zan bcad par byas pa'i 'o @223b zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “of one who has fasted.”

original: gang la ji tsam bza' bar bya ba nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang la ji tsam bza' bar bya ba nyid yin zhe na /
translated: What is the measure of that which is to be eaten?

original: de'i phyir nyi ma dang po la spar gang ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyi ma dang po la spar gang ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “on the first day, a full handspan.”

original: gnyis pa la ni do'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni do'o //
translated: In the second, it is a morsel.

original: gsum pa la ni ci tsam gyis chog pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni ci tsam gyis chog pa'o //
translated: In the third, it is as much as one needs.

original: shing thog rung bar ma byas pa dang byin len ma byas pa dang / lag nyar blangs pa dag kyang dus ma yin par yang bza' bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: shing thog rung bar ma byas pa dang byin len ma byas pa dang / lag nyar blangs pa dag kyang dus ma yin par yang bza' bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Also, fruit that is not suitable, that is, not given or received, and that is held in the hand, should be eaten even out of season.

original: de dag thams cad kyang gzhan ma grub na zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang gzhan ma grub na zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas pa nyid yin no //
translated: And all of these are also governed by the statement, “if the other is not available.”

original: de dag su'i bza' bar bya ba nyid yin zhe na /🔽de'i phyir zan med na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de dag su'i bza' bar bya ba nyid yin zhe na / de'i phyir zan med na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Whose should it be that is to be eaten?🔽Therefore, it is said, “if there is no other food.”

original: zan med par gyur pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zan med par gyur pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: if there is no other food.

original: ci gnas skabs thams cad du 'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci gnas skabs thams cad du 'am zhe na /
translated: Is it in all circumstances?

original: de'i phyir shin tu bkres pa nyid na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir shin tu bkres pa nyid na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “if there is extreme hunger.”

original: bkres pa srog la bab pa la thug na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bkres pa srog la bab pa la thug na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: if hunger is life-threatening.

original: rtsa ba dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang dus ma yin par bza' bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rtsa ba dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang dus ma yin par bza' bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and roots are also to be eaten out of season.

original: rang gis kyang btogs pa nyid dang dbyung pa nyid dang bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni zas med pa shin tu bkres pa nyid na 'bras bu rnams dang rtsa ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: rang gis kyang btogs pa nyid dang dbyung pa nyid dang bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni zas med pa shin tu bkres pa nyid na 'bras bu rnams dang rtsa ba rnams la'o //
translated: One should also know that fruits and roots are to be gathered, dug up, and cultivated by oneself when one is very hungry and has no food.

original: 'dir grangs ji lta ba bzhin du shes par mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir grangs ji lta ba bzhin du shes par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not understand this in the order in which it is stated.

original: rtsa ba rnams la yang btogs pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsa ba rnams la yang btogs pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For roots are also to be gathered.

original: dper na chu 'gram du skyes pa ngos ltung ba rnams lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na chu 'gram du skyes pa ngos ltung ba rnams lta bu'o //
translated: For example, those growing on the bank of a river, which fall on the ground by themselves.

original: 'bras bu rnams la yang bton pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnams la yang bton pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And fruits are also to be dug up.

original: dper na pa na sa la sogs pa rnams lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na pa na sa la sogs pa rnams lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the panasa, etc.

original: byin len ma bstabs pa dang rung bar ma byas pa dang dus ma yin par bza' ba la sogs pa rung bar bya ba dag la thams cad du rtsom 'dod pa la sogs pa na byang gi sgra mi snyan na grags pa'i yid la byed pa bya'o zhes
analyzed: byin len ma bstabs pa dang rung bar ma byas pa dang dus ma yin par bza' ba la sogs pa rung bar bya ba dag la thams cad du rtsom 'dod pa la sogs pa na byang gi sgra mi snyan na grags pa'i yid la byed pa bya'o zhes
translated: When one is about to begin eating what is not fit to be eaten, such as what has not been offered and accepted, what has not been made permissible, or what is untimely, one should apply the attention known in Uttarakuru.

original: bya ba ni rang gis byed par 'dra ba la rnam par dag par gyur pa'i sde 'di skas kyi gdang bu lta bur gyur pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba ni rang gis byed par 'dra ba la rnam par dag par gyur pa'i sde 'di skas kyi gdang bu lta bur gyur pa ste /
translated: This is the pure stage of this assembly, like the steps of a staircase.

original: bye brag thob pa'i phyir de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: bye brag thob pa'i phyir de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: It is like that in order to obtain the distinctions.

original: ji ltar mngon bar 'du byed pas kyang yid las nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rtsom 'dod pa na'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mngon bar 'du byed pas kyang yid las nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rtsom 'dod pa na'o //
translated: Also by way of manifest activity, one should be liberated from the mind, which is about to begin.

original: de bas na 'dir thams cad du byung gi sgra mi snyan na grags pa'i phyir rtsom 'dod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir thams cad du byung gi sgra mi snyan na grags pa'i phyir rtsom 'dod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, here, in order to be known in Uttarakuru, one should be about to begin.

original: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba dang 'bras bu la brten ba 'di nyid la ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba dang 'bras bu la brten ba 'di nyid la ma yin no //
translated: Everywhere means not just in this very place, based on roots and fruits.

original: 'dir sogs pa'i sgras ni len pa dang nye bar len pa'i don du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir sogs pa'i sgras ni len pa dang nye bar len pa'i don du rig par bya'o //
translated: The words “and so on” should be understood to mean “to take up” and “to be taken up.”

original: lag pa bsnyal ba dang 'dab ma dag yod na skyogs kyis skom mi btung ngo @224a * //
analyzed: lag pa bsnyal ba dang 'dab ma dag yod na skyogs kyis skom mi btung ngo @224a * //
translated: If one has a water-pot and leaves, one should not drink water from one’s cupped hands.

original: zhes bya ba ni chu nyung zad nyid dang lam 'gron shor ba la sogs pas lag pa bsnyal ba med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chu nyung zad nyid dang lam 'gron shor ba la sogs pas lag pa bsnyal ba med pa'o //
translated: This means that if one has a water-pot and leaves, one should not drink water from one’s cupped hands if one has only a little water, or if one is traveling on a road, or if one has lost one’s water-pot.

original: med na ma bsgribs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: med na ma bsgribs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one does not have a water-pot, one should not drink water from one’s cupped hands in the open.

original: lag pa bsnyal ba dang 'dab ma dag med na skyogs kyis skom btung ba ma bsgribs par btung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: lag pa bsnyal ba dang 'dab ma dag med na skyogs kyis skom btung ba ma bsgribs par btung bar mi bya'o //
translated: This means that if one does not have a water-pot and leaves, one should not drink water from one’s cupped hands in the open.🔽If one has a water-pot, one should not keep it open.

original: de chu dang bcas pa nyid yin na kha ma bcad pa nyid du mi gzhag go zhes bya ba de la de zhes bya ba ni skyogs so //
analyzed: de chu dang bcas pa nyid yin na kha ma bcad pa nyid du mi gzhag go zhes bya ba de la de zhes bya ba ni skyogs so //
translated: In this case, “it” refers to the water-pot.

original: de'i kha gab ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de'i kha gab ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of covers for it:

original: shing las byas pa dang rdo las byas pa dang sa las byas pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shing las byas pa dang rdo las byas pa dang sa las byas pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: made of wood, made of stone, and made of clay.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni skyogs la'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni skyogs la'o //
translated: In this case, “it” refers to the water-pot.

original: skyogs gzhi shing las byas pa'am rdo las byas pa bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skyogs gzhi shing las byas pa'am rdo las byas pa bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The bowl base should be made of wood or stone.

original: gang du gnas pa'i don du skyogs 'di gzhag par bya ba de ni skyogs kyi gzhi'o //
analyzed: gang du gnas pa'i don du skyogs 'di gzhag par bya ba de ni skyogs kyi gzhi'o //
translated: The bowl base is that on which the bowl is placed for the purpose of keeping it.

original: 'dab ma dag snod nyid du spyod pa ni byin len ma byas pa nyid la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'dab ma dag snod nyid du spyod pa ni byin len ma byas pa nyid la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one uses the leaves as a container, since they are not consecrated.

original: 'di la brngas pa dang ma brngas pa dag ni khyad par med do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di la brngas pa dang ma brngas pa dag ni khyad par med do zhes bya ba la /
translated: There is no difference between what is cut and what is not cut.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba shing ljon pa la sogs pa ma brngas pa dag la yang skyes pa las 'di rnams dang 'brel pas 'dir nyes pa med pa ni byin len ma byas pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba shing ljon pa la sogs pa ma brngas pa dag la yang skyes pa las 'di rnams dang 'brel pas 'dir nyes pa med pa ni byin len ma byas pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: In this case, there is no difference between what is cut and what is not cut, such as a tree, etc. There is no offense if one uses what is not cut, since it is related to what is cut. The meaning of not consecrated is understood.

original: gzhan med na ma brngas pa dag spyad do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan med na ma brngas pa dag spyad do zhes bya ba la /
translated: If there is none, one may use what is not cut.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni 'dab ma brngas pa'am de'i don byed nus pa gzhan la'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni 'dab ma brngas pa'am de'i don byed nus pa gzhan la'o //
translated: If there is none means if there is no other consecrated leaf or if one is unable to make use of it.

original: shing ljon pa la sogs pa dag dang 'brel pa'i skom la sogs pa 'thung bar byed pa bzhad gang du 'gyur bas mi bya'o zhes bya ba 'di la bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shing ljon pa la sogs pa dag dang 'brel pa'i skom la sogs pa 'thung bar byed pa bzhad gang du 'gyur bas mi bya'o zhes bya ba 'di la bstan pa'o //
translated: One should not drink water that is related to trees and so forth, because it is said, It is not to be done, since it is a source of laughter.

original: gsog 'jog gi ltung byed do /
analyzed: gsog 'jog gi ltung byed do /
translated: The downfall is accrued by the monk who stores things.🔽If there is no one to give and receive, then one may take and eat the food that has been given by the donor with a pure intention.

original: // / gzhan dang byin len stobs pa med na sbyin bdag gis bsam pa thag pa nas btang ba rang gis blangs te bza' bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni byin len ma bstabs par bza' ba thams cad la byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i dus su byin gyis brlab🔽par bya'o zhes bya ba thams cad du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: // / gzhan dang byin len stobs pa med na sbyin bdag gis bsam pa thag pa nas btang ba rang gis blangs te bza' bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni byin len ma bstabs par bza' ba thams cad la byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i dus su byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba thams cad du shes par bya'o //
translated: This is to be understood as the consecration of all food that is not given and received, as stated in the line Consecrate it as if it were in the land of the north.

original: byin len byas zin pa'i zas gzhan med dam byin len stobs pa po gzhan med na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byin len byas zin pa'i zas gzhan med dam byin len stobs pa po gzhan med na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If there is no other food that has been given and received, or if there is no one to give and receive, then one may eat it.

original: gang yang rung ba cig yod na nyes pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba cig yod na nyes pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If either of these two conditions is not met, then one commits an offense.

original: 'dir gzhan med pa'i gzhung ni dge slong gcig gis bsod snyoms blangs te /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan med pa'i gzhung ni dge slong gcig gis bsod snyoms blangs te /
translated: The text that states that there is no one else to do it is as follows: A single monk takes alms.

original: gtsug lag khang du bzhag nas phyi rol du byung ba dang / khyim bdag gcig gis kyang bsod snyoms gcig khyer te 'ongs nas de nyid kyi steng du bsod snyoms gzhan gzhag pa mthong nas de 'gyod pa skyes te mi za ba'i skabs de dge slong dag gis bcom ldan @224b 'das la gsol pa dang /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du bzhag nas phyi rol du byung ba dang / khyim bdag gcig gis kyang bsod snyoms gcig khyer te 'ongs nas de nyid kyi steng du bsod snyoms gzhan gzhag pa mthong nas de 'gyod pa skyes te mi za ba'i skabs de dge slong dag gis bcom ldan @224b 'das la gsol pa dang /
translated: The monks reported this to the Blessed One,

original: ji srid du bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ji srid du bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: and the Blessed One said,

original: gal te byin len stobs pa yod na ni byin len byas te bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te byin len stobs pa yod na ni byin len byas te bza' bar bya'o //
translated: “If there is someone to do the receiving, then the receiving should be done and it should be eaten.

original: ci ste med na ni phyis byin pa gang yin pa de bsal te snga ma shos bza' bar bya ste /
analyzed: ci ste med na ni phyis byin pa gang yin pa de bsal te snga ma shos bza' bar bya ste /
translated: If there is no one, then the later offering should be removed and the earlier one should be eaten.

original: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: There is no need for remorse in this case.”🔽The text on the absence of a need for receiving is as follows:

original: byin len bstabs pa med pa'i gzhung ni de nyid las tshong ba rab tu mang po dag gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun bshos la spyan drangs te /
analyzed: byin len bstabs pa med pa'i gzhung ni de nyid las tshong ba rab tu mang po dag gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun bshos la spyan drangs te /
translated: Many merchants invited the Buddha and the saṅgha of monks to a meal.

original: de dag gis zas dag spyi bungs bcer ba dang / tshong khang dag tu me shor nas de dag me gsod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gis zas dag spyi bungs bcer ba dang / tshong khang dag tu me shor nas de dag me gsod pa'i phyir /
translated: They were distracted by the general distribution of food and a fire broke out in the marketplace.🔽They were distracted by extinguishing the fire and the time for the meal arrived.

original: dong pa dang gdugs tshod dag kyang bab par gyur nas dge slong dag gis ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba mi shes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dong pa dang gdugs tshod dag kyang bab par gyur nas dge slong dag gis ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba mi shes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The monks did not know how to proceed and the Bhagavān said,

original: de dag gis bsam pa dag pas btang ba yin pas byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i dus su byin gyis brlab cing bza' bar bya ste /
analyzed: de dag gis bsam pa dag pas btang ba yin pas byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i dus su byin gyis brlab cing bza' bar bya ste /
translated: “Since they were distracted by pure thoughts, they should consecrate and eat as if it were the time of Uttarakuru.

original: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Do not regret this.”🔽The foremost knowledge is that of the unaccepted.

original: shes gtso bo byin len ma byas pa nyid la'o zhes 'og nas 'byung na de byin len gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: shes gtso bo byin len ma byas pa nyid la'o zhes 'og nas 'byung na de byin len gang yin zhe na /
