translated: What is that unaccepted?

original: de'i phyir de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de brjod par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it should be stated.

original: mngon sum du mtshams kyi nang du 'thob pa'i phyogs na gnas pas lag pa bkan pas lus sam de dang 'brel par gyen du 'degs nus pa bsnyen par rdzogs pa mi ma yin las kyang sbyin par 'dod pas yan lag gis sam de dang 'brel pas byin pa🔽ma nos pa ni byin len no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mngon sum du mtshams kyi nang du 'thob pa'i phyogs na gnas pas lag pa bkan pas lus sam de dang 'brel par gyen du 'degs nus pa bsnyen par rdzogs pa mi ma yin las kyang sbyin par 'dod pas yan lag gis sam de dang 'brel pas byin pa ma nos pa ni byin len no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The candidate should not be received by extending a limb or raising it up in relation to a nonhuman.

original: mngon sum du zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du phyogs pa ste /
analyzed: mngon sum du zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du phyogs pa ste /
translated: Directly means directly facing.

original: glo'am rgyab nas blangs pa ni byin len ma yin no //
analyzed: glo'am rgyab nas blangs pa ni byin len ma yin no //
translated: If the candidate is received from behind or from the side, it is not a proper reception.

original: mtshams kyi nang du zhes bya ba la 'di ni spros pa ste /
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang du zhes bya ba la 'di ni spros pa ste /
translated: Within the boundaries means that this is an elaboration.

original: mtshams gzhan na gnas pa gang la yan lag nyid ma yin zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mtshams gzhan na gnas pa gang la yan lag nyid ma yin zhes gsungs so //
translated: If the preceptor is in another boundary, it is said that the candidate is not a limb.

original: gyen du 'degs nus pa las zhes bya ba ni gang zhig sbyin par nus pa de las so //
analyzed: gyen du 'degs nus pa las zhes bya ba ni gang zhig sbyin par nus pa de las so //
translated: From one who can raise up means from one who can give.

original: mi ma yin pa las kyang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi ma yin pa las kyang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Also from a nonhuman means

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dgon pa ba rnams la dgon pa na gnas pa'i glang po che cang shes dang rta cang shes dang spre'u cang shes dag gis shing thog dag 'bul ba dge slong dag mi len pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dgon pa ba rnams la dgon pa na gnas pa'i glang po che cang shes dang rta cang shes dang spre'u cang shes dag gis shing thog dag 'bul ba dge slong dag mi len pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: gang la gyen du 'degs pa yod pa de la byin len yang yod pas bza' bar bya ste /
analyzed: gang la gyen du 'degs pa yod pa de la byin len yang yod pas bza' bar bya ste /
translated: “Since there is also giving and receiving in the case of those who are raised up, you should eat it.

original: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽sbyin par 'dod pas zhes bya ba @225a * //
analyzed: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // sbyin par 'dod pas zhes bya ba @225a * //
translated: Do not regret this.”🔽Here the treatise states:

original: la 'dir gzhung ni dbang med pa la sogs pas sbyin par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: la 'dir gzhung ni dbang med pa la sogs pas sbyin par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “One should not give through lack of independence and so on.”

original: yul gyis mi smad par bya ba nyid yin na dkyil 'khor gyi steng du zhog cig ces bstan na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni de ltar nye bar bstan pa'i dkyil 'khor la yang btang ba la so sor 'dod pa ni byin len mnos pa yin gyi lus
analyzed: yul gyis mi smad par bya ba nyid yin na dkyil 'khor gyi steng du zhog cig ces bstan na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni de ltar nye bar bstan pa'i dkyil 'khor la yang btang ba la so sor 'dod pa ni byin len mnos pa yin gyi lus
translated: Even though it is taught like this, if one desires to give it to the mandala that is taught in this way, it is not only received by the body or by being connected with that.

original: sam de dang 'brel par mnos pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad do //
analyzed: sam de dang 'brel par mnos pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad do //
translated: The bowl and its base are the same.

original: lhung bzed dang de'i gzhi dag ni gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'di dag las gcig tu byed du bcug ba dag la gzhan du ltung ba mi 'dod pa las skyes par shes par mi bya zhes bya ba de la 'di bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed dang de'i gzhi dag ni gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'di dag las gcig tu byed du bcug ba dag la gzhan du ltung ba mi 'dod pa las skyes par shes par mi bya zhes bya ba de la 'di bstan pa'o //
translated: This is taught in order to show that one should not understand that the other is not obtained from that which is made into one, and that which is not desired due to falling.🔽The domain of the monkeys is the branch, therefore it is not the case that it is not obtained from that.

original: spre'u rnams kyi spyod yul ni yal ga yin pas de nas de'i phyir mi 'thob pa'i sa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yal ga de nas spre'u rnams byin len bstabs pa de'i phyir mi 'thob pa'i sa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spre'u rnams kyi spyod yul ni yal ga yin pas de nas de'i phyir mi 'thob pa'i sa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yal ga de nas spre'u rnams byin len bstabs pa de'i phyir mi 'thob pa'i sa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: This is not the case that the monkeys are not obtained from that branch due to the offering of the bowl.

original: shing thog dag man shel dang khri dang khri'u dang thu ba dang lhung bzed dag gis byin len mnod du mi rung ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shing thog dag man shel dang khri dang khri'u dang thu ba dang lhung bzed dag gis byin len mnod du mi rung ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not the case that fruits, crystal, thrones, benches, cushions, and almsbowls are not suitable for receiving.

original: byin len mnod du zhes bya ba ni byin len gyi bdag nyid can ni byin len grub bar 'gyur ba'i snod du rung bar gyur pa la'o //
analyzed: byin len mnod du zhes bya ba ni byin len gyi bdag nyid can ni byin len grub bar 'gyur ba'i snod du rung bar gyur pa la'o //
translated: The phrase suitable for receiving means that they are suitable as vessels for the accomplishment of the nature of receiving.

original: de dag gnas pa dag gis cang mi smra bas so sor brtag par bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag gnas pa dag gis cang mi smra bas so sor brtag par bya ba la /
translated: Those who are present should examine them by remaining silent.

original: de rnams zhes bya ba ni shing thog rnams la'o //🔽snyoms par 'drim par byed pa mos par bya'o zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'drim pa 'di la yod pas na /
analyzed: de rnams zhes bya ba ni shing thog rnams la'o // snyoms par 'drim par byed pa mos par bya'o zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'drim pa 'di la yod pas na /
translated: Those refers to the fruits.🔽One should be attentive to the equal distribution.

original: snyoms par 'drim pa zhes bya bas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'drim pa zhes bya bas bsdus pa'o //
translated: The word distribution is included in the word equal distribution.

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'drim pa'i phyir khyim pa rnams shing thog dag mi snyoms par 'drim par byed nas /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'drim pa'i phyir khyim pa rnams shing thog dag mi snyoms par 'drim par byed nas /
translated: Here is the text: Laypeople distribute fruits unequally.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: dge tshul dag brim du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: dge tshul dag brim du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Novices should be made to distribute.

original: dge tshul dag kyang mi snyoms par 'drim par byed nas /
analyzed: dge tshul dag kyang mi snyoms par 'drim par byed nas /
translated: Novice monks also distributed the food unevenly.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: dge slong dag gis lag pa dag bsnyal te byin len byas nas brim par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽dge slong byin len byas pas brim pa nyid ni rung ba nyid yin no zhes zas byin len byas pa brim pa nyid ni rung ba yin te /
analyzed: dge slong dag gis lag pa dag bsnyal te byin len byas nas brim par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // dge slong byin len byas pas brim pa nyid ni rung ba nyid yin no zhes zas byin len byas pa brim pa nyid ni rung ba yin te /
translated: “Monks, you should receive the food with your hands and then distribute it.”🔽It is proper to distribute food that has been received by a monk.

original: tshul dang mi mthun pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshul dang mi mthun pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is proper to distribute food that has been received by a monk. It is not improper.

original: mar dang 'bru mar dang sprang rtsi dang bu ram gyi dbu ba'i bum pa dag 'drim na rtsva dang lo ma dag la sogs pa dag gis gos dag bskyab par bya'o //
analyzed: mar dang 'bru mar dang sprang rtsi dang bu ram gyi dbu ba'i bum pa dag 'drim na rtsva dang lo ma dag la sogs pa dag gis gos dag bskyab par bya'o //
translated: If you distribute a pot of ghee, oil, honey, or molasses, you should protect your robes with grass, leaves, and so forth.

original: brim par bya ba gces pa dang @225b bar ma dang tha ma dag so sor bya'o zhes bya ba ni brim par bya ba'i zas 'di rnams ni so sor brim par bya ste mi bsre bar brim par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brim par bya ba gces pa dang @225b bar ma dang tha ma dag so sor bya'o zhes bya ba ni brim par bya ba'i zas 'di rnams ni so sor brim par bya ste mi bsre bar brim par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that this food to be distributed should be distributed separately, not mixed together.🔽The delicious mangoes should be distributed separately.

original: aa mra zhim po dag logs shig tu bsal te brim par bya'o zhes bya ba la mdo snga ma 'di snyoms par bsal ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: aa mra zhim po dag logs shig tu bsal te brim par bya'o zhes bya ba la mdo snga ma 'di snyoms par bsal ba'i don du'o //
translated: The previous sūtra is for the purpose of distributing equally.

original: 'di rnams ni rgan pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di rnams ni rgan pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: These are not the elders.

original: de bas na spros pa 'di ni rgan pa dang gzhon pa dang bar ma dag la shes par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na spros pa 'di ni rgan pa dang gzhon pa dang bar ma dag la shes par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this elaboration should not be known for the elders, the young, and the middle-aged.

original: 'drim par byed pa yi ni mkhan po'am slob dpon gyis mnod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'drim par byed pa yi ni mkhan po'am slob dpon gyis mnod par bya'o //
translated: The distributor, whether an ācārya or upādhyāya, should take it.

original: mi 'thob pa 'thob na drung du 'dug pas so zhes bya ba gal te mkhan po'am slob dpon gyis 'drim par byed pas mi thob pa thob pa mi rigs ba ni gnas gzhan ma yin pas 'di la byin len du bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'thob pa 'thob na drung du 'dug pas so zhes bya ba gal te mkhan po'am slob dpon gyis 'drim par byed pas mi thob pa thob pa mi rigs ba ni gnas gzhan ma yin pas 'di la byin len du bya ba'o //
translated: If the one who is not receiving receives, it is by sitting in front. If the ācārya or upādhyāya is distributing and the one who is not receiving receives, it is not proper. Since it is not another place, it should be received here.

original: 'dir gzhung ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Here the treatise states:

original: 'drim par byed pa'i skal pa ni mkhan po dang slob dpon dag gis mnod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'drim par byed pa'i skal pa ni mkhan po dang slob dpon dag gis mnod par bya'o //
translated: The opportunity to receive the precepts is from the preceptor and the master.

original: de dag gis bzang po dag thob nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de dag gis bzang po dag thob nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: When they have obtained the good ones, the Blessed One said:

original: de dag gi drung du 'dug pa dag gis mnod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi drung du 'dug pa dag gis mnod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Those who are seated in their presence should receive them.

original: du ma nyid yin na stan las ma 'phags pas ji tsam len nus pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: du ma nyid yin na stan las ma 'phags pas ji tsam len nus pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If there are many, as many as one can receive without rising from one's seat.

original: gang gi don du de ma thag pa'i gnas la gzung bar bya ba nyid ni de dag du ma la stan las ma 'phags par ji tsam len nus pa de tsam mnod par bya zhing de ma thag pa'i gnas dang ldan pas gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi don du de ma thag pa'i gnas la gzung bar bya ba nyid ni de dag du ma la stan las ma 'phags par ji tsam len nus pa de tsam mnod par bya zhing de ma thag pa'i gnas dang ldan pas gzung bar bya'o //
translated: As many as one can receive without rising from one's seat, for the purpose of the immediately preceding state, should be received and held with the immediately preceding state.

original: 'dril ba la ni rang gnas las ma 'phags pas len nus pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'dril ba la ni rang gnas las ma 'phags pas len nus pa nyid yin na /
translated: If there is a gathering, as many as one can receive without rising from one's own seat.

original: byin len ma zhig go zhes bya ba ni gang zhig byin len byas pa'i zas 'dril cing gnas nas gdu du song ba gang yin pa de ni stan las ma 'phags pas len nus pa nyid yin na byin len ma zhig pa yin la gzhan du na zhig
analyzed: byin len ma zhig go zhes bya ba ni gang zhig byin len byas pa'i zas 'dril cing gnas nas gdu du song ba gang yin pa de ni stan las ma 'phags pas len nus pa nyid yin na byin len ma zhig pa yin la gzhan du na zhig
translated: Food that is not properly received is food that is rolled into a ball and placed in the mouth without rising from one's seat.🔽

original: pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: pa kho na yin no //
translated: That which is not received is food that is rolled up and remains in a place where it has been warmed by fire. If it is not removed from its place, it can be received by one who has not received it. Otherwise, it is destroyed.

original: sprang bu dang grog sbur la sogs pa dag gis reg pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni byin len ma zhig ba'o //
analyzed: sprang bu dang grog sbur la sogs pa dag gis reg pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni byin len ma zhig ba'o //
translated: That which is touched by flies, ants, and so on is not received.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni byi'u phrug byung ma thag pa'i tshad pas kyang chung ba'i skye ba phra mo dag bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni byi'u phrug byung ma thag pa'i tshad pas kyang chung ba'i skye ba phra mo dag bsdu'o //
translated: The term “and so on” includes small creatures that are smaller than the size of a newly hatched sparrow.

original: dge slong gis ma btang ba la gzhan gyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni dge slong gis 'dzin pa ma btang ba la sprang bu dang grog sbur la sogs pa gzhan gyis reg pas kyang byin len ma zhig pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis ma btang ba la gzhan gyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni dge slong gis 'dzin pa ma btang ba la sprang bu dang grog sbur la sogs pa gzhan gyis reg pas kyang byin len ma zhig pa'o //
translated: That which is touched by others, such as flies and ants, is not received if it is not released by a fully ordained monk.🔽Here is the text:

original: 'dir gzhung ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: de nyid kyis byin len bya zhing de la bgo bsha' bya ste bza' bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa @226a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyis byin len bya zhing de la bgo bsha' bya ste bza' bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa @226a * //
translated: He should take it back and distribute it, and then eat it.

original: yin no // byi bas ni gzhig par byed do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yin no // byi bas ni gzhig par byed do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A mouse destroys it.

original: byi bas reg pas ni byin len zhig par byed do //🔽'dir gzhung ni de ltar der sbrang bu dang grog sbur dang byi ba'i bar dag lhung nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: byi bas reg pas ni byin len zhig par byed do // 'dir gzhung ni de ltar der sbrang bu dang grog sbur dang byi ba'i bar dag lhung nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: If a mouse touches it, the taking of it is destroyed.

original: byi mngas la sogs pa'i byi bdag gis reg pa ni byin len bya ste bza' bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: byi mngas la sogs pa'i byi bdag gis reg pa ni byin len bya ste bza' bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here is the text: “In this way, flies, ants, and mice fell into the begging bowl. The Blessed One said, ‘If a mouse or other such animal touches the begging bowl, the taking of it should be done again and it may be eaten.’🔽It is not improper to take again the taking of that which has been taken.

original: byin len byas pa'i byin len stobs pa ni mi rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni reg par ma gyur tam 'on te byin len byas pa ma yin snyam pa'i the tshom bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byin len byas pa'i byin len stobs pa ni mi rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni reg par ma gyur tam 'on te byin len byas pa ma yin snyam pa'i the tshom bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is said to remove doubt, thinking ‘It was not touched’ or ‘It was not taken.’

original: byin len byas pa la slar byin len byed pa ni rigs pa dang mi ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byin len byas pa la slar byin len byed pa ni rigs pa dang mi ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not improper to take again the taking of that which has been taken.

original: shes gtso bo zhes bya ba ni 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid do //
analyzed: shes gtso bo zhes bya ba ni 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid do //
translated: The term “predominant cognition” means that discernment is the predominant factor.

original: gang la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
translated: With regard to what is the predominant factor?

original: de'i phyir byin len ma bstan pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir byin len ma bstan pa nyid la'o //
translated: Therefore, it is with regard to the very act of not receiving.

original: chu dang so shing ma gtogs pa bza' bar bya ba'o 'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: chu dang so shing ma gtogs pa bza' bar bya ba'o 'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says, “except for water and tooth wood.”

original: chu dang so shing ma gtogs pa'i bza' bar bya ba la'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chu dang so shing ma gtogs pa'i bza' bar bya ba la'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is with regard to food that is not received, except for water and tooth wood.

original: 'dir chu dang so shing zhes bya ba smos pa ni dpe tsam du zas de kha sbyang ba'i tho rangs kyi chu dang ba'i lci skam dang lci ba dag kyang 'dis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir chu dang so shing zhes bya ba smos pa ni dpe tsam du zas de kha sbyang ba'i tho rangs kyi chu dang ba'i lci skam dang lci ba dag kyang 'dis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the mention of water and tooth wood is merely an example. One should understand that this refers to the water for rinsing the mouth in the morning and to the dry and moist khadira wood that is used for cleaning the teeth.

original: de yang kha sbyang ba'i zas kyi phyir so shing la 'di ni nyes pa med pa nyid yin gyi mgul du med pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang kha sbyang ba'i zas kyi phyir so shing la 'di ni nyes pa med pa nyid yin gyi mgul du med pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, this is not a fault with regard to tooth wood that is used for the purpose of food for rinsing the mouth, but it is not a fault if it is not around.

original: der byin len ma byas pa nyid mgul du mid pa la ni ltung byed kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der byin len ma byas pa nyid mgul du mid pa la ni ltung byed kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one eats food that is not received and is placed in the mouth, then there is an immediate offense.

original: mgul nas kha'i cha tha dad par gyur pas bza' ba gang yin pa'i de la ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang de'i phyir shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mgul nas kha'i cha tha dad par gyur pas bza' ba gang yin pa'i de la ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang de'i phyir shes par bya'o //
translated: And it should be understood that if it is food, then there is an offense refers to the case where the food is separated from the throat to the mouth.

original: gzugs dang mi ldan pa la yang blos bza' bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gzugs dang mi ldan pa la yang blos bza' bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Also, it is food if it is mentally consumed by one who is not embodied.

original: de ltar yang reg pa dang yid kyis kun du sems pa bza' ba nyid kyis mngon par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang reg pa dang yid kyis kun du sems pa bza' ba nyid kyis mngon par brjod pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is stated that contact and mental attention are food because of the consumption of food.

original: bza' ba yang gang zhig blo 'di rnams nye bar 'tsho bar byed pa de zhes bya ba nus par bya'o //
analyzed: bza' ba yang gang zhig blo 'di rnams nye bar 'tsho bar byed pa de zhes bya ba nus par bya'o //
translated: And it should be understood that food is that which nourishes these mental entities.

original: de bas na khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir khar ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de bas na khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir khar ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, in order to indicate the distinction, in the mouth is stated.

original: ji zhig rjes su bsgrub na 'di'i byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji zhig rjes su bsgrub na 'di'i byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
translated: If one asks, What is accomplished by this?

original: de'i phyir zos na'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir zos na'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it is stated, when it is eaten.

original: ci yul thams cad du'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci yul thams cad du'am zhe na /
translated: If one asks, Is it in all realms?

original: de'i phyir byang gi sgra mi snyan ma gtogs par ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang gi sgra mi snyan ma gtogs par ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is stated, except in Uttarakuru.

original: 'dir zhu ba las byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi gling na zas ma byin par kha'i sgo nas za bar byed de /
analyzed: 'dir zhu ba las byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi gling na zas ma byin par kha'i sgo nas za bar byed de /
translated: This is included in the statement in the ritual for going for refuge that in the northern continent of Kuru, one eats food with one's mouth without giving it to others.

original: gal te byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i dus su byin gyis brlabs na ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gal te byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i dus su byin gyis brlabs na ni ltung ba med do //
translated: If one consecrates it as belonging to the northern continent of Kuru, then there is no offense.

original: ji ste byin gyis mi rlob na ni nyes byas @226b so zhes gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba de 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ste byin gyis mi rlob na ni nyes byas @226b so zhes gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba de 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: If one does not consecrate it, then there is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If a sick person is not fully ordained, then one should receive food in the mouth of a fully ordained person.

original: nad pas bsnyen par rdzogs pa med na bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la zan mnod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nad pa'i khar zan mnod pa la 'di yin gyi rjes su gnang ba'i dngos po la ni de bsnyen par rdzogs pa la gnang ba ma yin pas
analyzed: nad pas bsnyen par rdzogs pa med na bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la zan mnod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nad pa'i khar zan mnod pa la 'di yin gyi rjes su gnang ba'i dngos po la ni de bsnyen par rdzogs pa la gnang ba ma yin pas
translated: This refers to receiving food in the mouth of a sick person, but it is not permitted for one who is not fully ordained to receive a gift.

original: btang ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir 'di mi bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: btang ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir 'di mi bya ba nyid do //
translated: Since it is not given, it is not to be done.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas bza' bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas bza' bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one is not fully ordained, one should eat it.

original: nad pa kho na ste gtong bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir 'di mi bya ba shes par mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nad pa kho na ste gtong bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir 'di mi bya ba shes par mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is only the sick who are allowed to do it. The meaning is that one should not understand that this is not to be done.

original: 'dir gzhung ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nyal ba'i ltung byed kyi cho ga gnyis bo dag go //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nyal ba'i ltung byed kyi cho ga gnyis bo dag go //
translated: Here the text is the two rituals of the offense of lying down together with one who is not fully ordained.

original: byin len ma byas par za ba'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: byin len ma byas par za ba'i ltung byed do /
translated: The offense of eating without having received it.

original: // /'o ma dang zho dang mar dang nya sha dang sha skam lta bu ni kha zas bsod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam pa de lta bu dag ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: // /'o ma dang zho dang mar dang nya sha dang sha skam lta bu ni kha zas bsod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam pa de lta bu dag ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Milk, yogurt, butter, fish, and meat are good food. The meaning is that they are of that kind.

original: de ni byed pa po'o zhes bya ba la 'di ni zas bsod pa ste /
analyzed: de ni byed pa po'o zhes bya ba la 'di ni zas bsod pa ste /
translated: He is the agent. This is good food.

original: de ni ltung ba 'di'i byed pa po yin no //
analyzed: de ni ltung ba 'di'i byed pa po yin no //
translated: He is the agent of this offense.

original: sbyin par byed pa nye dum yin pa khyim pa nyid kyang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyin par byed pa nye dum yin pa khyim pa nyid kyang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: The giver is a relative, and also a layperson.

original: nye dur ma gyur pa'i khyim pa ni nye du ma yin pa'i khyim pa ste de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: nye dur ma gyur pa'i khyim pa ni nye du ma yin pa'i khyim pa ste de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: A layperson who is not a relative is a non-relative layperson. That is its nature.

original: 'dir sbyin pa po'i byed pa po gzhan grogs su gyur pa ni zas bsod pa 'di la'o //
analyzed: 'dir sbyin pa po'i byed pa po gzhan grogs su gyur pa ni zas bsod pa 'di la'o //
translated: Here, the other person who is the agent of the giving is the helper.

original: nye du ma yin pa zhes smos pa la /
analyzed: nye du ma yin pa zhes smos pa la /
translated: The text says “not a relative,”

original: gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa dge slong gis bro ma 'chal bar bdag nyid kyis slad du khyim dag nas zas bsod pa blangs ta 'cha' 'am 'cha' ba la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba mchis sam yod de nye du las blangs te za na ltung ba🔽med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa dge slong gis bro ma 'chal bar bdag nyid kyis slad du khyim dag nas zas bsod pa blangs ta 'cha' 'am 'cha' ba la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba mchis sam yod de nye du las blangs te za na ltung ba med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: and the question is, “Venerable, is there a case where a monk who is not sick does not commit an offense when he himself asks for and eats good food in families?🔽” The answer is, “There is no offense if he eats it after receiving it from a relative.”

original: rab tu byung ba gang la nyes byas byed pa nyid ma yin pa nyid ltung ba'i rtags 'di yin zhes bya ba 'dir khyim pa'i tshig gis 'di 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba gang la nyes byas byed pa nyid ma yin pa nyid ltung ba'i rtags 'di yin zhes bya ba 'dir khyim pa'i tshig gis 'di 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the sign of an offense for one who is ordained, but not for a layperson.

original: gang gi tshe de gnyis ltung ba 'di la byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de gnyis ltung ba 'di la byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
translated: When are these two the agent of this offense?

original: de'i phyir rang gis blangs te zos na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gis blangs te zos na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “if he eats it after receiving it himself.”

original: rang gis blangs te zos na'o //
analyzed: rang gis blangs te zos na'o //
translated: If he eats it after receiving it himself.

original: mi na bas blangs pa dang slong du bcug pa nyid de la nyes byas kyi'o zhes bya ba ni mi na bas rang gis blangs pa tsam la yang de gnyis nyes byas kho na'i byed pa po yin la mi na bar gzhan slong du bcug pa nyid yin
analyzed: mi na bas blangs pa dang slong du bcug pa nyid de la nyes byas kyi'o zhes bya ba ni mi na bas rang gis blangs pa tsam la yang de gnyis nyes byas kho na'i byed pa po yin la mi na bar gzhan slong du bcug pa nyid yin
translated: If one who is not sick merely receives it oneself, then both are only agents of wrong conduct. If one who is not sick causes another to request it,

original: na slong du bcug te zos pa de la ni de gnyis nyes byas kyi byed pa po yin no //
analyzed: na slong du bcug te zos pa de la ni de gnyis nyes byas kyi byed pa po yin no //
translated: then both are agents of wrong conduct who eat after requesting it.

original: mi na bar slong du bcug pa la ni nyes byas phra mor 'gyur ro //🔽ci min bar thams cad la de gnyis kha na ma tho ba 'di'i @227a * //
analyzed: mi na bar slong du bcug pa la ni nyes byas phra mor 'gyur ro // ci min bar thams cad la de gnyis kha na ma tho ba 'di'i @227a * //
translated: If one who is not sick causes another to request it, then it is a minor offense.

original: byed pa po yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: byed pa po yin nam zhe na /
translated: Do both become agents of this misdeed in all cases of not being sick?

original: de'i phyir ci bder bstabs pa ma byas pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ci bder bstabs pa ma byas pa la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore the text says, “If one does not offer it as much as one likes.”

original: gang la slong bar byed pa des ma byas pa des ni ci bder bstabs pa ma byas pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang la slong bar byed pa des ma byas pa des ni ci bder bstabs pa ma byas pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one does not offer it as much as one likes to one who requests it, then one does not offer it as much as one likes.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong bsong snyoms la rgyu zhing khyim dag tu 'gro ba na bud med kyi yul zas thogs te phyir byung ba'i tshe dge slong cang mi smra bar sdod pa na bud med kyi yul na re 'phags pa ci bzhed ces 'dri na bstabs par
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong bsong snyoms la rgyu zhing khyim dag tu 'gro ba na bud med kyi yul zas thogs te phyir byung ba'i tshe dge slong cang mi smra bar sdod pa na bud med kyi yul na re 'phags pa ci bzhed ces 'dri na bstabs par
translated: Here, the text states:🔽When a monk who is begging for alms goes to a house, if a woman comes out holding food, the monk should remain silent.

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: If the woman asks, “Noble one, what do you want?” he should say, “Give me whatever you like.”

original: ci 'dod pa de blang bar bya ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ci 'dod pa de blang bar bya ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if he accepts whatever he wants.

original: sbyin bdag gis ci bder byas pa la ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin bdag gis ci bder byas pa la ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: There is no offense if the donor gives whatever she likes.🔽Therefore, if he accepts whatever he obtains, whether it is bad, good, ordinary, or excellent, there is no offense.

original: de'i phyir ngan pa'am bsod pa'am tha mal pa'am bzang po thob pa ni gal te blangs na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ci bder bstabs pa ma byas pa la 'di ni byed pa po yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ngan pa'am bsod pa'am tha mal pa'am bzang po thob pa ni gal te blangs na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ci bder bstabs pa ma byas pa la 'di ni byed pa po yin te /
translated: This is because if he does not accept whatever is offered, he is the one who does not act.

original: ci bder bstabs par byed pa cig ni 'dir nges par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: ci bder bstabs par byed pa cig ni 'dir nges par 'byung ba ste /
translated: Here, the one who acts is the one who accepts whatever is offered.

original: nye bar bsdus pa la byed pa po ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar bsdus pa la byed pa po ma yin no //
translated: He is not the one who acts in the summary.

original: de las rnyed par gyur pa la yang gal te 'di dang 'brel pa'i blangs pa med na de ltar yang 'di blangs te zos na dngos gzhi'i byed pa po yin no //🔽ngan pa 'di la phyed nyid do zhes bya ba ni gang zhig blangs te za ba 'di la byed pa po nyid bstan pa der ngan pa 'di la ni phyed nyid de nyes byas so //
analyzed: de las rnyed par gyur pa la yang gal te 'di dang 'brel pa'i blangs pa med na de ltar yang 'di blangs te zos na dngos gzhi'i byed pa po yin no // ngan pa 'di la phyed nyid do zhes bya ba ni gang zhig blangs te za ba 'di la byed pa po nyid bstan pa der ngan pa 'di la ni phyed nyid de nyes byas so //
translated: If one obtains it from that person, but does not request it, and then eats it, one is the actual perpetrator.🔽In this bad case, it is half,🔽means that in this case of eating after requesting, the actual perpetrator is shown. In this bad case, it is half, meaning it is a minor offense.

original: rang gis blangs te za ba 'di la ni nyes byas phra mor 'gyur te slong du bcug pa'i sbyor ba la yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gis blangs te za ba 'di la ni nyes byas phra mor 'gyur te slong du bcug pa'i sbyor ba la yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In this case of eating after requesting, it becomes a minor offense, meaning it is the preparation of requesting.

original: 'dir gzhur ni dge slong gis 'o ma thob pa na zho slong par byed na /
analyzed: 'dir gzhur ni dge slong gis 'o ma thob pa na zho slong par byed na /
translated: Here, in the Vinaya, if a monk obtains milk and requests yogurt,

original: de slong ba la ni nyes byas lam 'thungs na ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de slong ba la ni nyes byas lam 'thungs na ni ltung ba med do //
translated: there is a minor offense in requesting it, but no offense in drinking it.

original: dge slong gis bsod pa thob pa na ngan pa slong bar byed na de slong ba la yang nyes byas la zos par gyur na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gis bsod pa thob pa na ngan pa slong bar byed na de slong ba la yang nyes byas la zos par gyur na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If a monk obtains good food and requests bad food, there is a minor offense in requesting it, and if he eats it, there is a minor offense.

original: ngan pa thob par gyur pa nyid la ni thams cad nyes byas kyi byed pa po nyid yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni phyed tshig gis 'di la byas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ngan pa thob par gyur pa nyid la ni thams cad nyes byas kyi byed pa po nyid yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni phyed tshig gis 'di la byas par rig par bya'o //
translated: But if the bad food is obtained, then all are guilty of the act of wrongdoing. This is understood by the half-verse.

original: zas khyer te phyis byung bas cang mi sma ba'am phyir spong ba la 'on ci slong zhes dris pa na ci bde bar bstabs pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni dris pa 'di la ci bde bar bstabs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: zas khyer te phyis byung bas cang mi sma ba'am phyir spong ba la 'on ci slong zhes dris pa na ci bde bar bstabs pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni dris pa 'di la ci bde bar bstabs pa nyid yin no //
translated: If the food is brought later, and the monk does not say anything, or if he rejects it, then when asked, “What is to be done with it?” he should say, “Give it to whoever brought it.”

original: de bas na 'dir byis pa las gang 'dod pa de blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir byis pa las gang 'dod pa de blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in this case, the child should take whatever he wants.

original: bsod pa slong ba'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: bsod pa slong ba'i ltung byed do /
translated: This is a downfall created by desire.

original: // / rang sbyong ba'i don nyid la 'jug pa dang spyod du 'jug pa dag la'o zhes bya ba ni 'di dag la gzhan nye bar spyod @227b pa'i don nyid la ste /
analyzed: // / rang sbyong ba'i don nyid la 'jug pa dang spyod du 'jug pa dag la'o zhes bya ba ni 'di dag la gzhan nye bar spyod @227b pa'i don nyid la ste /
translated: “In the sense of using oneself and making others use” means that these are downfalls in the sense of using oneself and making others use the goods of the community.

original: dper na dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang du lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pa'i las la don ma yin pa nyid la yang ngo //
analyzed: dper na dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang du lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pa'i las la don ma yin pa nyid la yang ngo //
translated: For example, in the case of the goods of the community, such as begging bowls and robes, in the monastery, it is not right to use them for one’s own purposes.

original: 'di lta ste dper na don med par chu la sogs pa la spyod pa dang / rtsva la sogs pa sbengs pa dang shing la sogs pa 'thu ba la sogs pa la sngar bstan pa'i ltung byed ni byed pa po nyid do //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na don med par chu la sogs pa la spyod pa dang / rtsva la sogs pa sbengs pa dang shing la sogs pa 'thu ba la sogs pa la sngar bstan pa'i ltung byed ni byed pa po nyid do //
translated: For example, it is like the previous downfalls of using water, etc. without a purpose, or of gathering grass, etc. and cutting wood, etc.

original: gang la rang 'jug pa dang gzhan 'jug du 'dzud par byed na rang spyad pa'i don nyid la yang smras pa ni de la shes gtso bo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang la rang 'jug pa dang gzhan 'jug du 'dzud par byed na rang spyad pa'i don nyid la yang smras pa ni de la shes gtso bo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: When one engages in it oneself and causes others to engage in it, it is said to be the meaning of one's own practice.

original: de la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa nyid do //
translated: In that case, it is the one who makes perception primary.

original: gang la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po 'di yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po 'di yin zhe na /
translated: What is the one who makes perception primary?

original: de'i phyir srog chags dang bcas pa nyid pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir srog chags dang bcas pa nyid pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be the one who has life.

original: gang gi srog chags dang bcas pa nyid la zhe na de'i phyir chu dang mar dang sbrang rtsi dang bu ram gyi dbu ba dang 'o ma dang zho dang mar sar pa dang tshva dang 'bru'i tsha dang zho ga chu dang / rtsa ba mo dang shing tog dang bca' bar bya ba la sogs pa nye bar sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /🔽srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la zhes bya ba la /🔽chu'i tshig ni so sor thar par dper mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi 'di ni skye ba'i dbang gis gnas yin te /
analyzed: gang gi srog chags dang bcas pa nyid la zhe na de'i phyir chu dang mar dang sbrang rtsi dang bu ram gyi dbu ba dang 'o ma dang zho dang mar sar pa dang tshva dang 'bru'i tsha dang zho ga chu dang / rtsa ba mo dang shing tog dang bca' bar bya ba la sogs pa nye bar sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba smos te / srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la zhes bya ba la / chu'i tshig ni so sor thar par dper mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi 'di ni skye ba'i dbang gis gnas yin te /
translated: the root text states, “One should apply water, butter, honey, molasses, milk, curd, fresh butter, salt, grain beer, whey, and root, fruit, and cooked vegetables.”🔽The phrase “water that contains life” is an example of the term “water” in the Prātimokṣa Sūtra.

original: chu 'di la shin tu mang du 'jug pa 'di la ltung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu 'di la shin tu mang du 'jug pa 'di la ltung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “water” refers to any substance that is used for drinking and that is derived from a source that is subject to contamination by living organisms.

original: nye bar sbyar ba de dag srog chags ji lta bu dang bcas pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar sbyar ba de dag srog chags ji lta bu dang bcas pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: What kind of living organisms are present in these substances?

original: de'i phyir snang ba dag gis so zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir snang ba dag gis so zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The root text states, “By means of a strainer.”

original: 'dir gang gi tshe 'di'i byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir gang gi tshe 'di'i byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
translated: If one asks, “What is the agent of this action?”

original: de'i phyir shi na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir shi na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “if they die.”

original: 'dir srog chags du ma shi na yang kha na ma tho ba gcig gi byed pa po nyid yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir srog chags du ma shi na yang kha na ma tho ba gcig gi byed pa po nyid yin nam zhe na /
translated: Here, if many living beings die, is one the perpetrator of one offense of wrongdoing?

original: de'i phyir srog chags re re'i 'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir srog chags re re'i 'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “for each living being.”

original: srog chags ji snyed sbyor ba de'i dbang gis srog bcad de dus byas na de nyid kho na'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: srog chags ji snyed sbyor ba de'i dbang gis srog bcad de dus byas na de nyid kho na'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If as many living beings as are involved in the act of killing die because of it, then that is the offense of wrongdoing.

original: slar spyod pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: slar spyod pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the act of using?

original: de'i phyir spyod pa na lus kyi nye bar spyod pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir spyod pa na lus kyi nye bar spyod pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “when using, it is the use of the body.”

original: de ni spyad pa mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas bstan nas /
analyzed: de ni spyad pa mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas bstan nas /
translated: That is taught from the perspective of the characteristics of the act.

original: da ni ngo bo'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni ngo bo'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach from the perspective of the nature of the act,

original: 'di lta ste khrus dang btung ba dang so shing dor ba dang lag pa dang rkang pa bkru ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste khrus dang btung ba dang so shing dor ba dang lag pa dang rkang pa bkru ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said, “for example, bathing, drinking, spitting out water, and washing the hands and feet.”

original: lus kyi yo byad dag tu nye bar spyod pa gang yin pa de lus kyis nye bar sbyong ba kho na yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i phyir yo byad dag tu nye bar spyad pa gang yin pa de ni lus kyir yin no zhes bya ba🔽smos te / @228a * //
analyzed: lus kyi yo byad dag tu nye bar spyod pa gang yin pa de lus kyis nye bar sbyong ba kho na yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i phyir yo byad dag tu nye bar spyad pa gang yin pa de ni lus kyir yin no zhes bya ba smos te / @228a * //
translated: The enjoyment of the necessities of the body is the enjoyment of the necessities of the body alone.

original: gang gi yan lag tu gang byed pa de nyid la de byas par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi yan lag tu gang byed pa de nyid la de byas par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that whatever is done as a branch of something is done in that.
